Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: threegirls4me
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at this hotel for one night, after a cruise, but we were really very happy with it. The room was clean and had a beautiful patio on the same level as the pool. There was a Murphy bed that was big enough for our 2 girls to share. Loved the modern bathroom as well. Very convenient to restaurants, and there was a supermarket right across the street. Everyone at the hotel was very helpful. Taxis were easy to get. And let's not forget the amazing warm chocolate chip cookies! Also very impressive, we took a taxi from the hotel to Old San Juan, and my daughter left her iphone in the taxi. The taxi driver was kind enough to go back to the hotel and leave it there for us, and the people at the hotel were good enough to give him a cash tip as we requested and just added the money to our bill.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean great location”
Reviews.Author: nsexplorer
Reviews.Content: This was a great location within walking distance to the beach. The rooms are clean and the warm cookie upon check-in was a nice touch if you have a sweet tooth :). There is a great supermarket directly across the street if you like to make your own food or simply want some variety. There are some great local restaurants within walking distance and they have sister resorts on the beach which allow you to use the facilities. For those who simply like to relax in peace and quiet, they have a small atrium with hot-tub and pool area which is a great place to just chill out and read. The bathrooms are small and completely glass. While we liked the uniqueness of them, I prefer a real bathroom with walls and a door because you feel like you're showering in the same room as all the people you are travelling with. We also stayed at the Caribe Hilton for roughly the same price and preferred it over the doubletree if you are staying in San Juan for an extended stay. This is however a great business travelers hotel and is highly recommended. Staff was extremely professional and helpful also!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, clean, convenient, superb service”
Reviews.Author: BigSaver
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. I stayed here for a weekend on Hilton Honors points, will remain here for upcoming week on business. Room very modern, new, very well-designed. Lots of outlets, counter space, desk space. Furniture has wheels so you can easily move chairs & side tables as needed. Bathroom small but more than adequate for 1 person. Lovely modern shower with good water pressure. Very very clean. Hotel staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Hotel restaurant, Cafe Pierre, has reasonable prices for San Juan. Nice breakfast buffet for $15. Great for filling up for a day of walking. Also ate dinner at "Under the Trees" next door; Again, very reasonable prices for San Juan. Within easy walking distance (1/4 mile) from Museum of Puerto Rico. Took a bus to Old San Juan. If I return to San Juan, this is where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Disneylovers
Reviews.Content: Very upscale and modern hotel just outside of the Condado beach resort area but well within walking distance. There was a 24-hour grocery store across the street, and all day/night local diner was around the corner as well. Bus transportation was inconsistent, so we ended up taking a taxi in/out of Old San Juan ($15 each way); you could walk to Old SJ, but it would be a trek. We were there during Easter, so the front desk folks found us a Catholic Church in Condado that was holding services in English - awesome. The best perk: warm chocolate chip cookies await you everytime you pass the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: hopper1
Reviews.Content: Although not on the beach, the hotel partners with a beach front property that's a casual 15 minute walk away. The beach front hotel is very accommodating to Doubletree guests, you never feel like an outsider! The walk is mostly along a street lined with restaurants and shops, and we would usually stop for a drink or snack on the way back to the hotel. The Doubletree is also within walking distance of many very good restaurants, and we always felt safe walking to them at night. Staff was very friendly and very helpful at every request, and we were particularly pleased with the breakfast staff, chefs, and food choices. Great value for a four day weekend getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: KSterling
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Double Tree on a government rate (175), so it was a good value compared to other hotels of equal rating in the area on a short notice. It is a good 10 minute walk to Condando beach and the main "strip". There is a 24 hour grocery store across the street which we utilized a few times. We stayed in two different rooms there (due to extending our stay because of work). The first room was VERY tiny. Two people and 4 bags of luggage do not fit well in it. The second room, they had to put us in a smoking room by the pool because they were overbooked. These rooms are HUGE and I overlooked the smell of smoke because of it (the staff offered to use a machine that would remove the smell, but I was exhausted from hiking and didnt want to vacate for an hour to use the machine). The only small complaint I had about the hotel is roomservice trays will stay in the same spot in the halls for more than a day. Also we ordered roomservice once and they forgot half our order and then re-charged us the delivery fee for bringing up the remaining items, then it took 20 minutes at check out to get it removed. The doors are also paper thin and housekeeping will wake you up in the morning chitchatting with each other. Little tidbit that isnt advertised very well there: they have self serve washers and dryers behind the showers at the pool!!!!! The staff at the Doubletree for the most part is very helpful and nice. The "tree" restaurant next door is great too! Biggest avacados I've ever seen in my life :-)

Reviews.Title: “A modern, clean, well located, bargain.”
Reviews.Author: Eric L
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it was midway between the cruise ship pier and the airport and it was inexpensive and had excellent reviews. What a nice place - modern, clean, nice pool, friendly people. I am an extensive traveler and have paid much more for much less. A terrific find!

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree did not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: Pete C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree, San Juan for two nights before a cruise. I had done a lot of research before choosing this location and I am extremely pleased that we decided to stay there. Every member of the staff who we met was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The management obviously has a lot on the ball. Our Queen room was very clean and nicely decorated. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom area was really nice. The pool area was also very nice. No one questioned us when we brought some beer out to the pool that we had purchased over at the market across the street. The prices at the bar and restaurant in the hotel were quite high. This hotel is not located near the beach. The neighborhood is city and somewhat older but we always felt very safe walking around even after dark. We enjoyed reasonably good PR cuisine (dinner and breakfast) a very short walk away at Bebo's Cafe around the corner. The remarks you'll read about slow service are accurate. We also enjoyed dinner one evening at Fleria Greek Restaurant which was about 2 blocks further than Bebo's. Tiny place. The owner presented the bill of fare on a white board explaining each item to us. The meal was terrific and the pricing was quite reasonable. I recommend both places. We were interested in seeing El Yunque, the rain forest. We booked the tour through the hotel front desk. $20 deposit and the balance to the tour guide in the morning. No question that we were a little worried about how this might turn out. However, the tour through E&B Tours and transportation was really good. Our guide, Joey was knowledgeable and well-spoken. We stopped along the road on the way back and had a light lunch at a local place. Nothing special but it wasn't too bad. The beer was ice cold! Everyone on the tour agreed that it was a good value. After we boarded the ship, my wife and I went back over to Old San Juan. This is a really beautiful area. Historical with lots to see. The hills will give you a workout!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: DawnDuBois
Reviews.Content: Stayed her the first 2 nights we spent in San Juan! I am IN LOVE with this place! I LOVE the modern, crips clean decorum. the bathrooms are sooooo cool! Designed cleverly! The bathroom fixtures, hardware etc..high class, quality! LOve the drk wood ladder in bathroom w/ blowdryer in bag and stainless steel accents every where and pool robe hanging on it! The lrg marble shelf prolly designed for safety in front of lrg windows, yet soooooo functional for more places to unpack. Loved the modern thermostat to control AC temp and wait can't forget the DElicious Amazing cookies! the sheets were so soft and I couldn't believe ALL the pillows! LEts not forget OUtlets Everywhere ya need em! And extra lighting everywhere as well!! I didn't want to leave my room. Thanks also to the VERY nice staff at front Desk! BTW the phone in the room actually works! Plus they have computer hook-up! pools and fitness room also nice. And I loved being able to wash my OWN laundry! thanks for wonderful sleep! Loved the brkfst buffet as well!

Reviews.Title: “Staff went above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: etruman
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 5 nights here. It was the perfect location, and had the amenities we needed. The new, modern bathroom was very luxurious. The rooms were comfortable, and the pool facilities adequate. The fitness center looked very nice, but we didn't use it. We had an emergency late on a weekend night, and the staff really came through. They helped with both medical and language issues, and the 3 management staff on duty quickly banded together as a team. They provided great support and helped us through a potentially frightening situation. People who like to walk can get to the Condado area easily from the hotel, and there are 2 bus lines that stop right by the hotel. We took buses several times, and while they can be erratic, we only had one long wait. And, hey - you're on vacation anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for a Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jeri C
Reviews.Content: We had planned to be on a cruise for Spring Break (my husband, and two daughters 17 and 20), but Princess cancelled at the last minute and we were scheduled to fly out to San Juan the next day. I scrambled to find a hotel (2 rooms for the four of us) and landed at the Doubletree. It was a great find. The staff was extemely friendly and helpful, and the property was clean and comfortable. The staff helped us with rental car arrangements, restaurant recommendations, and basically anything we needed. At a cost of half per room of what it would have been to stay at one of the resorts on the beach, this was an outstanding value. We took advantage of the shared facilities of both LaConcha and the Marriott, and found both properties to be great places to spend the day. The hotel was in a good location. We walked to restaurants, the Art Museum (which I would recommend), the beach, and the grocery store (right across the street). We took a cab to Old San Juan ($15) and rented a car for three days. We had a great time in San Juan and would be very happy to come back again and stay at the Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “OK, not great”
Reviews.Author: ChuckLu
Reviews.Content: The interior (i.e. room) was OK but not great, shower poorly designed (water flooding the floor), and hot water pressure was pretty weak. The room itself is comfortable and well designed, though I had ongoing problems with the internet connection. Location is also so-so itâ€™s not a beach front property and itâ€™s not located walking distance from the old town. ($15, 10 min, taxi ride). Still in a reasonable area and not far from the beach. I felt that for $180/night it was a little over priced though I didnâ€™t do a thorough research around. So the bottom line is, if you are looking for an OK hotel in that area it cuts this threshold, but donâ€™t expect a â€œwowâ€� property

Reviews.Title: “Overall great hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Mahdego
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel even though I only got to stay one night. I found the staff to be very helpful and engaging. For instance, the maids always greeted me at my floor even though they were cleaning other rooms. The concierge at the front desk was also helpful and friendly and even held my bags while I went and explored the city before my flight. The campus was clean and I always felt safe even walking around late at night. There are several things to do around the area (restaurants, clubs/bars, beach/pool) or you can travel to OSJ (I chose to get on a bus and it was fairly easy). For my first time in PR, I did have a good time and feel as though if I were to return and did not go for a resort that this hotel would be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel, close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: oselarm
Reviews.Content: Supwr friendly staff. Hotel is close to allot of San Juan atractions, musr vist the Puerto Rico Art musuem. The pool area is nice and very tropical.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: FREDERIK D
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in PR and the staff at the hotel gave me great advice and assistance to get to my meetings and how to spend a good time with my little freetime. Will defenitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel, but no resort”
Reviews.Author: LarryJAX
Reviews.Content: Read all reviews before selecting. Most reviews were accurate. Hotel is 1/2 mile walk to beach and they will give you letter to use La Concha Resort on beach. No shuttle and taxi ride is would be $20-25 round trip. I knew this before I selected this hotel. I more interested in getting a clean hotel, good beds and car self-parking. I used this hotel as place to sleep, because most of time I was out touring the Island. There is so much to see in Puerto Rico. You rain forest, beautiful islands and beaches, and Forts in Old San Juan. I am not one to sit around the resort. I visited La Concha on beach, and I did not like this place. It did not feel like resort, more like dentist office with a small pool and just few chairs (little privacy/no trees, you look up all you see 100+ room looking directly down on pool). Down a few blocks was Marriot on Beach; now, this place seemed like a real family resort, big pool and lots of chairs. If I was resort type I would check out Marriot or Caribi Hilton. Doutbletree Service was okay, but not very friendly. Mostly desk clerks that are only interested in check you in & out. So don't expect to find hotel concierges waiting to answer your questions and make dinning recommendations. If stay at Doubletree in San Juan your on you own. Do your research on restaurants and attractions before you go to Puerto Rico. Site called "Puerto Rico Day Trips" is very good. Doubletree rooms were clean, but as other have said bathrooms are strange. As other have commented, I found the frosted door a bit strange. Although, I thought the frosted door was sufficient enough for privacy, but other are right you see shadow movements. My problem was shower area is so tight and door opens into the shower, not out; so stubbed my toe trying get arround the door and out of shower area. Door to Shower should open out, not in. Self-Parking was $15 day and valet was $20. I avoid valet parking to save a little money, time and tips. Self-parking was pretty easy, but I wish they would give you pass for whole stay, because you have to get each day's parking ticket validated by hotel desk. So each night when returning to the hotel, you have to get the front desk to validate (stamp) the parking ticket to give garage cashier when exit next day. Beds were comfortable and room was always clean. Murphy bed was also comfortable and will sleep two young children or one adult. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A Solid Doubletree Property”
Reviews.Author: pack-less
Reviews.Content: Disclaimer for my review: We did not want or need a beachfront resort hotel, we are walkers and explorers, we knew we would need to spend some money on taxis and we had a rental car. Here's the 1,2,3... Why you WILL like this hotel: 1. Rooms are nice and clean (I stayed in the shorter 3 story side with view of garden/pool area). Hotel grounds are nice too. 2. Service from all hotel staff is very good, pleasant, and efficient. 3. Often a cheaper option if you don't need or want a beach resort property, but still amenities you expect from a Hilton chain. Why you may NOT like this hotel (again, these were not important to us): 1. If you want beach, it's a 5 min walk to a local beach, not like a resort beach. The local beach is not overly attractive. 2. Sits in a residential area. Not many restaurant or bar options unless you walk 10 min or more. 3. Nearly everything you want to do or to see is a taxi ride or car rental drive. ($15 plus tip taxi ride to Old San Juan. )

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and hip”
Reviews.Author: globetrekr
Reviews.Content: I really liked the hotel. Very friend staff. They had also helped us book a kayak trip to the bio-luminescent bay which is actually the same price as booking directly. One of the hotel staff suggested that we eat at Bebo's which is really close. It was delicious Puerto Rican food - try the chicken stew. I loved the bathroom - Crabtree and Evelyn products and very hip. FYI, the shower has really great acoustics if you like to sing in the shower! I am giving this 4 stars since there is not much around the hotel. The beach is about 4-5 blocks away and it's not the best beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay (even for the germaphobe)”
Reviews.Author: SizzlingSkies
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel in a room with a king sized bed and a private patio area overlooking the pool. We were traveling with my parents-in-law and my sister-in-law (all of us adults) who stayed in a room with two beds (one being a Murphy bed) which also had its own private patio area overlooking the pool and had a connecting door to our room. This was the perfect set up for a family. We kept mentioning how the room with the two beds would work perfectly for a family with small children. The hotel was nice and, mind you, I am very very picky about hotels and am an extreme germaphobe, especially when it comes to hotels. The hotel was very nice and clean and the staff was very helpful and knowledgeable about what was around the hotel. The hotel is located right across the street from a grocery store, which was nice and is very close to the bus, which was nice. For only $0.75 per person one can easily jump on the bus and take it to Old San Juan and then take the bus directly back to the hotel. There are 3 restaurants right next to the hotel, but that being said, the Ashford Street, which has a multitude of restaurants and boutique stores is about a 15 minute walk from the hotel and this walk is slightly scary at nightfall. The cab ride to the hotel from the airport costs $15 plus a $2 gas surcharge plus $1 per bag. It was about the same price to the cruise ship pier. Overall, it was a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, inexpensive and clean choice for 2 nights pre-cruise...”
Reviews.Author: DiscoD27
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the hotel lobby (outdoor and indoor seating area was very nice). Outdoor pool area was nice to use after the beach to sit and relax but there were a few kids. Breakfast was served outside for only $10 per person - you get great coffee, OJ, eggs, so-so potatoes and toast with cream cheese, jam, etc. The supermarket across the street was so convenient and cheap! Large Fiji water for $1.75. Conveniently close to Tijuana's Mexican Restaurant and we found it safe to walk at night. Taxis are $20 each way just about anywhere you go. We took a taxi to Isla Verde and it was a really nice beach day :) I would stay there for 1 night pre or post cruise again. We got a deal and only paid $450 including tax for 2 nights and slept 3 people.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CRAFTY CRUISER
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights. The rooms are very nice and modern. The staff at this hotel are great and will do anything for you. The pool area and hot tub are perfect. The hotel is within walking distance of the beach and restaurants. Even after dark we felt safe walking here. Grocery store across the street is very handy and they let you bring your own drinks to the pool. When I return to San Juan I will be sure to stay here again. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Dnick09
Reviews.Content: My overall experience was good. The staff were hospitable and friendly. Willing to give advice of places to go and things to see. The rooms are quite small (especially with the the murphy bed pulled down) so more than 2 people staying in one isnt advisable unless you are very close. The hotel didnt have its own transportation service but there were always taxi drivers waiting. It was clean, tidy, and conviently placed to get anywhere in San Juan. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bhighley
Reviews.Content: Very convinient locations and friendly staff. Bar food was good as was the happy hour from 5-7 each night! My room wasn't very well kept, but not sure it's a reflection of the whole property which was clean and well maintained. Service in the restaurant was good. There are a lot of people service a very small place though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean”
Reviews.Author: rossq
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night post cruise and were looking for a nice, clean modern facility without the high prices that come attached to the beachside hotels. Well we found the right place with the Doubletree and its friendly and accommodating staff. They supplied a couple of complementary water bottles which was a nice touch. The room had a modern almost chic feel to it with the modern furnishings and nicely appointed bathroom. We had a comfortable double bed and the room felt spacious especially after spending one week on the cruise ship. The bathroom didnâ€™t come with a bath but had a large shower area with great pressure and lots of hot water. The pool area is nicely laid out but we took advantage of the free visit to its sister property, the La Concha resort, which was directly on the beach and had three great pools. They supply you a letter to take with you and is a 15 minute walk away. You get complimentary beach chairs and umbrella and get to use all of their facilities for the day. It made for a very relaxing day on the beach. Once back at the Doubletree you can take advantage of the happy hour with its half priced beer and mojitos. Also across the street is large supermarket where basically all sorts of commodities are available. There were some comments from other reviewers about the surrounding area being iffy especially at night but my wife and myself walked around with no issues at all and weâ€™ve seen a lot worse in our travels. The hotel might not be beachside or Old Town but for the price, we got a special internet rate of $125, it cannot be beat. We would whole heartily recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: BeachBumDE
Reviews.Content: The front-desk staff is very friendly and efficient, though unfortunately the same cannot be said for the restaurant personnel. I enjoyed the nicely maintained outdoor pool and lounge areas. Our room was modern and sufficiently large, but the bathroom, though very stylish, did not afford much privacy. Located in a residential area, next to a large and convenient supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: jmc8683
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel within a great walking distance of Condado Beach! The rooms are clean and inviting. The staff is wonderful, welcoming and friendly. I look forward to my trip back to this hotel in November of this year!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: matm48
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. Very modern, nice decor and a terrific pool area. Also well situated in San Juan. I'd stay here again anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay...No Problems”
Reviews.Author: mauresa w
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I arrived late (just after midnight) due to a delayed flight. Check-in was easy and the girl at the desk was pleasant. We were given a free upgrade to a King bed with a patio leading out to the garden/pool area. It was very nice. The patio came in handy when we wanted to be in our room but still relax outside. We were given chocolate chip cookies at check in and they were sooo good. We bought some from the gift shop to take back home to the kids. Housekeeping was very prompt and on top of things. I accidently got sand all over the bathroom floor but they were able to clean it up without a trace left. The concierge guys were always helpful. We never had a problem getting a taxi to get wherever we wanted. They were very helpful when we needed ideas of things to do. The 24 hour grocery store across the street was great. We made multiple trips there. The beach was about 3 blocks away...walking distance. The only thing I would say that I didn't like about the room was the frosted glass bathroom door. Would like to have had a little more privacy in there. It was just me and my fiance so not such a big deal. But I probably would've been a little uncomfortable sharing that room with a friend. Overall the hotel was quiet and we were able to get decent sleep. Next time I would probably search for a hotel on the beach. If not, I would most likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and room”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: We just stayed one night after going to other islands. Very nice facility. We were pleasure travelers, but if you're travelling on business, this hotel has everything you need. The staff was very pleasant and accomodating. The pool area is nice. You can walk a couple of blocks to a great beach. There is a huge.24 hour supermarket across the street. It's a little pricey, but the facility is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet hotel with decent location”
Reviews.Author: Coloradotraveler14
Reviews.Content: Spent just one night at this hotel on a layover to another location. The rooms are nice and the Murphy bed was comfortable. Was concerned about the neighborhood based on other comments but went for a long walk in the evening on a Sunday night and never felt uncomfortable or scared. The grocery store across the street was a nice benefit. The service was great and they arranged a taxi across the Island and negotiated the price for us.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it's as good as they say.”
Reviews.Author: HREAM
Reviews.Content: TIP: Do NOT search for "De Diego" or "Calle De Diego" as your Hertz NeverLost GPS destination ... that will take you a different De Diego that's about 20 minutes south of this Doubletree. Trust me, it won't make for a great start to your vacation. If your GPS doesn't have the exact street address or POI, point it instead towards nearby streets like Calle Estrella or Calle Martin Travieso to get close. The front desk clerk was very friendly and upgraded us to a room that led directly out to the pool. Our room was nicely decorated and immaculately clean. Very sophisticated styling throughout including the bathroom. Location was easy to find via rental car and is even located across the street from a grocery store - so convenient. Valet was $20something but we found it worth the cost rather than risking frustration when trying to find the self parking option (which is NOT right there next to the hotel, that's a different parking garage). Biggest surprise was the continental breakfast (ours was complimentary due to Hilton Gold status). We weren't expecting much of anything other than grabbing a piece of fruit on our way out the door ... but honestly, they have a great spread! I loved the ham and cheese sandwich on griddled cinnamon bread, it sounds a bit crazy but tasted fantastic. The french toast was made with thick slices of french bread, which is just the way I like it. Fruit was as fresh as you can get and even the mini cheese danish was tasty. Especially if you get it for free, you should eat breakfast here! Very, very impressed with the Doubletree San Juan experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable home away from home”
Reviews.Author: luv2globetrot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice during our vacation to Puerto Rico on either side of a 2 night trip to Vieques. We stayed first for 6 nights while we explored the mainland, then one night at the end before our flight back home early in the morning. We highly enjoyed our stay here and were happy to get back â€œhomeâ€� to this hotel again after Vieques. As others have said, the location is not on the beach but about a 10 minute walk. It is about a 15 minute walk to the happening area of Ashford Ave with lots of bars and restaurants. This location suited us fine as we donâ€™t mind lots of walking and we are not huge beach-goers. About the only downside we could find with this hotel is that it is about 5 miles to the center of Old Town and a taxi costs $15. The bus is very cheap ($0.75-youâ€™ll need exact change) but doesnâ€™t seem to run very often (we waited about 20-30 minutes). The front desk told us to catch the bus across the street from the Shell station on the corner. This bus went out of it's way to the convention center (at the Sheraton Hotel) and took about 40 minutes. We later discovered you can take the number 5 bus into Old Town and save about 15 minutes. You catch this bus across the street from the hotel in front of the grocery store (not in front of the Shell station). We found the room to be very comfortable and quiet. We had a room with a queen bed with garden/pool view which also came with a murphy bed. The room was large and had plenty of storage space....lots of drawers and closet space for unpacking. They provided 2 bottles of water everyday which was a nice touch. Wi-fi was free (and fast). There was a mini-fridge, coffee and coffee maker, iron, ironing board, full-size hair dryer, safe, and mp3 player/clock radio. The bed and pillows were comfortable. Plenty of hot water in the shower. As some have noted, some of the rooms must slant a bit as the water from the shower will seep out into the main bathroom area. Our room during our second stay did not do this. The staff was always helpful and friendly and provided yummy chocolate cookies every night when we came back from our day out (another nice touch!) There is a fitness center with 4 treadmills, a couple of ellipticals and one bike and assorted dumbbells and other accessory equipment. We did not eat at any of the hotel restaurants so canâ€™t comment on that. We did not find out until the very last night of our trip about the arrangement they have with their â€œsisterâ€� hotel La Concha for use of their pool facilities and access to their beach. They will give you a letter to take with you. But apparently you have to ask about it (or maybe they just forgot to tell us upon check-in). Overall, we would highly recommend this hotel. It is not cheap (we paid $218 per night including tax -AAA rate), but there do not seem to be any comparable places that are cheap in San Juan. Yes, you can find a condo on VRBO or similar, or stay at a lower-end B&B or 3 stars-or-less hotel for less money. But for something this nice we found it to be a great choice! (tip: go for the AAA rate).

Reviews.Title: “What a WONDERFUL experience!”
Reviews.Author: SierraScott
Reviews.Content: Hopefully when you check in Pete will be on the desk! He made my stay absolutely incredible! He went WAY BEYOND the call of duty for me numerous times, but the incident that most impressed me was his willingness to make sure I found the location I was looking for. I wanted to eat in an AUTHENTIC restaurant. Not only did he tell me where to go, he actually WALKED me to the area to make sure I found it. In most hotels you're lucky if they point in the right direction, you're even luckier if they give you a map, but Pete went WELL BEYOND that by walking out the front door with me and showing me where the restaurant actually was. The rooms were beautiful, the service exquisite, and the hotel was clean and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Double good staff at Doubletree San Juan”
Reviews.Author: toomuchtravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here four nights while on business in San Juan. From the moment I approached the front desk at check-in until I requested a cab after check-out, I encountered some of the friendliest hotel staff I have ever met. This is something that adds a lot to a hotel stay, because they do everything possible to make your stay great - and with a smile. My room had a queen bed and a murphy bed, which I didn't need, but would be helpful if family was with me. The room was kind of small, but this is a city and space is valuable. The bed was very comfortable and the bedroom and bathroom were extremely clean. There was a good selection of channels on tv. The wireless internet service worked like a charm. Towels were plush and thirsty. The only complaint about the bathroom is how the shower floor and bathroom floor are at the same level and water can get out of the shower stall into the bathroom. I had to use a towel to mop it up. The courtyard, pool, hot tub, oversized chess board area was very nice. One of the best things is that the pool and hot tube are available 24 hours a day! The pool is very good sized and the hot tub was actually hot. Lots of chairs and lounges, even a couch and chairs conversation pit. Yes, there is a huge outdoor chessboard with almost life-size pieces. I ate breakfast each morning at the buffet - it was good and there is an omelet chef. For dinners, I went to area restaurants (Orozcos, Cafe del Angel - I will be writing reviews) to get more of the local flavor. It is about a 5-10 minute walk to the beach and they have free "beach kits" at the front desk, but I don't know what is in them. No, it's not directly on the beach, but it cost less to stay here. The few blocks around the hotel are iffy at night, but if you walk up the adjacent street to Ashford Avenue, you will be fine. At worst, take a cab up to the tourist area on Ashford. To sum it up, if you don't need to be on the beach and want to pay less than on the beach, this is a very good, reliable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but small”
Reviews.Author: TFS37
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with an attentive staff and clean, well appointed rooms. The rooms, however, are very small. We are seniors and I can say without a doubt, this was the smallest room I have ever stayed in. The bathroom had a frosted glass sliding door (the door had to slide as there wouldn't be enough room to open it otherwise (!), and the shower wall was glass block. If the light was turned on in the bathroom in the middle of the night, the whole room would be lit up. I am an early riser and my wife is not, and I felt I had no place to sit and read, and because of the size of the room, showering bgefore she was awake was out of the question.The bed was barely two feet from the bathroom wall. If you privacy or modesty issues, this could be a problem. Also, if you are a senior or have any difficulty walking distances, don't listen when people say it is a short walk to the sister hotel. It is a good twenty minute walk to La Concha, and the buses are very slow. We waited an average of 30 minutes EVERY time we used public transportation. Taxis are always available, but they run according to zones and are not metered. To cab to La Concha would cost $15!! Same to Old San Juan. If you are going to San Juan for the beaches, this is not the hotel for you, but is perfect for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Not so nice neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: TollerNB
Reviews.Content: I'd have given it an excellent rating if it was in a different location. Very nice hotel but the neighbourhood is a little scary, especially at night. Walking around the corner from the hotel is like walking into the twilight zone. Abandoned buildings iron bars on all the windows, lots of graffiti etc. The hotel complex is very nice. It seems to be part of a complex which has a couple of nice restaurants and a high-end condo development. There is a grocery store right across the street which is handy. Just around the corner is Bebo's restaurant which is apparently a local favorite. We ate there a few times. Some things we liked, some not. It wasn't a case of bad food, just very different from our usual menu. It's about a 5 block walk to the beach which is about a 5 on a scale of 1-10. Make sure you're back before dark (I'm not really sure how safe this area is, it just feels scary).

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: treddd
Reviews.Content: Wow... Staying at the Doubletree at the end of our PR trip (with a host of rather forgettable hotels) we realised how much a good hotel can really change your stay! Location was good (less than ten mins walk to the beach and to the restaurants on the 'resort strip' but imbued you with a slight sense of superiority not to actually be on the strip). The rooms were comfortable, the 24hr pool and hot tub were a godsend after a day walking about and on the beach and the 24hr store just across the road was dead convenient! This is everything you want from a hotel on a beach holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the San Juan Doubletree on De Diego Street”
Reviews.Author: imviolin
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Doubletree on De Diego in San Juan. The rooms were clean and nice, the restaurant breakfast was delicious with GREAT coffee! We didn't use the La Concha, as the pool area was perfect for our needs (we have stayed at La Concha before, and loved the beach but not the hotel). We appreciated the extra touches like the front desk's personal service and the hot chocolate chip cookie. Other pluses- the safe and fridge... & there is a grocery store across the street!

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kokue s
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, the rooms were very modern and fresh clean. Really centric and easy to get every where. From now on when i need to be in San Juan this where I am staying.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Scott_Gatherum
Reviews.Content: The reviews say it all. Stayed using Hilton points. Lots of business types (poor saps), so didn't feel like a resort, but the room is modern, breakfast was prompt and tasty, and most of all, the staff were wonderful (especially Courtney).

Reviews.Title: “No Privacy”
Reviews.Author: Traveling G
Reviews.Content: Very small and absolutely no privacy. Don't go here if your traveling with family. The doors to the bathroom are smoked glass but you can still see the image. It is also allows for sound to come through.Imagine taking a shower and having your children commenting that they can see and hear everything going on in there. I'm sorry but keep the the bathroom private. I'm in San Juan all the time and this is definitely not the best hotel to stay in!

Reviews.Title: “Fine choice for business travel.”
Reviews.Author: Springtraveler06
Reviews.Content: If you travel to San Juan for business, this is an outstanding choice. If you are hoping to experience the beach, nice pool, and convenient sightseeing of Old San Juan, it is not the best choice. Pros: easy access to major metro SJ highways, superb meeting facilities, beautiful and artfully furnished rooms, easy walk to the Museum of Art of PR and to Hacienda San Pedro Cafe, several casual and upscale restaurants & 24/7 supermarket. Cons: small pool (and unclean during our visit), a fair walk to the beach, an expensive taxi ride to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: mark G
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by how cleaned and how well kept the hotel was. The people were very nice and helpful. I was supposed to check in at 3:00pm, they let me check in at 10:45am. The hotel is near several beaches, stores and a bus line.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in Condado”
Reviews.Author: BirdBrain2011
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree by Hilton provided a clean, stylish stay for us in San Juan. There are many good restaurants nearby, and the beach is a short walk. Staff are very friendly and helpful; the bed is comfortable, and things are spotless. One downside was the cloudy pool.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel For Our visit”
Reviews.Author: Cullen M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights on our way to the Virgin Islands due to the way our flights worked out (prices). We scrambled 6 weeks ago to find a decent hotel that was close to Old San Juan but not too expensive...but also in a nice area. We arrived at the Doubletree in the Condado neighborhood and were very impressed with how clean and pleasant it was. Check-in was a breeze and we were at our room shortly. We had requested a room with a balcony and were surprised to learn that our balcony was on the ground floor with direct access to the pool. We were a little worried by this but it proved to be great, actually. The sliding glass door is nearly soundproof and the pool wasn't all that crowded. The pool area itself is beautiful, perfect lighting, great background music, a waterfall, and a great hot tub. This area would be great for hosting a gathering like a wedding or some other big event. The porch/patio has some bit of privacy from the pool, but it is not completely blocked off with a gate or anything...we had no problem with this, but if you want more privacy, this probably won't work for you. The accomodations are very nice and updated, very clean and fresh feeling. The bed was nice and big...and comfortable. The rooms include a flatscreen TV with basic cable, including one or two movie channels. There are a couple of restaurants on the premise which are great, plus the room service can't be beat! If you want to travel around without a car, there is a bus service which is actually just as nice as any continental U.S. bus system (air conditioned, smooth ride, etc). And for only 75 cents you can go all the way to Old San Juan. Taxis are also available. Additionally, there is a 24-hour grocery story across the street should you need anything the hotel cannot provide. We did not travel to the beach, but were told that Doubletree had a special deal with hotels on the beach allowing guests to use them. We were greatly impressed with the Doubletree in San Juan and we definitely plan to return to expore Puerto Rico more and will be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: mcbelleville
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights prior to cruising and were impressed with the front desk staff who were extremely helpful in recommending restaurants and answering our questions. They have a relationship with "La Concha" resort on Condado Beach that allows you to use their facilities that we took advantage of twice...beautiful resort with great amenities. The rooms were small, but adequate. One of the reviewers mentioned the limitations of counter space in the bathrooms which was a bit challenging. Breakfast buffet was adequate...overall a good value and good location.

Reviews.Title: “What happened to the DoubleTree...?”
Reviews.Author: restrapo
Reviews.Content: I'm not certain what happened to the DoubleTree since my last visit and review in September 2011. My visit to the DoubleTree this past weekend was simply average. * Room did not seem to be that clean. Even after maid "cleaned" the room, I picked up bottle top and other traces of untidiness from floor. Even the blinds were soiled. * The restuarnt, Pierre's Cafe, was mistaken-ridden on Sunday, February 19. I was not acknowledged for at least 8-10 minutes upon arriving. I then ordered the breakfast waffle. It took about 20 minutes for waffle to be served. The waffle was not edible. I had one bite and simply could not touch the cold waffle that reaked of cooking oil. * Front desk service was good but not all members of staff were as attentive as I recall previously. In short, sad to say, the hotel appears to have declined. I will not return to the DoubleTree on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: Cindy H
Reviews.Content: Perhaps my expectations were too high from the previous reviewers. I am not a person that is negative about the places I've stayed. I'm going to keep this short and sweet. The room was small but cute, carpet had stains. Location just OK in my opinion. Staff were friendly but I woulldn't say more so than other places I've stayed. I really don't understand how this place warrants the great reviews it is getting. It can be a good deal I guess if you book it the right way. I stayed two nights. It cost $330. I think I could have done so much better even for a little more money.Even the cookie that everyone raves about was only a so so cookie. We looked at a number of different places in different locations around San Juan and this place is definitely just middle of the road.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury accomodations for an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: dougyfrizzle
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a good location. Taxi's were readily available, only a couple blocks from beach and main road. Our air conditioner created a leak in the ceiling, but they were very quick to fix it. The warm cookies upon arrival are excellent. They do offer food & drink on property, but pricey. The pool area is large and very nice and the hot tub is decent size and very "hot" Would definitely stay here again. We stayed pre-cruise for 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: chill188
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and almost always stay in Hilton properties. You never know exactly what you are going to get but this hotel is great. The price is right and you get a lot for your money. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “DoubleTree in San Juan, Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Berthica
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing but special -- wonderful clean, modern facilities, great service, easy and convenient to other locales and to Old San Juan, and has great food (not to mention the warm cookies and Mojitos!). Most important of all is the attitude of the entire staff: it doesn't matter whether you stay for pleasure or business, the attentiveness and friendliness of the staff (all VERY bilingual) is notable from the moment you step onto the premises. There is a smile and a willingness to help that is never forced. I especially love MARGARITA and GENESIS, two of the front desk staff who never stop smiling and appear to be there just to make your stay as easy and pleasant as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond happy at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Fosforita
Reviews.Content: We can only say that this was one of the 2 best hotel experiences of our travels. Everyone, and I mean everyone of the staff made it their priority to make sure we were happy and comfortable. Bo Bramsen, the manager, responded to questions prior to our check-in and upgraded our room to one off the pool. The pool area was fantastic, peaceful and worth everything. The room was beautiful and the beds so comfortable. Go across the street to the supermarket and get provisions (including alcohol) and you can have everything to make your stay comfortable. We did have the breakfast buffet every day with made to order eggs, omelettes, and a vast variety of meats, cheeses, fruits, breads, etc. Coffee was available in the lobby until 10 am every morning. The staff at the front desk took care of everything - we needed large bills cashed, bandaids, water, more cookies, and they even found a pair of shoes left out on our room porch overnight. I can't say enough about these people. Taxis to casinos and other venues were about $10, to the airport about $18 (including bag charges). Only caveat, drinks at the beautiful bar were approx $10 each (but good drinks), and the food menu at the pool was high. If that's the worst you can say about a place, you really are in heaven. Although it is not on a beach, this hotel provides complimentary use of the amenities at 2 of their sister properties where there is a beach and casino. They even provide beach packages (towels, chairs, water, etc) to take with you. We truly thank Bo and the wonderful staff for the 3 nights we stayed. We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but well laid out. Couple of blocks from Condado strip.”
Reviews.Author: Izzie704
Reviews.Content: This hotel is new, clean and well-maintained. The rooms we had were small but well laid out. Staff friendly and helpful. Easy couple of blocks walk to Condado strip with good restaurants. Highly recommend. Pool lovely and open 24 hrs! Highly recommmend.

Reviews.Title: “All Around Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdventurousEve
Reviews.Content: This hotel was extremely clean, modern, and offered friendly service to my husband and I. The hotel rooms were much larger than expected. It is only a 5 min (2 block) walk to the beach area. There is a great local restaurant right around the block from the hotel. It is called Cafe Bebos. There is also a 24/7 Grocery Store across the street. It has everything a normal Grocery store in the states has. It was also very convenient that everyone spoke English. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: BeachManiacDotCom
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, helpful, smiling staff: Peter at desk, Robert the bellhop and Antonio at concierge desk were all wonderful. We stayed here on both ends of our cruise. If possible, get a room with a balcony by the pool/hottub courtyard area on the main level. Great for lounging or swimming (though it is a small-ish pool) or resting in the hot tub. This is a lovely courtyard where you can relax on your computer (wi-fi throughout the hotel) or just sun yourself. The hotel is not on the beach but is within walking distance (10 minutes) to Condado Beach. Also, the hotel has two "sister hotels" on the beach - La Concha on Condado Beach and the Marriott Courtyard on Isla Verde Beach. We visited both, and it is great to be able spend an afternoon at the beach and by the pool there even though we were staying at the Doubletree. Ask the helpful concierge desk about walking to Condado Beach, but basically you walk a few blocks down De Diego to Ashford. Turn right to the local park where you can access the beach. The day we were there, this was a quiet area of beach, apparently mostly for locals. But the sand is grainy and not soft on the feet. However, if you turn left instead of right when you get to Ashford from De Diego and walk a few blocks (15 minutes or so) to the hotel zone on Condado Beach, you will find the sand is soft and golden. However, the day we were there the waves were pretty strong, carrying in seaweed in spots, making this not the best swimming area on the island. However, there is a cove near Park La Ventana al Mar bordering the Renaissance La Concha Hotel (the Doubletree's sister hotel). There is a nice small protected beach behind the La Concha and alongside the park, which has a beautiful collection of Palm trees spread throughout the sandy soil. Be sure to walk out on cement pier that takes you across the beach for beautiful views of beaches to both the east and west. If you want to go to the Marriott Courtyard on Isla Verde, it is about a $15 cab ride, but it is a very nice hotel on a great beach location, with signature Marriott resort-style pool. The only downside here is that the airport runway is right behind the hotel, so be prepared for some screaming jet engine sounds while you're sitting by the pool. Overall, I highly recommend the Doubletree. Oh, also, there is a grocery store across the street, which was very convenient. I have posted more information and photos of Condado Beach and Isla Verde Beach on BeachManiac.com. And if you have time, be sure to visit Old San Juan (a $15 cab ride). It is way more interesting that the immediate area around the Doubletree (which is kind of blah). Old San Juan has very interesting the forts, shops, restaurants, etc., and take a walk along the promenade below the wall that surrounds the city (but beware that there apparently is no exit at the end so don't go too far, you have to walk back too.)

Reviews.Title: “Good location... Great Value... Beautiful Boutique like hotel..... Stayed at other hotels in area and none compared.”
Reviews.Author: Raymond A
Reviews.Content: Stayed 23 nights at this hotel. Room was very modern but not cold. Food was decent in resaurant... watched Superbowl in bar and enjoyed good specials. SuperMax grocery store across street allowed us to save $ on food and beverages for stay. Very clean and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great night stay”
Reviews.Author: ScPe
Reviews.Content: We had booked 2 nights in this hotel before leaving for a cruise but when we arrived to check in, we were told that they were overbooked and we'd have to move to a "sister" hotel for our first night. (We stayed at the La Concha nearby and the Doubletree paid for our cab ride to and from) When we came back the following day, we were upgraded to recognize our inconvenience. We were greeted with warm cookies and a fruit and cheese plate. The room was beautiful! The upgraded room is apparently different because it is next to the pool with a patio door. We made use of the ample fitness room and had a great breakfast the following morning. We would definitely stay again. (Hopefully it won't be double-booked again...)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay...near all”
Reviews.Author: RJGBklyn
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay. Beautiful hotel with great bathroom. Lobby is lovely with a various seating areas. Pool was large and clean. Hot cookies is a favorite treat from Doubletree! Walked 10 minutes to the Ashford Ave strip in Condado. I usually stay at Conrad Hilton. This is a quieter stay and will return. RJGBklyn

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place...”
Reviews.Author: XplorerMike
Reviews.Content: Traveling to San Juan was a first, and wanted a comfortable place to stay. I am so glad I chose the Doubletree. Below is my unbiased review of the property, surroundings, services. Duration 3 nights over weekend Getting to the hotel from the airport can be a little tricky especially if you miss the exit. But most exits come quickly so pay attention. With a GPS, you will make it there fine. Property: The Doubletree shares the corner block with two high rise condo...hence the parking will be shared as well (more on that in a bit). The hotel lobby area was very clean and staff were everywhere to help your every need. Very nice and welcoming. Upon entering the inside was modern and very comforting. However, the smaller front desk is not easily visible from the main entrance sliding door...but rather around the corner on the left then right. Check in was quick and easy. In less than 5-10 min I was up in my room. I was lucky to get on the 8th floor (top) facing the street...here you can get a partial view of ocean, grocery store, pool below, and other apartment buildings. The other side faces the condos and residential houses. Room: I got the single queen room...as I was traveling alone. It was very nice, professional looking, and comforting, but a little on the small size (maybe 12x20) - it didnt feel crammed though. The bed was extremely comfortable with 4 soft pillows, down comfortor, and thick padded headboard. Even the bed skirt was nice and clean. This room will accommodate any picky business traveler. Bathroom: This was modern as well, with LOTS of glass (doors, walls). The shower is all tile. Water pressure was good, hot water abundant. Everything was provided. Very nice. Side note: On the two of the nights, house keeping tends to forget something each day. On the first day, no face or medium towels (only 3 bath towels). Was provided at next cleaning. The next day, got missing towels, but forgot water (two complimentary bottled water) and coffee creamer. Minor details, but I am very observant and will note everything in my reviews. Facilities: The pool and hot tub are was nice...though I didn't use them, I took a little tour around the place. The landscape and layout and lighting was nice and soothing. The workout room was near in a separate room, with lots of equipment. Strange Observation: Every day as I was coming and going there seems to the homeless man in a wheelchair hanging around the front entrance and often in the bar/lounge. He didn't smell good...old urine smell. Every time, i've seen this person, the staff did nothing...and even saw the bar folks giving him drinks while having dinner at the on-premise restaurant. I really felt uncomfortable and don't feel this is a good visual to have to this caliber of hotel. Though he didn't pan-handle or bothered anyone, you had to make an effort to make your was around him...and the smell. yuck

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable but you'll $$$pay$$$”
Reviews.Author: jsmcolegio
Reviews.Content: I've been in many hotels around the world and most of them when you have a special situation that includes unexpected hardships they will work with you on pricing specially if you are arriving @ 4am. Someone tried to break in the place I was staying so after a long night of filling a report with the authorities I needed a place to crash until morning to take my flight. Explained to the attendant and asked for manager. She never even tried to get the manager to come talk to me so I had to pay the full $200/night even thou I only slept for 5 hours. Bed was really comfortable. Smoking rooms don't smell :) which is great because I'm a non-smoker. Parking was expensive also ($15 for those 5 hours) and it was not even attached to the building, had to walk around the block to come back from the parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, clean updated hotel, highly recommend staying here”
Reviews.Author: H6smith2
Reviews.Content: Stay here. Although it's not on the beach, the accommodations and friendly staff make up for it. The pool area is very nice and the overall hotel is contemporary and updated. The hotel has walkable access to the market and other local restaurants. When I return, I will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but smelly”
Reviews.Author: MeganS1
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly. My husband was in bad need of a hair cut so he asked on of the associates where to go. Instead of giving directions he personally took him to the barber around the corner for a great hair cut! Only bad thing was that our room smelled like cigarette smoke. We bought Febreeze from the local supermarket across the street which helped, but every day we came back to the room it smelled even worse. Also, the bar is not that great. Overall, I enjoyed myself but don't know if i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, relaxing, centric, and comfortable!!!”
Reviews.Author: Swadeshi1
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife like this hotel in Condado (San Juan)! Its new, rooms are large, comfortable and clean, bathrooms look and smell great, and the staff is excellent. The location is great having key places are nearby like Munoz Marin Airport, Condado, Old San Juan, Hato Rey, and Santurce). There are many restaurants nearby, but the hotel also have two very good restaurants. A convenient 24hrs supermarket is located across the street. Hilton Honors are welcomed. This place is perfect for business travelers. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AlbaCruz_24
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler, I have a variety of hotels that I can choose from and I always prefer to stay here. The staff is wonderful and they always welcome me back with gracious words and genuine smiles. I can't say enough about the Front Desk, Management, Restaurant, Valet,Room service and the gentlemen that help me with my bags :-)! The hotel rooms are comfortable and cozy and the hotel is centrally located. It has easy access to both the highway and the beach. Convenient restaurants on the premises and a grocery store right across the street. There is even a dry cleaner close by and the hotel has washer/dryers available too. Definitely would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for pre-cruise stay!”
Reviews.Author: Travelfan7455
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights prior to a cruise which departed from the Pan American pier. We took a taxi from the airport at a cost of $15.00 plus tip and had a smooth and efficient checkin. The person on the front desk was extremely helpful and gave us tips on where to eat and sightseeing tours that were available from the hotel. He clearly loved his job and it certainly showed. Our room was clean and modern with plenty of room. We ate dinner at a restaurant across the street and the food was delicious. We took a taxi to the shopping center as it was a special holiday and we knew Old San Juan would be very crowded. Beautiful pool area. The breakfast buffett has a large selection of items or you can order from a menu. I would certainly stay in this hotel again when visiting San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Good balance of modern and inviting”
Reviews.Author: lpaustian
Reviews.Content: solo business woman stayed 2 nights. toured old town one afternoon, biz the next day, beach on the morning i left. location: had 2 great runs on the beach. 2 blocks to Ashford Ave (condos on the beach), make a right and about 1 1/2 blocks down, go thru playground on left. if you run right, you can go about 1 mile out to Isle Verde. to the left are all the condos and hotels of condado, but there's rocks that block you from going too far. there's a tai chi class on Sat morning on a small plaza that's part of the playground area. if you walk left on Ashford, there's a Starbucks about 2 blocks down. i'm a coffee person, and the hotel coffee didn't do it for me. eat at Niche if you can, 3 blocks to the right on Ashford and then left toward the ocean. dinner is sublime, heard breakfast is great as well. i walked to Niche and back for dinner, felt pretty safe. during the day, if you get back into the neighborhood around the hotel (walk back from Starbucks on side streets) it's quite lovely and peaceful. 15 min taxi to old San Juan $15 or longer ride on bus $0.75 exact change, didn't do the latter. wonderful history, good walking town, see the forts, don't miss this. front desk can give you a letter to use pool & beach at La Concha Hotel (Marriott) which is a nice place to catch some rays, much nicer pool, looking out on beautiful blue ocean. $10 taxi, 5 min ride. you can walk, but it's over 15 mins on Ashford Ave which is hot and a bit crowded during the day. there's also a Marriott on Isle Verde that has the same arrangement, didn't try. why stay here since it's not on the beach and not in old San Juan? nice digs to return to after a long day, rates not bad for what you get, very peaceful night's sleep on a comfy bed, fall asleep watching a nice flat screen tv.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel not best location”
Reviews.Author: Sonny & Cher
Reviews.Content: positives: modern comfortable rooms, good amenities including pool, bar, restaurant and chocolate shop, top notch service from all negatives: expensive drinks and food, not good area for walking at night, too far to walk to old San Juan

Reviews.Title: “Clean & modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ivy61
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights pre-cruise. We had never been to San Juan before so were curious to sitesee. We selected this hotel based on the ratings and cost. We were not dissapointed. The rooms were very modern, clean, though on the small side. But the utilization of the small space was well layed out. The beds were very comfortable, large picture windows (though our view looked out to the city with some old houses right in front). It had a large walk in shower (no bathtub) which was nice. It had several dining choices right by the hotel. First night we ate downstairs (don't remember the name, but it was near the entrance) The food was good and location handy for a quick dinner. Both mornings we had breakfast at Under the Trees, which is located next door to the hotel. Great food, and nice ambiance. The last night we ate dinner at Bebos, around the street corner since it came recommended by other tripadvisor readers, and the taxi driver that dropped us off. But to be honest with you we didn't care for it. It was almost all local people and reminded us of a Puerto Rican Denny's. All in all the location was conveniant (in the Condado area). Taxis are expensive here so we took a bus into Old Town which you catch out front of the hotel for .75 one way, but be prepared to wait (almost 1 hour) For the price and the comfort I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel for stays in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: tmorris1
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Doubletree hotel for business and pleasure during my stays in San Juan over the last 3 years. This hotel is fantastic and treats you like family. The service is top-notch. From the moment you arrive, the team of Antonio, Omar, Juan and Peter provide you with a heartfelt welcome and a smile. The rooms are very modern, trendy, warm and the pool is very nice and accommodating. If I need anything, there is a 24 hour supermarket directly across the street. Although this hotel is not located on the beach, the beaches were easily reached on foot within 5 mins and you have access to the beach at other Hilton properties in San Juan. Since I mostly come for business, special thanks go out to the Sales and GM teams of Rosa, Lisandra, Grisell and Yodil for treating me like family. This property will continue to be my first choice when I'm in San Juan and "Staying at Hilton".

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Sweeties59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree hotel at the beginning of our cruise for two nights and at the end for one night. The hotel was recommended by our flight carrier and booked through them. I e-mailed the hotel and asked to upgrade our room to a balcony room. I asked how much it would be so that I could send them the payment. I had an e-mail back to say that we could make the payment when we arrived. When we did arrive they didn't have a balcony room for us so they put us in a corner room which was a bit bigger than the average room. This room was perfectly fine if you wanted a room without a balcony. It was big and had a nice bathroom. There were tea/coffee facilities, a microwave and big safe. The bed was very comfortable and so were the pillows. I had read in some previous reviews that the breakfast was hit and miss and not very good. We found the breakfasts we had to be very good. My husband even sent his compliments to the chef for the way he cooked the scrambled egg. There was a big selection and omelettes and fried sandwiches were cooked fresh. We had a large container of delicious orange juice on the table too - all for $15.95 which I think is very reasonable. On arrival you are given one of their cookies which are delicious. We ate one at the time and kept the other for the next morning to have with an early cup of tea. There is a small swimming pool and some tables and chairs and loungers around this area. Whilst we were there it was not busy and therefore perfectly adequate. There is a supermarket over the road which a lot of people use to buy food and drink. Outside the front of the hotel there are some tables and chairs - this area gets a breeze so its a nice place to sit and have a drink. All of the staff were pleasant but I did object to an envelope being left in our bedroom for a tip for the person who cleaned it. Surely that is what she is paid to do! There are some guys outside who will call taxis and help to get luggage etc into/out of the taxis. All in all a nice hotel but very disappointed when having booked a balcony room months beforehand we did not get one.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as the reviews stated”
Reviews.Author: Pamela H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night before and one night after our cruise. The hotel is beautiful, the staff is courteous and friendly, the rooms are clean and well appointed. The hotel is in a great location for walking. Many restaurants are close by and the food was very good at the ones that we visited. Would absolutely stay here again. Highly recommend it to other cruisers.

Reviews.Title: “San Juan Hilton ...not Handy ...Hardly exciting”
Reviews.Author: usacountrygirl
Reviews.Content: Hilton...hardly exciting. I stayed at this property in May for a business conference. I was looking forward to my stay as I had never been in Puerto Rico. I had images from travel brochures of a tropical island paradise i.e. ocean view ,lush vegetation and old world charm and definately different from the upper midwest, so I was excited. The Hilton was unfortanately situated no where near water, scenary or anything picturesque (sp)nor was there easy access to beaches which I was lead to believe were "nearby". This Hilton had a sister property located on the beach,which as a Hilton guest I was told allowed beach priveleges. When I called the Hilton to ask about this, I was lead to believe this sister property and beach were very "close". As a single female traveler I always am aware of safety issues so I don't wander too far by foot especially after dark. This property was located in more of a city, residential area with , as far as I could determine, few sites, resturants, shops of interest(for the traveler) nearby. A fellow conference goer and myself went to check out the beach at this sister property. We walked for neary 45 minutes to get there! Unfortunaelty in San Juan all taxi service has set prices and even a short city block juant in this part of town costs $10 so it can be quite expensive to explore the area by taxi. I never did get to see the beach as when our meetings were over at 4:00 a walk there would bring us there after dark. (Note: I asked the Hilton whether since this was a "sister" property there was a courtesy shuttle to take us there...the answer..."No".) Hence, the only water I saw was when I arrived one day early and stayed in Old Town for the sites (I recommend this area for attractions if you have a short stay). The hotel itself was Ok, nice but unremarkable. The conference rooms were dark (with dim lights) and cramped. When we had a break there was little nearby to explore. The rooms were clean (as I would expect), but it seemed the decorator had gone overboard in the modern look. For example in the bathroom, there was a freestanding sink with no counter to lay out toiletries (quite an inconvience). There was nowhere to hang things in the bathroom. There was some weird ladderlike shelf where the towels were shelved. It was a shared room and the one double bed was about 2 feet from the slidding bathroom door (glass) which didn't close fully so it was impossible to fully have privacy in the bathroom. The amenities were Ok. The resturant was on the way to the conference rooms (which were past the garage entrance) which you needed to walk to on the other side of the building. The resturant was kind of dark and ugly. It seemed as if it were part of the garage with a cement ceiling. Although it was open air, I definately found the atmosphere unpleasant and didn't even want to sit in there as there was little sunlight. As a summary, this was a nuts and bolts hotel i.e. clean and if you only had to stay one or two nights for business OK , but not if you want to explore and feel the atmosphere of Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Great confort”
Reviews.Author: eugeita
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel, with a super staff, Mr Antonio over all (he kindly helped me to organize a visit to a rum distillery). The only small note that I can do, is the glass door in the bathroom, no privacy. I recommend this hotel for sure, first of all, for the great breakfast served, sweet and salty. Good location with a 24 h supermarket just in front. 3 minutes taxi from Isla Grande Airport, 10 minutes from old town and shopping center, 20 minutes from the international airport. I'll be back for sure

Reviews.Title: “Best stop we've had in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: hw-in-bermuda
Reviews.Content: We got severely disrupted by the Airline, and chose to spend the night here rather than their "free" hotel (been there before and "if you can't say nuthin' nice....). It was easy to get to, and check-in was simple. the room was recently refurbished, and very comfortable. We were late arriving so had room service - beware, the portions were huge, so under order. The food arrived promptly and was hot and enjoyable. Breakfast was very good, and the trip back to the airport for a "stupid-o'clock" flight to New York was easy and inexpensive. Helpful staff, good price, good experience.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to stay”
Reviews.Author: Eunicegirl
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with a group of friends on a tour of Puerto Rico. We stayed our first 4 nights at the Doubletree in San Juan. The property is very nice, clean, welcoming. The breakfast was excellent also. BUT, the staff was the best. Warm chocolate chip cookies greated us every time we came back from a day of fun. We came back to spend our last night at this hotel and everyone greeted us like old friends.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, comfortable, and amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: klf599
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree by Hilton for one night before departing on a cruise, and I have nothing but positive things to say about this hotel. I stayed in a room with a balcony, offering easy access to the pool and hot tub...what a perk! The rooms were also very comfortable: great mattresses/sheets (I had an amazing night's sleep), trendy decor, and best of all, amazing products. (We were happy to stock up on some more travel-sized shampoo, conditioner, and lotion.) The service was also extremely helpful and professional. The front desk had very useful suggestions on nearby restaurants and attractions, and they also encouraged us to check in our luggage at the cruise ship early and spend the day in Old San Juan, rather than checking it at the hotel, saving us time and cab fares, and giving us some additional time to spend walking around in the historical part of the city. Plus, you can't beat the delicious cookies :) The only reason I didn't give this property 5 stars was the location. It's not on the beach or in Old San Juan, so you do need to walk a ways or drive to most attractions. But, since this hotel is centrally located and has very easy access to the highway, it's a great place to stay if you're planning to rent a car, which, frankly, I would recommend. I would definitely stay at this hotel again, and in fact, when we had a negative experience staying in a hotel in Old San Juan on our return, we all wished that we had reserved with the Doubletree after our cruise as well.

Reviews.Title: “Would definetly stay at this location again!”
Reviews.Author: Liz V
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very kid friendly.... Staff was very helpful... the premises was very well maintained. There were no congestion the way it is on Asford Ave Hotel strip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot to explore puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: DJSCMac
Reviews.Content: If you are interested in a combination of nightlife and beach, rent a car and stay at Doubletree. You won't pay the price of a resort, but you are near everything! At night, walk to the main Condado area for bars, restaurants and casinos. Or take a cab into Old San Juan for the night. For day trips, you are near Old San Juan that you can drive to, or drive to the public beach in luquillo. Worth it drive there and get away from all the buildings. Also, we did day trips to the rain forest, to fajardo to take ferry to Culebra or Vieques. Overall, great hotel and grocery store across the street which was really nice. Staff was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Jakesen
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in December 2010. Great location and friendly staff. Rooms are modern and clean although a bit smaller than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: TravelnRun00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree by Hilton San Juan the night before we were departing for a cruise. Check in was a breeze, the cookies were delicious, and our room was clean. The bellhop on duty (January 6 2012, I can not remember his name) was fabulous. He gave us a great recommendation for dinner. The pool area was small but clean and perfect for a quick dip. If we ever cruise out of San Juan again, we will definitely be staying here as our pre-cruise hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just unique! Hilton double tree.”
Reviews.Author: Ivyflo52
Reviews.Content: A group of 8 ladies from Louisiana stay in the hotel for a week. It was a perfect place. Close to the airport and the service for taxi make your saty easier to move, The hotel was clean and very chic. All the staff make you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but smallish room. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: BostonianVagabond
Reviews.Content: My friend and I, two single women, stayed at this place and would recommend it. Good location. It was a short walk to the strip of restaurants and shops. There's a grocery store right across the street. Good service. You have to pay for parking: $15/day. The room is a bit small/cramped for two people and the second bed is not a real bed but a pull out. The bathroom had all the appropriate amenities.

Reviews.Title: “just great”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyGo
Reviews.Content: There is nothing negative I can say about the hotel. We spent a week there and had a fantastic time. The standard rooms are pretty small but nice and functional but traveling with 2 kids we decided to ask (and pay) for an upgrade to one of the rooms that are next to the pool area. Luckily we were able to move after 2 days and we had a blast. The pool access was so easy, the staff was just great and we went out every night to Old San Juan or Condado. The beach is a 5 minute walk away and okay, there are better beaches in Puerto Rico but you can definitely spend an hour or two there with the kids. Going to the city was also very easy, there are 2 bus lines right next to the hotel going into the bus terminal of Old San Juan. (You have to catch either the "21" going in the direction of the beach or the "T5" going uphill, the opposite direction). Having a 24-hour supermarket across the street is very helpful, especially with kids. So what's negative? Nothing. The food in the hotel restaurant is not outstanding (we ate there once) but with all the different options around this it not a problem whatsoever. And the staff is just great. Definitely a place I would try first if I will ever return to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: lexington_sc_foodie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on December 30th for 1 night before our cruise. From the airport, the cab ride was a $15 plus $1 per bag.
