This is a government regulated rate which is posted at the bag carousel. A rate sheet is also handed out at the taxi stand. We stayed in a garden verandah room #2006 which had a walk out balcony to the pool area. We got a great rate because we kept checking the rates on the internet and when the price when down, they adjusted our rate for us. We ended up paying $152 including taxes. Our room was very clean. It had a comfortable queen bed and a pull-down double Murphy bed. It can be a little tight when the Murhpy bed is down, but it was not a problem for us. Our room had a double cup coffee maker and 2 complimentary bottles of water. The bathroom was clean and well laid out for the small space. We loved the walk out balcony to the pool area and ate our breakfast out there. The pool is beautiful and the staff were very helpful in getting our kids towels which were moved inside after a rainfall. Before we got there, we called the hotel a few times and the service we received over the phone was exceptional. Also, my husbandâ€™s wallet was left in the room and it was actually turned in to the front desk by the cleaning staff. When we contacted the hotel from the cruise ship, they put it in a sealed envelope and sent it to us via taxi. It arrived 15 minutes later. We were very impressed with their willingness to ensure we got the wallet. The grocery store, literally across the street, was amazing. It was huge, similar to Publix, and had pretty much everything including liquor and organic food. We saw many people walking through the hotel lobby with bags of groceries at dinner and again at breakfast. We bought breakfast items which we ate on our balcony and at the patio tables. We ate at Silk which was EXCELLENT. Overall, we had a great experience so I would definitely recommend this hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect pre-post cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canadarocks463
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Doubletree San Juan on 01 Jan and 08 Jan 2012 pre and post cruise with kids. 7 story hotel so not too big which makes checking-in/out quick. Excellent and friendly staff. Checked in at 2.00am and though room service was closed, front desk staff found milk and brought it to the room. TV remote replaced 2 mins after calling about it. Allowed early checkin at 10am post cruise. Nice trendy fixtures in room. Free internet plus fridge and microwave. 10 mins from airport ($23) and cruise terminal. 5 mins walk to the beach. Murphy bed folds into the wall giving more space - also good mattress compared to any sofa beds. Antonio who is bellhop/concierge can give you great tourist advice. Supermax in front of hotel and has food counter, groceries, liquor and pharmacy. Safe and clean area. Hotel in-room breakfast is expensive but good. Went to Bebos 1 min away for lunch - huge portions, good PR food, cheap. Also in the same plaza as the hotel is Under the Trees - excellent restaurant, dinner for 4 was $100. All in all excellent hotel with great staff and I will defintely stay again. Wish other hotels would learn great and friendly service from this hotel. Would like them to offer a shutle to cruise terminal/airport as added benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel with great front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: PocitosGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for about a week on our first visit to Puerto Rico. It would have been nice to be on the beach but the hotel has an arrangement with the local Marriott if you want to spend time there. Daniel at the front desk was amazing (I think that was his name) and was able to help us out with any of our questions. The restaurants close by are also great (under the tree). The welcome with a choc chip cookie is a nice touch. Having the supermarket across the road was very handy too. All in all a great place to stay for the money. The rooms were a bit small but that wasn't such a big issue. The hotel helped us rent a car, take a plane to one of the islands, gave us information regarding the old city etc and had a warm greeting every time we walked by. I read a lot of hotel reviews for PR and it all seemed that they had issues. The DoubleTree had no such issues. You can walk to the beach from the hotel and they also give you a handy beachpack (we took this with us on the day trip to the island).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: MannyCintron
Reviews.Content: Service was fantastic! The staff in Front Desk was really helpful, they welcome me at the hotel with a warm cookie and when I had any questions about directions or good places to eat, they would give me a nice review. The rooms are beautiful, love the colors. Breakfast was really good and staff was really nice, they even handled me the newspaper when I sat down for breakfast. Location is near principal highway and walking distance from the beach. I recommend everyone to try the Doubletree Hotel someday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: taxiartist
Reviews.Content: Here for one night pre cruise. Pool are is nice and relaxing, close to beach and their beach chairs are great! Across street from nice market. Staff friendly and helpful. Short ride to cruise ships. Rooms well lit! Beautiful bathrooms. All in all a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, great location, very clean and comfortable beds.”
Reviews.Author: titobeba
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. Not a choice if you are looking for a beach, but the pool area is very beautiful, and the overall experience was great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay over Christmas 2011”
Reviews.Author: Scott C
Reviews.Content: The service was fantastic - everyone so friendly, and the hotel is in great shape - our room and the public rooms are quite new and well maintained. We used the hotel's relationship with La Concha Renaissance - the front desk gave us a letter of introduction which we took to the La Concha front desk where they gave us an account number to charge to, allowed us free access to the pool and beach, use of beach chairs, free use of water sports items like boogie boards, etc. La Concha is within walking distance so we made several trips there to use the beautiful Condado beach. I also visited the 24 hour grocery across the street from the Doubletree - very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Service is awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: trivyny
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several hotels..but man, I've yet seen something real amazing. The breakfast staff is great and Manager Keilyn is a great ambassador. She made our stay an unforgettable one. She went out of her way to provide information regarding places to go around the island. Also, addressed our family by name; like she knew our family since a long time. The hotel should be very proud to have such person working for them! My advise to everyone is to find Keilyn once they get to the Hotel! She'll make your stay memorable. Overall, hotel is very well orientated about service as well as clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: sdantas
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel about 3 times now. I do like the location, the welcome cookies. Rooms are small but do the job as I am only at the hotel to sleep. Staff is helpful, price is fair and they have a parking lot (useful as I usually rent a car there to go around the city and other locations). I do recommend. Pool is available as a small restaurant (only tried breakfast but don't think it is worthy).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed stay”
Reviews.Author: onthego619
Reviews.Content: Not a lot of positive things to say about this location other than there is a 24hr grocery store across the street to stock up some snacks. The location was ok, in between Condado and la Isla Verde area. The rooms were not that great looking unless you are on the 8th floor. I didnt like the design as the bathroom faces the room and all the smells that come from it invade all over! Service from the staff was ok, didn't really go out of their way to help in any occation. The double room we reserved the second bed was a hideaway. Not typical or comfortable but its all they have. No place to park so you have to valet or do self parking which is a block and a half away!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: travelgraciously
Reviews.Content: i booked on booking.com and they couldn't find the reservation at first but then gave us a free upgrade. the location is good and just across from a grocery store. The only negative is a little on the service. We had to call a few times to get towels for our 3rd person and they wouldn't allow us to actually use the business center (they printed out our boarding tickets for us though).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Philip D
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is not located on the beach, the beaches were easily reached on foot within 5 mins. It more than makes up for this when it comes to getting about the city. We travelled on the local buses wherever we went and there were bus stops right outside the Hotel. There was a Supermarket right across the street for any shopping needs. There was also a very nice restaurant 'Under the Trees' right next door. The hotel staff were most attentive to all our needs and were always visible around the hotel and at the front desk. There was also a friendly car hire firm just 5 mins walk away from the hotel who were only too willing to collect and drop off. Should we ever go back to San Juan we would definately choose the Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff, and excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: Veggieofile
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights before our cruise. It was perfect for what we wanted. We were travelling from London so arrived at the hotel nearing 1am. A taxi from the airport cost around $16 at that time of night. We were checked in efficiently and given 2 warm cookies and two bottles of water, which were gratefully received after travelling for over 14 hours. The staff for our entire stay were all very helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean, modern and well equipped. The hotel had a swimming pool, a hot tub, and a gym. We used all these facilities and really enjoyed them. The swimming area is a nice place to relax and the temperature of the hot tub is really nice and hot. There is complimentary bottled water and coffee. They serve the complimentary coffee in the mornings between 7-9am, downstairs in the foyer. The bar and foyer is a nice place to sit and they also have seating outside, which we used daily. They donâ€™t provide laundry service but they do have washing facilities and will provide detergent and dryer sheets. We used this and found it sufficient for our needs. There is also a 24 hour grocery store opposite the hotel which is very handy. The location of the hotel is not in Old San Juan, a taxi there will cost around $21. The beach is about a 5-10 minute walk and a there are many restaurants and bars on Av Dr Ashford which is a 5 minute walk away. You can also use the facilities of their sister hotel La Concha; a renaissance resort, which is a five star resort. We went to the resort and spent the day at the pool. This is a great hotel with very friendly staff. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the stay here!”
Reviews.Author: islandfevergurl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4 night leisure stay here. I have no major complaints that would hender me from staying here again. I decided on this hotel because it had better reviews than the other Hilton I was looking into. Location: it is not where "all the action" is, so if you want to be in the center of the hustle and bustle you may opt for another location HOWEVER it is within walking distance to get to any eatery or shopping-within .50 mile. There is a grocery store right across the street which was really convienent to get basic bottled water and drinks. The hotel is on a couple of the bus routes which was nice to catch a ride to Old San Juan. If you choose to ride it, the cost is .75 person and you need exact change(no dollars). Good way to get around and see the city too-but only do this if you have time. Staff: They were friendly and very helpful. No complaints in that department. Anytime I asked for help or towels they were happy to offer assistance. Room: it was clean and very modern furniture. It had a microwave, hairdryer, mini fridge, etc. One negative(and certainly not a big deal) was the maid left some food and stuff from previous guest...again, not a big deal. Another negative was that the walls were slightly "thin" I could hear the neighbors opening and closing the bathroom doors. They are heavy type material made of glass and they slide. It wasn't enough to keep me up at night. I am also use to sleeping with a "noise fan"-and we didn't have one of those to drown out the noises. Again, these negatives were not bad enough to keep me from staying at this hotel in the future. We used the fitness center and pool area; both were small but nice-served its purpose. We ate breakfast there every morning because we had vouchers. It was good. They had eggs, potatoes, fruits, omlets, bread, sausage, bacon, cereal. One benefit of staying at this hotel is that you get guest priviledges at another hotel and casino. We did spend the day at this other hotel which was located on the beach. They set up an account and link it to the Double tree. We were able to get food, drinks, towels, etc. We felt safe in the neighborhood and had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ekrauss
Reviews.Content: We came to San Juan for a destination wedding and chose to stay here instead of the wedding hotel. We are so glad we did even though we had to walk back and forth to see the other guests for the 5 nights we were here. Rooms were comfortable, service was excellent, and the fresh cookies was always a huge bonus. It was also super convenient to have the 24 hour SuperMax across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Preston71
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a night pre-cruise. Hotel was very nice overall and quiet. Hotel staff was very friendly; check-in and check-out were a breeze. I had called down to the hotel a couple of months before inquiring about a kayaking trip and the hotel staff took care of everything, called me back the same day to let me know it had been confirmed. The evening of arrival the excursion company picked us up and dropped us off at the hotel. Rooms are very nice, much more pleasent than I was expecting, I especially liked the fact that the room we had had a large shower and no bathtub. The hotel had Aveda products in our room as well. The room also had a trundel bed that we needed (think it pulls down out of the wall), I will say that when it is pulled down it does make the room more 'cozy' as there is not alot of floor space. There was a desk, chair, and flat panel HDTV all in the room. No issue with noise during our stay. The pool area seemed very nice and clean. The fitness room is located right off the pool and has large glass windows looking onto it. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great People”
Reviews.Author: ICUHEN
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay on business. I wouldn't recommend for families only because it is in a strange neighborhood. There really isn't much shopping within walking distance. Although it is only four blocks from the beach, I wouldn't recommend walking unless you are familiar with and comfortable in PR. If you have a car, there's a ton close by. Although the property is not beachfront, as a guest, you have access the beach at any other Hilton property in San Juan. The parking structure is pretty inconvenient. The entrance in located around the block so it is worth paying for valet. Gym is clean and has newer equipment. Four solid restaurants close by but all are a bit $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Very Hard & Small Beds”
Reviews.Author: BadHotelExperience
Reviews.Content: This place is great but the beds are extremely hard and small. Their "Queen Size" bed is as big as a standard "Full Size" bed (54" x 75") which they say its their "Queen Full Size" bed. Note: A standard "Queen Size" bed is supposed to be 60" x 80".

Reviews.Title: “"Smoking Allowed" rooms in San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoLucy
Reviews.Content: The hotel, pool area and room were gorgeous. We stayed 4 to a room, using the bed and also a Murphy bed. There were no blankets provided for the pullout bed, only 2 chairs on which to sit, and coffee enough for only 2 people. Several requests for ashtrays, towels, coffee, and blankets went ignored for several hours. In a non-smoking country, it was great to find a hotel that still allows smoking, (so you'd think they'd provde ashtrays) but the service was disappointing. Next time, we'll opt for a hotel known for great service and we'll step outside to smoke. Hope this was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Better late than never”
Reviews.Author: mauikit
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here 2nd week of October for 3 days and had a wonderful stay. Rooms are modern, clean and the beds were very comfortable. The welcoming cookie was definitely a nice touch aside from the excellent customer service! I agree with the previous review about the bathroom flooding from the excess spillage from the shower. But, that did not prevent us from having a great time!

Reviews.Title: “dont bother”
Reviews.Author: couturecorgi
Reviews.Content: the guy who checked me in named juan was the only really good part of this place. i booked last minute and spent a little over 200. the computers in the business center are slow and really in need of an update i am a part time writer and was constantly kicked off my own blog and news site until i gave up. the elevators in this hotel are the worst and slowest i have ever experienced. the pool is a joke very cramped and good luck finding your own chaise to lay on i gave up after the 3 whole minutes it took to navigate the pool area. the rooms though small are pretty nice good sheets and pillows and comfortable beds. the bathroom was nice well appointed with nice towels. DO NOT eat at the restaurant in the hotel. the restaurant is really cheesy tables and furniture like that of a college cafeteria if that. food was so so but cheap but if you are looking for haute cuisine go elsewhere. my biggest concern is cleanliness and they cover that part. getting a hotel in san juan is hit or miss if you dont want the ritz make sure you book 4 stars bc the 3 and a half star places are not nice.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for 2011”
Reviews.Author: Patrick B
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all the staff at Doubletree in Puerto Rico, especially to Daiana, Margarita, Antonio, Peter and Juan for making my every visit a memorable one Cecily Simmonds-Barrett

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but aimed at business travelers”
Reviews.Author: runchadrun
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because at the time it was the #1 rated hotel on TripAdvisor and because we got a very good non-refundable rate on hotels.com. We were staying in San Juan for 3 days before going on a cruise. The hotel itself is modern and nice with a very comfy bed and lots of pillows. The bathroom has a sliding translucent glass door so there isn't a lot of privacy. And the shower only has a glass wall for half of the stall while the rest is open to the bathroom. Unless you properly place the floor mat next to the shower the bathroom floor will get all wet. This mainly a business, not tourist, hotel. You'll need to take a car, taxi, or bus to the tourist areas however there are always taxis at the ready--just ask the valet and he'll buzz one over. The closest car rental agency is at the Marriott ($11 cab ride). The on-site restaurant is pricey (again, meant for people on expense accounts) and the breakfast buffet disappointing. The little shop does sell gourmet chocolates though. :-) There is a supermarket across the street and a Subway a block away if you want cheaper food. The rooms have microwaves and fridges. If I was coming back as a tourist I think I would stay in the more tourist-oriented areas.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: alanglynn
Reviews.Content: We stayed her 5 nights before our cruise. It was fairly small but the staff were welcoming and we got a hot cookie when we booked in. At first I thought I would be disappointed with the location as it is about 10 minutes walk to the beach, but it was so handy for the buses and we did a lot of exploring. Also a great supermarket opposite which was open all night. We went to old San Juan several times and that was very interesting. We got on the ferry not knowing where it went and ended up touring the Bacardi factory which was good. The pool was small but it was never crowded and it and the jacuzzi were open all night. It rained quite a bit but that didn't spoil it. The week on the cruise the weather was brilliant the whole time. It also had a washing machine/dryer by the pool which was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for overnight before cruise.”
Reviews.Author: FSUWizard
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night before cruise. I loved this place. Small, but very efficient rooms with modern decor. Great recomendations for where to eat. Only problem was that the shower flooded the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: NR9788
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with my stay (although short). The staff was all so welcoming and greeted me with a smile from the front desk to housekeeping. I had a company function at Alquimia, and since the very first contact to plan it all, it was all smooth sailing. During the function the staff was amazing! They treated all the attendees like VIP's until the last of the guests left. I received great feedback from all who attended the activity and many said they'd consider having their own parties or meetings here. Even the DJ liked the place and the service received! My room was super, and the bed.... I wanted to take back home with me. I had a very restful sleep. I will definitely book another stay here. Thank you to all the staff at DoubleTree by Hilton San Juan!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Joyce W
Reviews.Content: If you want to receive value for money, while experiencing a very enjoyable trip, try this fantastic spot.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay when visiting San Juan !”
Reviews.Author: blkhaiku
Reviews.Content: I'd heard very good reviews of the Doubletree from a buddy who works at their establishment. He was not kidding at all. The staff and amenities are top-notch and made my 2nd visit to PR a fantastic vacation. The hotel room was clean & tidy, distance to favorite sites/restaurants was easy to walk, and had no trouble arranging tours of the local area/island. Definitely will be staying here on my future travels to PR.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look any further.”
Reviews.Author: Mohammad1
Reviews.Content: Everything was above and beyond. Good looking hotel, friendly staff always eager to help, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: thecaribou
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited San Jaun in Sept. 2011 and stayed at this hotel. Although we wondered if we would be too far from the beach, while we were making our bookings, we realized that this location was great for us once we got there. It is a about a 5 block walk to the Ocean Park beach, which was very manageable for us. The hotel will give you nice chairs, an ice box and towels. The Ocean Park Beach is a great beach and seems like where the locals hang out, and a little away from the touristy areas as you go along the beach. We also loved going to the Bebos cafe next door. Make sure you give yourself sometime if you eat here, as orders take some times. There is a grocery store opposite the hotel which is convenient. For the night life, we had a bit of a walk as it is not very close to this hotel. But we don't mind walking, and after getting directions from the hotel staff, it was easy. I would suggest driving if you don't want a very long walk, but parking might be tough. All in all, a great hotel, helpful and courteous staff, good breakfast and clean, well maintained room.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: curacaovisitor
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree is a nice hotel. The grounds are well-kept. The staff is friendly and do a good job of making you feel welcomed. The pool area is nice - and surprisingly it is the area where the washers/dryers are located. The restaurant offers a very good breakfast and the staff are great. The rooms are rather small; thus, this is the main drawback. But, the hotel is a short walk away from Bebo's Restaurant - which serves the best Puerto Rican/Caribbean-style food. Also, the Santurce marketplace is in the area and merits a visit. The Doubletree has a sister property a short drive away where you can go for a beach visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Carl D
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very clean and the staff is great. They were very courteous everyday of our stay. In addition, they went above and beyond by mailing packages and enrolling me in Hilton Honors. I was very impressed with their attention to satisfying the customer. The OPS MGR is outstanding!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: THOMAS J
Reviews.Content: Make no mistake, this hotel is quite the stay! Rooms are exactly as posted. Per my visit, I noted that this is more of an adult (singles/couples) executive/business style hotel in which everything is within arms reach. It is not a typical touristy hotel which is exactly what I was looking for. I aptly named it "The Convertible" as everything nice and in place but without excess. The staff is excellent, and there is a 24 hour grocery store across the street. Also, the hotel food is excellent but a tad bit pricy but the grocery store has tons of choices from alcohol, fresh fruit, to a Boars Head deli. The restaurant adjacent to the hotel provides excellent local cuisine choices at a great value. I would definitely rate it 4+ out of 5! Also, there are few Mom and Pop eateries within 3-5 mins walking distance. The beach is within a 10 minute walk and the hotel will give you a pass for the resort (partner hotel) as required. I did note that I did not see any children ( a plus for me) so if you have little ones, a larger resort style may be best suited for your needs. Pls note on Fri/Sat evening, it can get pretty loud but management mandates and enforces quiet hours after "11ish" per my visit. I had read about this issue on Trip Advisor so I knew what to expect and it did not pose an issue for me. Also there is free (yes free) wifi, a free kiosk, safes and a small fridge in the room. A plus for me was also the free happy hour on Wed evening. I would like to see brighter lighting in the bathrooms for shaving. Again, this is a highly recommended hotel. So if you are looking for a nice place with tons of privacy coupled with some nice features within walking distance, this is the place for you. I will stay here again on my next visit in the spring. I almost forgot, do not forget to ask about the amazing free cookies! Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Fentyway
Reviews.Content: Great place I love it, great location, great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, comfortable, friendly, convenient to supermarket but not close to shopping,expensive parking.”
Reviews.Author: moy s
Reviews.Content: Been to PR several times. This hotel is clean, modern, quiet and comfortable with friendly, helpful staff. Room is small but adequate. Omar, asst. manager and front desk receptionist were very helpful. Traffic in PR was always busy 24/7. GPS could not get us back to hotel, GPS was good with all other destinations, but always took us to bad section instead of hotel, very frustrating. Omar stayed with us on the phone guiding us back to hotel on several occasions. We spend a lot of wasted time trying to get back to hotel. Hotel not far from Plaza Las Americas Mall by car, definitely cannot walk there. Food at SuperX Market cafe across the street was convenient, fresh, delish and affordable. Wish hotel was within walking distance to shopping. Driving in PR is a total nightmare. Very very sorry we rented a car, we also bought extra insurance coverage...Valet Parking at hotel is approx $20.per day or self park approx $16.00 , plus its in the other building not too far from hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: WileECoyoteChicago
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night on our recent trip. The staff is exceptionally warm and gracious. The room was small, but very modern and confortable. I felt like we got an excellant value on a cost-to-quality metric. An added bonus was that there was a 24 hour supermarket across the street. The only complaint I have (which can't be helped) is that the hotel is several blocks away from the tourist zone. Other than the beach (which is about 2 to 3 blocks away), there is not a lot to do in the immediate vacinity.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: RTWTripping
Reviews.Content: We were happy with our choice. We stayed at this hotel for four nights and that was a good amount of time to see San Juan. We took one of the tours recommended by the hotel - we went to the rainforest and that was worthwhile. It was a morning (half day) tour. The breakfast at the hotel is really good. The location of the hotel is ok but a taxi to Old San Juan will be $14-$15 each way (fixed rates in San Juan!) The supermarket across the road was a bonus and the Puerto Rican restaurant around the corner was the best! The staff are all friendly and welcoming. Nothing is a problem. They were always happy to help. My only criticism is that we had cigarette smoke coming through the vent into our bathroom - perhaps from the smoking floor one level up. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad room locations”
Reviews.Author: TruBlu1872
Reviews.Content: We've just spent two nights in this hotel, after a cruise. We arrived at the hotel around 10.00am, I did know that check-in was 3.00pm, but thought there maybe a chance for a room being ready earlier. Greeted at the administration desk by margarita, pleasant, but NOT exceptional. Told we would have to wait, at least until 1.00pm, or have a LOWER rated room, at the same cost. I declined, and gave her a mobile number to contact me, should a room become available. Just after 1.00pm, went back to the administration desk, asked about room availability, was told not yet, AND the room maids were on a one hour lunch break ! Unlikely to have the room before 3.00pm ! Around 2.45pm, went back to check, different employee at the administration desk, and room was available. Now need to get luggage, from their storage, which they did take upon arrival. The original porter being very helpful at the time of arrival. It took discussions with 4 porters, before we got our luggage, then the long trek to our room. NO elevator to this side of the hotel. The room, number 211, is at the end of a long corridor, next to a very noisy ice making machine, and the fire exit door. The ice making machine could be heard all night, on both nights that we stayed. Room was just average, and had a comfortable bed. Nothing special, very modern, with minimal storage in the bathroom for personal items. Two normal sized toilet bags completely filled the available space. The room was clean, the grounds around the pool were clean, towels available for bathers. The downside, apart from Margarita and the long wait for a room. Breakfast; buffet style is $15.95, plus 15% tax, so for two with a tip, $40.00. Nothing great on the buffet selection, and similar Denny's/Perkins/IHOP etc. would be less than $20.00 Used the business area facility on each of the three days, and it was good. Had a printer linked to the three available computers, so I could check-in for my flight, and print boarding passes. The big black mark against this area, the large spider web, which was there on the three days I used the facility, photograph included. Would I go back to this hotel ? NO. Nothing much around, long walk to the beach, and the currents are to strong to attempt swimming. Value for money - highly overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew C
Reviews.Content: I joined a colleague of mine who often stays at this property and he always raves about how wonderful the service and people are. He made this hotel and itâ€™s employeeâ€™s sound to good to be true and gave me, what I thought, were unattainable expectations. Well, this place more then exceeded those expectations with a combination of extremely clean, modern and comfortable rooms and a hotel staff that is genuinely happy to help you with any needs and are extremely friendly. My associate mentioned to Rosa Desarden (Corporate Sales Manager) that I have never tried the traditional Puerto Rica holiday drink â€œCoquitoâ€�. Rosa went out of her way to present me with a taste of this delectable beverage and completely blew me away with her hospitality and ability to make me feel special! Unfortunately, unlike my associate, I will only have a chance to visit San Juan occasionally but I would never even think of staying at any other property then the Doubletree! One of the best Hotel experiences I have had in many years of regular travel!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable hotel”
Reviews.Author: AustinT
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because it was rated #1 on TripAdvisor and it proved to be a very nice hotel. Rooms are very modern and the interaction with the staff was very pleasant. 24hr grocery store across the street from the hotel which is very convenient if you don't always want to eat in restaurants. The rooms come with microwave and small refridgerator. Small fitness centre but had the basics, pool and jacuzzi were nice and during my time here was very quiet. Short taxi ride in Old Town or to the Marriott on the beach which guests are allowed to use beach access. I was told it is about a 20 minute walk but I took a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: SouthernSweetT
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I selected this hotel for our pre-cruise stay. It was very pretty, helpful staff, friendly environment. The grocery across the street is a plus. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “100% great service”
Reviews.Author: Christopher M
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this Doubletree on and off for the past 3 months. The staff has been very accommodating and friendly. It is a great place to stay while on business. The hotel provides all the services you would expect while on a business trip - free use of fax, free internet and laptops located throughout the lobby for internet access. It is located right across the street from a supermarket which is really convenient. Pizza place near by. It is close to the beach and the happening part of Condado. The area is safe and a great launching point to all the Puerto Rico has to offer. Great job guys!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a lovely and welcoming stay!”
Reviews.Author: Chapmandala
Reviews.Content: A group of eight of us stayed at the Doubletree in San Juan at the beginning of November, 2011, prior to boarding a cruise. The property is lovely and we were warmly greeted with smiles and warm chocolate chip cookies. Check-in was a breeze. The hotel staff really stood out. They were all so friendly and helpful. I must have heard "welcome!" five or six times before I reached my room. Our room was very clean, nicely decorated, well appointed, and offered a pretty view of the surrounding neighbourhood. My brother and his girlfriend used the pool area and the gym and said both were really nice. I can't say enough about this place and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a place to stay for a night or even a week! There is a grocery store right across the street that sells liquor (bonus!) and I recommend the "Gasolina" drink packets, They were recommended by a local and they really pack a punch! If you're hungry, go to "Under The Trees" across the parking lot. One of the best meals I've had in a long time and they make killer specialty mojitos. I've also posted a review about the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Post Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: erby2283
Reviews.Content: We got to the Doubletree around 10 AM and was happy when advised our room was ready and we could check in. The room was very modern but the view was not so great (but I didn't care b/c we were exhausted from the cruise). We changed and went down to the beautiful pool area but it was so hot, we only lasted an hour. The room was very modern and over all it was quiet. My only complain is that there is no fan in the bathroom and b/c of the modern decor, you can hear EVERYTHING that goes on in the bathroom while it's in use (if you know what I mean). I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay after a long day at the park”
Reviews.Author: Jose Bou R
Reviews.Content: After a long day at the park find a great bed to sleep w my two daughters. My wife enjoyed all the facilities, in the morning a great breakfast, the childrens under 12 eat free was perfect for us and better was having a great service from our server Sandra Alvarez she was very helpful & attentive with the girls, lovely woman.

Reviews.Title: “Room Service Experience Ruined this Stay”
Reviews.Author: TRC70
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was fine, clean and convenient. My complaint has to do with the service. I ordered breakfast to be delivered between 6:15am and 6:30 am to allow for time to eat and make it to the airport to catch our flight home. At 6:40 room service called to see if we still wanted our breakfast. We declined due to our timing. They offered no apology and were completely indifferent to their lapse in service. I stopped at the front desk to let them know of the problem and to ensure we were not charged for the breakfast. The front desk person was equally as unapologetic and could not have cared on way or the other if we were satisifed. As a Hilton Honors member I expected more. Will stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic spot!”
Reviews.Author: blockhouse
Reviews.Content: We just spent a night at this Doubletree prior to starting a cruise. We had kids and adults and it met all our needs. Although we had to take a cab to Old San Juan, the location was really pretty good. The beach was only a short walk away. We found that since we needed to feed so many, it made sense to walk across the street to the 24 hour supermarket. They had a GREAT hot meal selectionâ€¦very local foods. The prices were great too! We brought it back and sat around the pool. The rooms are not big but they are clean and newly renovated. The staff was great and very helpful. It was a perfect spot for us!!

Reviews.Title: “Review of Doubletree by Hilton San Juan”
Reviews.Author: ralegria1130
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. I was a guest here in early January 2010 and then in August 2010. Both times the staff were excellent in every way possible. From extra towels to messages received by the front desk for me the staff were always attentive, discreet and ready to make sure my stay was a memorable one. It is not on the beach but that in no way detracts from the service and amenities the hotel offers its guests. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to San Juan, PR and looking for value in a hotel experience. Of course the warm chocolate chip cookie is a plus as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: BobKop
Reviews.Content: Great hotel nice located next to a grocery store. Even though they are near a busy street, the pool and courtyard are silent, open and inviting. Good rooms, and very nice staff. They also have a great program with some hotels that are at the beach which allows guests to lay at those hotels' beaches. A great hotel especially for less than $100 per night. And ofcourse the warm chocolate chip cookies help make it a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree San Juan, Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: Just to let any one know I have had to go to Puerto Rico many times in the past four years for business. I'm in the food business and have two sons in business there. It is by far the BEST property I have stayed at in Puerto Rico very close to the beach and Ashford Ave great places to eat very close to the hotel. What stands out most is the attentiveness of the the folks that work the hotel all details are covered. I travel fourty weeks a year on average and these folk don't miss a beat. A fine tuned machine needing no oil. I highly recomend this property if passing through P.R. or staying any lenth of time I was there last time 18 nights the best service bar none. Bo the manager and company do their best to make it all happen!!!!!! Recomend for familes as well great pool fitness center and a Super Max supermarket next door for the things ya just might want or need! great Deli in there a s well!! Kevin Murray Boars Head Brand 24 Rock Street Brooklyn, New York 11206 kevin.murray@boarshead.com

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: hillkrest
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was extremely clean and the front desk staff was extremely helpful identifying places to eat and visit. We came in a day early for our cruise and the dinner staff at the hotel restaurant were friendly and the food was good. Pricey, but good. However, the breakfast staff in the restaurant were barely average. They seem to cater to the spanish speaking customers and ignored us. It took forever to get assistance, if we could even get it. Rude would be the word. Oh, and be warned that the bathrooms in the rooms are semi see-through. Awkward when you have children.

Reviews.Title: “San Juan Stay Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ann731
Reviews.Content: Loved the accommodations-- decor, amenities, cleaniness, staff, especially the glass & glass block bathroom. Convenient location--walking distance to beach (3 blocks), resturants (in hotel & all around), grocery across the street, and easy on/off the highway system. The pool was small but we weren't looking for a resort swim up bar, just a clean/safe place to stay while we toured the city. Very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanAddict09
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night prior to a cruise. We got a very good rate for what you get here, felt like it was a steal. Great service and rooms. The outdoor pool area is very nice. The free beach access program with their sister hotel was amazing and within walking distance. Market right across the street. Convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!Awesome! Awesome”
Reviews.Author: ITravel614
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just amazing. Warm welcome, smiling faces greeting you upon arrival and such a quick check- in. We were even upgraded!! Thanks Nicholas! My wife and I loved the placed so much. The rooms were superb, modern and clean. And those cookies were the icing on the cake! The staff goes out of there way to accommodate your every need. Plus, the hotel is conveniently located across the street from a 24 hour supermarket and just blocks away from great night life on Ashford Avenue. This hotel is a must if you plan to visit San Juan !

Reviews.Title: “Good...except for the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: sipari_traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 417 and the sliding glass door to the bathroom did not close properly. It's bad enough that you can hear everything going on the bathroom but I was not impressed that it wouldn't close by about 2 inches. This did not provide the adequate level of privacy that I would have liked. The door was also hitting the floor and producing small shards of glass. Two of the days of our stay we were not provided with any clean face cloths. I used my Hilton Honors card for the first time but on my return home I recieved an email telling me that I would not earn any points because I had booked through a travel website (Expedia) instead of through them directly. This doesn't make sense to me as they are still getting my money for the room. I won't be using the card again.

Reviews.Title: “Warm WELCOME”
Reviews.Author: kathiravelu a
Reviews.Content: We were welcome by hotel staffs with cookies. room was very clean. Cross the road shopping mall. Walking distance to new San Yuan beach. Hotel staff gave us letter to use their sister hotel beach activities by beach

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at any time!”
Reviews.Author: papisan
Reviews.Content: This is just a great place to be at. Location is great, with access to the Condado and San juan areas. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The cookies are always warm and the breakfast, so much better than the regular fare, you can't go wrong staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Floridian Stay”
Reviews.Author: pharmd2008
Reviews.Content: The stay overall was good. The best part about it was the happy hour on Wednesday where the Hotel picked up the tab!! The only complaint I have is the location. You may have to do alittle walking or calling cabs frequently.

Reviews.Title: “San Juan Retrear”
Reviews.Author: Geoqual
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, service, location, taxis service always available, close to old sun juan and lots of restaurants. Room and accomadations very nice, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree San Juan PR”
Reviews.Author: flyerNewYork
Reviews.Content: Doubletree is rated the number 1 hotel in San Juan and you can tell the instant you arrive at Doubletree. All of the staff from the bottom to the top are there to make your stay the best experience possible. If you have a concern it will be address and corrected as quick as possible. The location is great with plenty of restaurants and shops within a short walk. This hotel also has a sister hotel on the beach that you can use anytime, and it's about a 20 minute walk. We had a large group and everyone enjoyed there stay here. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel, But Not Always Great For Business”
Reviews.Author: johngalt_DC
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location for those visiting San Juan for business: it is not right on the beach, it is surrounded by restaurants and a supermarket, and has very easy access to the expressway. The problem is that sometimes the non-business crowd overwhelms the hotel and it becomes very noisy (i.e., parties in the pool until late, noise in the hallways, etc.) When it's quite, it is great; when it is not, it can be frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms with a modern feel!!”
Reviews.Author: kt-22pounder
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay @ doubletree. Only knock is the location, which is a little over two blocks from the beach. Past that, the rooms were very nice with a nice modern touch.

Reviews.Title: “Loud fans in room; staff don't care”
Reviews.Author: tinybabyrobot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a day in November. The good: The rooms look modern and are very clean. The lobby is also very clean and modern. There is a restaurant adjacent to the property called "Under the Trees" which was very good. The bad: The room we stayed in, Room 801, was a corner room on the top floor. Very nice room but we were surprised at how loud the fans were. The main A/C fan we shut off immediately, but the biggest culprit was the bathroom fan which apparently could not be shut off. This normally wouldn't be a problem except in these rooms the bathroom door is 2 ft from the bed and made of glass - makes for loud bathrooms. We phoned to ask if the bathroom fan could be shut off or if it was 'just that way'. The front desk said that they had to check with maintenance and they'd call us back. We were in the room for 4 hours before going out - no call was made to us. When we came back at night, we phoned around 11pm to ask about the bathroom fan again - they said it was too late to check in to it. I pointed out that I'd phoned earlier about this problem. All I got was a 'sorry, there's nothing we can do now'. The hotel was fully booked. Finally, upon check out, we told the front desk staff the same thing - our room was too noisy. Her response was "what room number?" me: "801"; her: "here's your check out receipt. Thank you. Want a cookie?". They just don't care. Would not recommend unless the price was too good to pass up.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: tjm617
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Double Tree San Juan was excellent! I read many reviews before booking my stay at this hotel, and so many of you were right...this hotel is a great deal. My room was quiet and clean. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The Manager greeted me on arrival after I emailed him to ask a question..the personal touch was appreciated!! Some folks have commented the pool area was not as expected. I found the pool to be terrific. Many small seating areas allowed for privacy and relaxation. My only negative is parking. At $15-20 / day, it feels like a lot of money. I rented a car, but returned it early. All of the excursions I planned had the capacity to pick me up at the hotel. Getting to Old San Juan was an easy $.75 bus ride with no worries of where to park once I got there. Of the excursions I took, the Bio Bay was fantastic!! The guide was wonderful, and the experience was unforgetable. While other hotels may have direct access to the beach, for the price difference, I will walk a bit! I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Eddie5756
Reviews.Content: When we checked in the staff was very welcoming and of course the chocolate chip cookie didn't hurt! The accommodations were very modern and everything was extremely clean. Whenever we encountered a staff member in the hall they always said hello. The two negatives we had are minor - the window treatments block no morning sun so we were up earlier than we had hoped, Went to use the pool and of course the pool cabinet was out of towels so had to go back to the front desk and request.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in the Double Tree”
Reviews.Author: Dave9988
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in September 2011. Great Hotel. Wonderful Staff. Location is wonderful. Right across the street from a 24hr. Supermarket - great food there for Breakfast/Lunch or Dinner. Right on the bus line to Old San Juan. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in a safe environment”
Reviews.Author: Buddy_4226
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at this hotel in the San Juan Metro Area and it is very comfortable and safe. The Staff at this property is the best: front desk, housekeeping, restaurant, and valet parking staff. Always willing to make you feel at home and attend to all your needs in a courteous and efficient manner. Restaurant is a little pricey, but all menu items are well prepared and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Schnieker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, and really enjoyed it. Well kept, comfortable and modern rooms, free wireless throughout and excellent hospitality and service from the staff. Will come back to Doubletree for sure. Oh: and the cookies are really that good.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PEOPLE AT DOUBLETREE HILTON SAN JUAN”
Reviews.Author: KitzB
Reviews.Content: I stayed in DoubleTree in San Juan for two weeks. The staff and management took care of all my needs. Super friendly and efficient staff. Like to thank Peter, Diana, Eliezer, Margarita, Luis and the rest of the staff. Thanks for the assistance and making my stay a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: flutemichael
Reviews.Content: We are staying here for 5 days on a business trip and I have been a guest of many Hilton hotels in the past. I have to say the staff; front desk, restuarant, room service, maid service was by far one of the most outstanding!! Everybody who works in this hotel should be proud of what they bring to the customer experience. Room: The rooms are small but well designed, efficient and the bedding, beds, pillows are fantastic. The bathroom is ultra modern and the use of the space is great! Grocery store across the street and a beautiful beach minutes away. Thank you for making my stay (even while I was working) so fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Red Mansion Party”
Reviews.Author: Marta M
Reviews.Content: My experience was excellent. The hotel location is very good. The hotel and Alquimia Room were very nice and clean. The staff are fantastic and always try to acknowledge you by name. All the activities planned by Sales Department always are fabulous and you had a lot of fun. The food, desserts and drinks are spectacular. The people in charge of Food & Beverage always are very pending to all guests.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed Stay”
Reviews.Author: vandy88
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter & I stayed at the hotel for a week. The staff were very friendly and helpful and remembered information about our preferences. The rooms and facilities were very clean; food was ample and very good. I cannot walk great distances but easily walked to the beach and restaurants, plus a 24 hour grocery is located just across the street. The room had a microwave, refrigerator & safe. I had read some reviews that thought the pool was small. We did not find it to be small at all. My granddaughter (17) enjoyed the pool, hot tub & sunning every day. Taxis were always available within a few minutes of request & we were picked up at our hotel for tours. I would definitely stay again should I travel to San Juan. Both my granddaughter and I greatly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Business/Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: ParadiseBob
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and clean. The room was a little on the small but big enough for the 2 of us. The location was OK. It was close to Ashford Ave. where we spent most evenings. The pool and work out room were nice and clean. The staff was friendly. I would absolutely stay at the hotel again. The only thing that was negative was the self parking. It was a hike from the parking deck to the hotel. I guess I could have paid the extra 5 bucks for valet parking but it wasnâ€™t that much of an inconvenience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need, clean and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Lauren54321
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights and was pleased with the accomodations. It is in walking distance to several cafes/restaurants and directly across the street from a large grocery store. Easy access to the major highways. We appreciated the friendly staff as well. Our room was very modern and clean, if a bit small. The pool area and gym was fine but a bit basic so we decided to take advantage of the hotel's sister property right on the beach (about a mile away).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Doubletree San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: zuriberg
Reviews.Content: We were more than impressed with the fabulous, friendly customer service, the delicious cookies, the expansive pool and the accommodating cleaning staff. It was a joy to stay there and we will definitely be back during our next trip to San Juan. Peter and Nicolas were absolutely delightful and took an interest in our family not only as clients but as people. The kids were enamored and felt very special being guests there. Thanks, Peter and Nicolas! We hope to stay with you again soon ...

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL BUT EXTREMELY OVERRATED”
Reviews.Author: CRY505
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight at this hotel with a group of 28 people on 9/17/11 before taking our cruise the next day from the Port of San Juan. The hotel is very clean but I don't see anything magnificent to specially complement about other than the breakfast was excellent. The hotel rooms are exceptionally small, the pool area and grounds are also very small and the restaurants are expensive. The area around the hotel is not very much to see nor do. The front desk had given some of my guests the wrong rrom type but did accommodate their request after they were informed of the error. The breakfast waitresses and staff was very friendly and attentive. I am not putting down the hotel because it is nice and clean, but based on the ratings I was looking for something much much more! I would probably try another hotel the next time with larger rooms and more restaurants in the area,

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat value, wonderful accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: alguibert
Reviews.Content: I"ve made it known before, my initial criteria as a business traveler are, security, comfortable bed, internet availability, cleanliness. This hotel hits all marks in my opinion, and gives you even more. The hotel itself is well situated in the Condado area of San Juan, and there are many restaurants within easy, safe walking distance. Across the street is a 24-hour supermarket. If you rent a car, the major arteries to all highways is less than a mile away, and the distance to the airport is close as well. I especially liked the layout of the rooms. As a single traveler, the rooms are both large enough, and provide all neccesities such as, wall safe, fridge, microwave, iron, large screen TV, well light working space, and more. For my money, this hotel will be hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: “Like the saying goes, "bueno, bonito, barrato" This is an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DRLieberson
Reviews.Content: The positives: -Good room rates, I paid $95 plus tax per night -Friendly, attentive service -Clean modern rooms -Nice beds -The cookies - whenever you want them, but they are 500 calories each! -Across the street from a 24 hour supermarket (literally 20 steps and you are there) -Microwave AND fridge in your room -They give you pool and beach towels (They even have a beach set they will give you with all that you need for the beach.) Negatives: -The walls are really thin so take some ear plugs if you will be there on the weekend. -Small bathrooms, but very chic -Small rooms, but ask for a corner room they are larger -Wake up calls are not automated so they are not always on time -No airport transfer service but a taxi costs you $18 one way with a fixed fare to/from the San Juan airport. Great place to stay you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: HotelLove88
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! Everyone was friendly and willing to help me with my 1000's of questions. The rooms are on the smaller end but you shouldn't be in your room much if your on vacation! The pool is open 24 hours too! The location is decent even though we spent most of our exploring in old san juan and the beaches! The managers Diana I believe (short spanish woman), Bo and one other male front desk manager who worked on Sunday 10/9/11 were GREAT! This property has a great team! Bebo's cafe is great place to eat that is only a block away for breakfast, lunch and dinner! The beach is about three blocks away and there is a supermarket directly across the street so you can get all your snacks, alcohol and even dinner. If you do not have a rental make sure you are prepared to pay minimum $15 each way for taxi rides... it doesn't matter how close or far that is the cheapest. They have a flat rate, this is the only thing I wish I had known or we would have rented a car. Also, club brava is over-rated! Tijuana's restaurant is a little walk but great food! O and the buses are on strike. But you can catch the trolley for free in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Vessup
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice already, and I am probably going to stay there a third time next month. The hotel is very clean and modern, and the staff is very professional and kind. The hotel is close to restaurants, bakeries, museums, and decent grocery store. The hotel has sent me two surveys to fill out, and the only negative point I've stressed is the quality of the food, at least the room service. I ordered room service during my first stay, which was only a one-night stay. I ordered both dinner and breakfast. For dinner, I ordered filet mignon and fries. The steak was okay, but it was bland. It also could have used a good sear on the sides, in order to develop some flavor and seal in juices, though the steak wasn't too dry, but it had a somewhat rubbery texture. In terms of the portion size, it was a lot of food, but hotel chefs ought to cook more tasty food, especially at the very high price of room service. The cheesecake was okay, not nasty, but not better than the ones I've made myself-I bake for a hobby. Breakfast was disappointing. I ordered the pancakes, which were very small, rubbery, and had a taste that seemed pre-made or made from a mix. Again, I do pancakes at home that come out much better. They do give you a lot of bacon as the side order, though. The tab was quite high for small pancakes of that quality. During my second stay, which was a few nights, I ate no food from the hotel. I ate every day at nearby bakery and at restaurants in Old San Juan. During my next stay, I'll be doing the same because I doubt the quality of the food has improved. However, most important is that the hotel is nice and very comfortable. For now, this is my hotel of choice for San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not impressive”
Reviews.Author: Pmramirezjr
Reviews.Content: Stayed on my first nights on PR. Upon checking in, I was checked into a single bed when I had already paid for a double bed room. When I brought it to management's attention, they first said they didn't have any rooms available. When I produced the print-out receipt, they promptly moved me to a double bed room. Unfortunately, it was a let down. The double bed room size was the same size as a single bed so that meant the toilet was literally 5 feet away from the bed. The bathroom had a sliding door rather than a swinging door. And because it was glass, it magnified all the bathroom sounds to an embarrassing volume. Overall, the room was nicely decorated but very small for PR hotels. The location was OK but at least a 1/4 mile from anything exciting. The lobby is small and so is the pool area. They were constantly out of their famous cookies everyone writes about. The one night we decided to have a nightcap at the bar, they closed early (before 10PM!) If you get a rental car, valet parking each night is $20. You still have to pay $15 if you park it yourself at their lot around the corner. I booked this hotel based on this site's reviews but I didn't experience a #1 hotel vacation. For my trip, it was just average.

Reviews.Title: “The reason why I had a great time...”
Reviews.Author: IceBluePa
Reviews.Content: Ive traveled a few times in the last few yrs, and this is by far the best hotel Ive ever stayed at. Immediately upon check-in, we were helped by Juan, an older gentleman. He was very nice and courteous. He explained everything accordingly and told us about the nearby attractions and places to eat great food. Then,.. comes the signature cookie. AMAZING! I swear I gta order some now just thinking about it. We finally arrived to our room on the 6th floor. The room was not huge but it was very nice and had a modern style. The bed was very comfortable and I was able to get 8-10 hrs of sleep per night, something I dont get often back home. Next to the hotel was the SuperMax de Diego, a 24hr supermarket for all your needs. If you're gna head over there for food, prepare for a long line, but the food was still delish and very cheap. The hotel was a perfect location for everything... the popular Ashford Ave was only a few blocks away, with all the other restaurants and shopping places nearby. You dont necessarily need a car to get to those places since they were in walking distance. But back to the hotel,.. everytime we walked past an employee, they always said hello or good morning, probably the nicest ppl u'll encounter during this trip. The only complaint I have was that early in the morning around 9-930, a few housekeepers would laugh and joke around next door to us, probably loud enough to wake us up a few times. I thought it was guests of the hotel but whenever I opened the door to check, the cleaning cart was outside the door. Besides that, I had a wonderful time and would definitely recommend this place to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Hope to see u Soon again !!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette C
Reviews.Content: Perfect Place !!! Next time I need to stay in a Hotel This is my choice, Service was Excellent ! Had a wonderful stay at this hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived. They gave us tips and suggestions for places to go. Room was clean and comfortable. Free wireless internet access too. The pool and hot tub were enjoyable, and the food at the hotel restaurant was good. Thanks Rosa, Peter, Emilia and Dianne !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome- fabulous customer service!”
Reviews.Author: PJ S
Reviews.Content: We stayed before and after our cruise at Hilton DoubleTree in San Juan..Super clean, great pricing, THE BEST was ANTONIO!! He took great care of our bags, was our consierge, and recommended Cafe SanJuan to eat dinner in Old San Juan.. what an amazing meal and reasonable pricing. The food at the Hotel restaurant is 20 steps away called Under the Trees, They had great food, and the manager even made us a burger before it was lunchtime. Everyone was SO accomodating. The room was impeccable. I would have preferred the layout of the bathroom to have more counterspace- us girls require more room! We were going to stay at El Conquistador, on the east side of Puerto Rico,. Since the ship docks in San Juan, the cabfare back to the cruise ship would have been very high for only one night. Glad we didn't stay there. We did check it out on our way to the Biolumenisence bay kayak, El Conquistador is something to visit for a longer stay. It was like a palace inside. DO NOT MISS the biolumenisence kayak with Eco Tours. They get booked quickly, so do in advance if you can. Peter picked us up at Doubletree, and Antonio hooked us up with him and has known him for years. Peter's knowlege of the bay is amazing. Don't be afraid to kayak in the dark, they do a good job of guiding and there were lots of kayaks on our tour. They took great care of us. Get some bug spray across the street from the hotel at the grocery.They will return you to your hotel . What an amazing trip- we will return to SanJuan!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: ilv2trvl2
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay prior to our cruise. Was undecided if we should stay at the Ritz or the Doubletree. Based on the reviews and the price, we chose the Doubletree and never regretted the decision. Guest services were wonderful!!! "Genesis" at the front desk was exceptional. We truly appreciated the service she provided. Room and location were great. Staff provided suggestions for sightseeing and dining. Will definitely stay at Doubletree again. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “I love it!”
Reviews.Author: myp_13
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay and since you get deal is spectacular! I love the location of the hotel and I have everithing accessible. The rooms are beautifull and very modern....super clean, like all the hotel. All staff are exepcional!!!The atmosphere is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: JettRink1
Reviews.Content: I have been to a few places where the staff simply don't help with finding local hot spots, but this staff here was pretty good. They told us that one restaurant was nice, but every tourist goes there, so we wanted something different. The one we ended up going was awesome. It wasn't 5 star, but a wonderful way of being immersed in the local culture.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Around!”
Reviews.Author: SunnyBoy50
Reviews.Content: This is my second time at The Doubletree by Hilton in San Juan and it's better than the first! The first time was great!!! Special thanks to Peter at the front desk for always willing to help me and others with such professionalism, Eliezer for being kind and always having a great smile and Diane for giving me a cookie every time I asked, and I asked many times. In general, the whole staff rocks. Thanks for making me feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Keith Norris - Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Sal1945
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because I have stayed in the Double Tree Hotels many times over the years. When I checked in the staff were very professional and extra friendly, a young man by the name of Christoper was the person that checked me in, you could not have has a nicer person, and helpful. My stay was the best, every one was so helpful and friendly, from the people at the front desk to the maids, and also the dinning room. I will stay at the hotel again in January 2012 on my next trip

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Hold an Event”
Reviews.Author: Jenni P
Reviews.Content: I echo the comments of others that the Doubletree by Hilton San Juan is great for business travelers. I held a major event here and the the staff (especially Roxy) communicated in a timely manner and provided me with the best customer service. The event space was great and it is directly in view of the main entrance, which makes it easy for guests to identify where to go. Roxy stayed late to greet me and made sure I was all set. Kudos!

Reviews.Title: “Double Tree Puerto Rico - A Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 100percentislandgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Double Tree Hotel in San Juan Puerto Rico from the 8-12 September 2011 and absolutely loved it. The hotel is well mantained, the staff was friendly and the chocolate chip cookie was awesome!!! Yum...... it's so good you almost want to check in again the next day to get another cookie.....anyway moving along.. :-) Upon check-in my room was spanking clean! The rooms are tastefully decorated, modern, and did I say clean? Well I'm saying it again! The food at the Michael's Bistro is tasty, so if you're thinking of dining in, you will not be dissapointed. The hotel is also in a good location, is more or less 10 minutes from the airport, Old San Juan (by bus) and about 5 minutes cab drive from Plaza las Americas (this mall is a treat....a MUST check out). Cabs from the hotel to these locations run you bewteen $15 - $20. All in all, I am extremely happy that I stayed there and will do so again the next time that I am in Puerto Rico. Thanks guys for a great stay! Trinidad!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay.”
Reviews.Author: princessnoleah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree last week on vacation. The hotel is very nice, clean and check-in was seamless. Pool is small but clean. Hot tub in nice too. There is a market across the street, but beware, prices are not like the states. It is about a 5 minute walk to a downtown area where there is another stretch of bars, restaurants and shops. Pinky's is awesome (a local eatery) Its a walk though so be prepared with sneakers. We made use of the LaConcha last few days (their sister hotel) which is about a 10 minute walk but worth it. Way better hotel, pool area (2 of them) and beach. DO NOT eat at the hotels, very expensive. $6.00 a beer and i think one day i paid $9.50 for a Pina Colada. All in all Doubletree was a nice experience, only complaint is they charged us a "resort fee" on our check out day for the week. Next time we visit San Juan we will stay at a resort though. It rained one day and we were stuck in the hotel. Cabs aout there are 20 bucks where ever you go.

Reviews.Title: “Great property”
Reviews.Author: Moconnor4485
Reviews.Content: I would recommend the San Juan Doubletree hotel for anyone traveling ro Puerto Rico. The hotel really caters to the business traveller. It has a very nice breakfast buffet every morning and is conveniently located close to all the major roads in San Juan. In addition it is in Condado which means you are within walking distance to some of the best restaurants in Puerto Rico. This location also means that you are close to the beaches and the airport. The best thing about tre Doubletree is the staff. They are all very friendly and professional. I get the same service at the Doubletree as if I were staying at a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: 00happytraveller00_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a cruise. I had issues with my luggage coming off the ship. The lady at the front desk was empathetic and soothed my anxiety with one of their infamous worm cookies. Everyone we encountered in the hotel were excellent. We dined in the restaurant near the front lobby and it too was top notch. Our room was clean. The first thing we did was have a wolf gang coffee which was better than the average hotel coffee iside our hotel room. The lost luggage was quickly forgotten and we proceeded to have an amazing day in St. Juan. I would definitely stay there again. Thanks to fellow reviewers for making this an easy choice and I definitely concur with the majority of positive reviews.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home”
Reviews.Author: RobertoCofresi
Reviews.Content: Away from the "strip" in San Juan, it is next to a supermarket and has several restaurants to choose from. Need a car if your going sight seeing. More of a local hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ttorres235
Reviews.Content: I was in Puerto Rico for a short trip to visit family. We typically try to stay somewhere nice on either arrival dates and or departure dates. This time we stayed at the Doubletree in Condado. While Doubletree wouldn't have been my first pick I was more than impressed with the Hotel. From the warm cookie at the reception check in to the amazing design in the rooms. The service did not fall short either. To add to this review we where there during the pass through of Huricane Irene, and while most of San Juan was a black-out and under dry law the Doubletree was in fact the most pleasant experience I could have ever imagined. From the friendly face at parking services to the very helpful rest of the staff...it was an experience that makes you want to come back, and we will.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: cindy a
Reviews.Content: My husband and i had the very best experience staying at the hotel: indeed, a gentleman with the name of Peter made our stay wonderful: he has been extremelly helpful in any situation and was always eager to answer questions when we needed the information. Always with a smile and a willingness to help, Peter and also the others (Nicolas, Eliezer, Omar, etc) made our stay very pleasant. To Peter goes the "Oscar of the best host of the year". He deserves whatever promotion or raise he will (we are sure) eventually be entitled to. Also, the room and accomodations were fine and close enought to the beach. Cindy & Rudolf Augustin, room#4008

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for price, good place to stay before or after cruise”
Reviews.Author: sj102
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night at this location before our carribean cruise and we absolutely loved this place. place is very modern and very friendly staff. They have kept the hotel utmost clean, pool and exercise room facility is excellent. We had breakfast buffet in morning and for $16 per person buffet was very good. Place is just two block away from cornando beaches and is in heart of resort area in San Juan. It is about 15 min from airport and about 15 to 18 minutes to Pan American Cruise terminal. Right across is 24 hrs SuperMax and you can get all items including infant needs. We travelled with 14 month old daughter so made few trips there.

Reviews.Title: “Great service @ Double Tree San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Carlos G
Reviews.Content: Well located, great service & amazing gym. All you need to dont miss home

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelist7499
Reviews.Content: Let me just start by saying how much we loved this hotel!! Check in was wonderful and lets hear it for those welcome chocolate chips cookies. Sinfully Delicious!! The rooms were well decorated and came with everything you would need.(fridge, microwave,flat screen etc) I was really impressed with the personalized service we received at this hotel. The front desk staff deserves A+++++. Double tree by Hilton San Juan has definitely spoiled me and we'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Look no further, this is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Fantravelastic91
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a wonderful stay at Double Tree Hilton, San Juan. Of course I read the many reviews on Trip Advisor and had high expectations. All of these expectations were delivered. We were staying here three days prior to our cruise. This was an excellent way to start our vacation. We arrived before check in time around 12:00. Our room was not ready which I anticipated. Grelisse met me with a smile, warm welcome, and warm cookies. She did a pre-check in for us and arranged for the hotel to store our bags. She said it might be an hour to an hour and a half before the room was ready. Not a problem for us because we went to eat lunch. We took a short stroll to Bebo's (recommended by Trip Advisor:). We enjoyed a tasty lunch and returned to the hotel. It had been about an hour. I went back to check the status of our room and was greeted by Bo. Also, very friendly and welcoming. He said it would be a little longer. We enjoyed more warm cookies from him and decided to look around the hotel a bit and the pool area. The pool area was nice. We found a place on the patio where there was a huge chess set. The pieces are plastic and about 2 feet tall. My son and husband started to play a game. Just as they were finishing, Bo came around to let us know our room was ready. We had only waited maybe 20 minutes more. How wonderful that he took the time to come and look for us. The room we had was great overall. It was modern, clean, effecient, and offered nice ammenities. There was a queen bed that was very comfortable and a murphy bed that pulled out of the wall. My son said it was comfortable as well. The room was not large, but was an efficient use of space and fine for us. In the closet was a safe, microwave, and small fridge. We used all of them with no trouble. 2 bottles of complimentary water were left each day for us. We had enough storage for our clothes between drawers, cubbies, and the closet. Lighting was good too.The bathroom was quite modern as well. I thought it was attractive and functioned well for my family. The housekeeper kept us in fresh towels and our room always looked great when we returned from our days adventures. One minor thing the hotel may want to address is the carpet in the room, it was a bit warn. Enough to be noticeable. I believe this hotel was recently renovated. Not sure if the carpet was replaced. I know carpets get a lot of abuse so it could've been newer but got a lot of traffic. (This wouldn't deter me from returning, just a note for management.) The one curious thing was that the thermostat in our room was set pretty cool so we moved it to 80. (The highest it would go.) It never felt like 80, it was pretty cold, so we called for an extra blanket. Literally, the blanket arrived at our door 5 minutes after I placed the call to housekeeping. That's service! When we would return to our room at the end of the day we'd turn the A/C off and it would warm up, then we'd put it back at 80 and we'd be good for sleeping.
