(Being from Florida we keep our thermostat 78- 80 most of the time). We never had to wait long for an elevator either. When we would pick up our rental car from the valet, Sammy would always greet us with a smile and familiar recognition. We never waited long for our car either. (Valet parking was included in our package. Highly recommend, because I believe it's $20 a day.) Also, I recommend renting a car (Avis was great) and renting a GPS to get around the island. We drove to Old San Juan, El Yunque, Luquillo, and Fajardo. We had no difficulties getting around. On our first night, Peter at the front desk gave us a wonderful dinner recommendation. (Marisqueria Atlantica-see restaurant review). He was right on the mark about the food, price, ambiance, etc. The hotel lobby has a fabulous chocolate shop. We tried out a few one evening, yum! We also, enjoyed complimentary breakfast at the hotel. (Included in our package) The food was satisfying and helped start our day on the right foot. We never had to wait for a table. They would seat us immediately and then we would help ourselves to their tasty buffet. They had many things to choose from (hard boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, omlettes made to order, bacon, sausage, pancakes, french toast, fresh fruit (usually cateloupe, honeydew, and/or watermelon), cereal, oatmeal, bagels, toast, and english muffins. I may have missed something, but you get the idea. I did not care for their scrambled eggs (hard and dry), so I opted for the omlette made to order which was delicious. Everything else I tried was great. (The scrambled eggs may have been a fluke.) Others ate them and seemed content. The coffee was wonderful too. The only minor thing I wish they had offered were pastries or muffins of some kind. (My son's favorite) Every morning they had complimentary coffee in the lobby which was great! We had some each morning before we came for breakfast. We tried the in room coffee but the lobby's one was much better. I used the business center a few times to retrieve addresses for our GPS and get some info. There were three computers available and a printer. All of which worked great and I didn't have to wait for one to become available. We also borrowed their beach chairs and beach towels that were available to guests. They came in handy at Luquillo beach. (They have a soft sided cooler if you need as well. We had brought our own.) Another nice thing was utilizing the facilities at their sister resort, La Concha. We got a letter from the front desk letting La Concha know we are guests at the Double Tree and that we would be enjoying some time at their facility. We self parked our car at La Concha. ($4.00 first hour, then $3.00 each hour). We enjoyed their infinity pool that looked out on the beach, along with use of their towels and chairs. The front desk was very welcoming to us as well. They set up an account for you so that if you want to charge something you can. Another bonus was the grocery store across the street. We were able to get drinks to take with us when we went out for the day and a much needed rain poncho. We also bought food for dinner one night. I utilized the microwave in the room. The staff at this hotel were truly delightful and seemed to enjoy their job. They were very approachable and helpful. Customer service is obviously a priority. This hotel was a great home base for us. If you are looking for beachfront, look elsewhere. Otherwise, this is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: MichaelJamesLexKY
Reviews.Content: Arrived the day before our cruise. Loved the property! Very modern motif. Beautiful pool area. Rooms are small but very well organized and tastefully decorated. The staff was very friendly. You can bet that we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice but small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: majones7
Reviews.Content: Pros: Modern and upgraded everything. The room and the hotel property itself were immaculate. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Cons: Small room (of course I do realize I choose the least inexspensive rate), but the room was the smallest that I have stayed in this year (50 + nights). In general I would probably stay again and I did rest peacefully and experiences no issues at all during the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very surprising!!”
Reviews.Author: cpatte
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of taking 52 women to San Juan, PR in Janunary 2011. We stayed at the Doubletree. When we arrived and went to our rooms, we were very surprised that the double rooms had beds that came out of the wall. just rember that I had 52 women, all I could hear was ....where is the other bed?? Although it was not what we thought we were getting, we still had a ball, and the hotel more than made up for the misunderstanding. The hotel was nice, all staff were pleasant, and we all enjoyed our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Hurricane Irene”
Reviews.Author: dgpr07
Reviews.Content: Ok so as custom here in Puerto Rico when a hurricane comes along and the lights go out , tv and air condition we locals tend to run to near hotels, that's why hurricane is good for business. Anyways last night we stayed in the intercontinental hotel in Isla Verde and we did not like it at all , out dated rooms, bad food, super expensive $70.00 for two club sandwich can you believe and $370.00 per night, anyways to make a long story short. When we got back home electricity still had not come back so we decided to stay out one more night so we came across doubletree and I must say what a difference!! I wish I would had known the previous night anyways great nightly rate!! beautiful, modern, fashionable, clean, very very nice facilitys staff did their job efficiently love the room, beautiful modern bathrooms, I really recommend this place two thumbs up. Now, on the downside I did not find the place to be a family friendly environment, I was not received or assisted in the parking entrance by the parking staff, i had to approach him after unloaded everything from the car, on my way inside the lobby you have to go thrue what it seems like a outside entrance porch or what it seems to me a smoking spot for big Cuban cigars right thrue the entrance, to get to the restaurant you have to go thrue the Smoking infested full of drunk Bar . So you can see it's a hotel focus more on the executive business with pleasure type of client but with potential of so much more by just twikking and redirecting a few things here and their. Overall is a great option if your staying in San Juan on a business trip or just visiting with friends oh and last but not the least You truly have to try the chocolate cookies simply out of this world delicious!,!,!,!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Timeout_NY
Reviews.Content: This was our first family vacation. We were in three different rooms. Everything about the Doubletree was excellent. The check-in was flawless. Two of the rooms were next to each other and the third room was a balcony room (or patio room) right off the pool and hot tub. Upon arrival we each received warm chocolate chip cookies -- what a wonderful way to begin the vacation. Our stay was six nights/five days. The rooms were clean and the housekeeping staff accommodating. There are three restaurants and the food is soooo good in each restaurant. (Silk Restaurant has the best Chinese food that you can imagine.) There was also a local restaurant that had some of best local food in two block away. The workout room although small was open 24 hours a day. The pool and hot tub was also available 24 hours a day. They had a very large Connect Four game and chess game on the grounds. The hotel is a short walk to the beach and there is a 24 hour supermarket across the street. The hotel had free Internet access but there was also a small business center giving guests access to a few computers and printer. I would definitely stay at the Doubletree by Hilton San Juan again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “AMAAAAZING AND CONVENIENT!!!”
Reviews.Author: nicole c
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel thru expedia I think and it was about 85.00 dollars for one night and well worth it! My hubby and I arrived from newark nj after a delayed flight of 4 hours. We were in a terrible mood because we came one day early just to do the bio-bay tour in vieques but because of our delayed flight our tickets were resold ;-( However, when we arrived at the hotel the front desk recommended that we perused the tour book in our rooms which we did, we called all the tours and they were ALL BOOKED UP, about two hours later we received a call that there were two cancellations and we would be going to bio-bay! After receiving this wonderful news, we wanted to celebrate! We went downstairs to the bar and got a sippy sip, great service and hospitality. The hotel itself is very pretty the lobby is chic, the pool and jacuzzi relaxing, and the rooms really modern, and clean! I think my favorite part of this hotel were the WELCOME COOKIES!!!! THEY were amazing, soft and chewy. After coming back from fajardo bio-bay we asked some of the staff great spots to party and they gave us at least 5 options, we ended up grabbing a late night dinner at a diner right up the street called Diana's and went to sleep, no party that night. The next day we decided to book "el yunque rainforest tour" it was 8:00 in the morning and we were tired, but heard so much about el yunque that we HAD to do it, we called the front desk and within 10 minutes they booked a tour for us, we got dressed in 15 minutes and went on the tour, and it was worth it. When we came back we went across the street to the 24 hour grocery store and got some last minute toiletries before leaving for our cruise, talk about convenience. This place sells everything including alcohol 24/7. We're not even drinkers but when you're on vacation this comes in handy! ' Hands down this hotel was great, in fact if I come back to puerto rico again, we are staying here, it's right in the heart of down town, the staff is SUPER FRIENDLY AND HELPFUL, the cookies are delicious, the rooms are modern and clean and I like the restaurant, bar, and patio outside, and although we never made it there, the beach is only a couple of blocks away and they even have a mini-fridge!!!...86 dollars well spent!!

Reviews.Title: “Management needs to get its act together”
Reviews.Author: IanAberdeen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern, clean and comfortable, but is a little way from the restaurants in the tourist areas of Condado and old San Juan and from the Convention Centre. The restauraunt offers a fixed price buffet for breakfast. If you want anything else, even something simple from the menu, be prepared for a long wait - 20 to 30 minutes when they seem to be busy. Better staff management might produce faster service; there seem to be a lot of staff wandering around in an unorganised manner. The daily housekeeping was erratic in terms of what received attention, and what was replaced - but that's not uncommon in more expensive American hotels. Reception/check out seems to be similarly disorganised - but that is partly the company's fault. I had a reservation for 8 nights, part covered by HHonors points, part pre-paid, and one night covered by a certificate for a free night's stay. I had a single reservation confirmation from the Hilton central reservation service, but the hotel's IT system still treated it as 3 separate reservations, gave me bill at the end of each one, and ignored the fact that I expected to use the certificate. I handed in the certificate when I checked out, but the room charge and taxes were charged to my credit card. Why do Americans think they can teach the world how to become managers?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: vamartinez05
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect! Staff, location, pool and quality was excellent. I can see why this is rated #1 on tripadvisor. We plan to come back to Puerto Rico and stay here. We also recommend it allthe time when people tell us they are going.

Reviews.Title: “As good as all the reviews said”
Reviews.Author: The_McSmiths
Reviews.Content: Booked with advanced payment rate through Hilton and got better price than anywhere around. What you got for the price was incredible! Plus they didn't even charge for bottled waters in the room or internet! This hotel lived up to all the good ratings it has. The dÃ©cor was very modern and beautiful. The room was very well laid out and we had plenty of room for 4 people to stay in one room. The murphy bed was very comfortable. Plus, it had a microwave & frig that were nice. The hotel is right across the street from a large supermarket if you want to keep drinks in your frig or need anything. The pool area was beautiful. Not a large pool but plenty big for the number of people there. They had plenty of computers to use and even a printer so you could check-in to flights and print boarding passes. They had a kiddie pool, adult pool, waterfalls and a hot tub (although that was too hot to use!). The fitness area looked nice too although we didnâ€™t use that. The service was incredible! We got cookies when we checked in. Check-in wasnâ€™t until 3 pm, but we got there at 11 am because we had gotten off a cruise and they got our room ready in less than an hour allowing us to check in early and enjoy the rest of our day. We were able to get a taxi right out front of the hotel and head down to Old San Juan for the rest of our day. When we had to get to the airport, a taxi was there ready to take us. The bell-hop (Antonio) was extremely nice and helpful. Everyone at the hotel would help you with anything you needed. When I read all the wonderful things about this hotel, I was worried that it wouldnâ€™t live up to it, but it was wonderful! My entire family had nothing but great things to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff was great”
Reviews.Author: Leo595
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Doubletree was excellent. The rooms were very nice, clean, and large, including the convenience of a microwave, fridge and safe. All of the hotel employees were extremely friendly and helpful, with special thanks to Genesis, Robert, Juan and Nicolas. The hotel had a nice pool and lounging areas. The hotel computers (5 in total) worked very well. Overall the hotel had an impressive design and decor (lobby and rooms). We would definitely stay again. We would highly recommend you ask for your authorization to visit La Concha Resort (Doubletreeâ€™s sister hotel) which is approx a 20 minute walk. You get to enjoy all the splendid benefits offered at La Concha resort, like: private, beach, towels, chairs, umbrellas, awesome pools and lounge areas. You can even charge your room at the Doubletree for any lunch or other purchases at La Concha. And all this for a third of the price....without settling for much less comfort or style! The Doubletree is located across from a large grocery store, which has anything and everything you could need. In terms of site seeing- we suggest visiting Old San Juan. The streets and shops are very quaint and a pleasure to stroll through. Seeing the Fort Cristobal in Old San Juan is also suggested, as it is an historic landmark. We donâ€™t recommend visiting the Rain Forest. We found that it was not as grand or impressive as they hyped it up to be...save your $62 per person and spend it somewhere else. If you are into shopping, then you should visit Plaza Las Americas which is the largest mall in the Caribbean, however I did not personally find it any different than shopping in any other mall in the USA, however the mall was very nice and large. In terms of restaurants, I would definitely recommend you visit Mojitoâ€™s in Old San Juan for some authentic Puerto Rican Mofongos. They are a 3 inch plantain pate filled with your choice of pork, beef, chicken, or crab....I recommend the chicken and pork... prices are reasonable (approx $15-20/person). Another restaurant is Cafe Beboâ€™s in Condado; its prices are very reasonable and its food is pretty good â€“ try the Alcapurrias â€“they are a deep fried breaded beef stuffed appetizer that is delicious, especially dipped in the mayo-ketchup sauce. If you want to spoil yourselves with gourmet experience, visit Niche restaurant also in Condado. Niche is in the Acacia hotel. It is a small, romantic restaurant; however it is on the pricey side. ($50-$60/person). We recommend the mussel, and mango salad for appetizers and the lamb for the entree. You can easily share these plates with 2 people. Hope you enjoy PR as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Great home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: okevin
Reviews.Content: My video crew and I stayed here for a month on a job. The hotel was very forgiving of our dragging lots of equipment in and out everyday at all hours of day and night. They were always helpful and supportive. The 24 hour pool and fitness area was great, as we work odd hours. Guest laundry on site, and 24 hour supermarket across the street. This was great with 4 of us and only 1 car. Good restaurants easily walkable, beach also walking distance. Can't say enough about how friendly and helpful the staff was. Come stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Tasteful as their signature chocolate chip cookie!”
Reviews.Author: Catguy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in San Juan many times before, but not in this hotel because I can always find rates for under $100 at other locations in the Condado area. This particular location was not of my interest because it was a bit confusing for me to get around in my car and find the hotel, more so the parking area. It so happened that I wanted to catch a theater show in Hato Rey and this was the hotel with the closest location. We booked a one night stay and were suprised with what we found. The lobby area was as refreshing as a tropical forest and the furniture in the sitting area was perfect to give a nice ambiance to the hotel. Upon arriving at the front desk you get a glimpse of decadent fine chocolate treats just waiting to be purchased at the mini store inside the hotel! The front desk agents were very quick and efficient with the check-in and we were asked if this was our first time here...of course it was! We were also briefed on the hotel facilities and services. Finally, the moment I was curious about and expecting came...the free chocolate chip cookies which they claim to be the best in the world! Nice and warm in a cute little brown paper bag! So soft and moist they can break easily in your hands! I knew about the cookie because I read it on the internet. We went up to our room and were amazed and the modern furnishings and the colors chosen to decorate the room which in a peculiar way reminded me of, lol, coffee and chocolates! The view was very nice on that high floor. The room had very modern decor which we liked very much and was extremely clean. We enjoyed our night here and were tempted to stay another night, but we'll be back in October for another show! In spite that this rate is more than what I pay at other great hotels in Condado, I would not mind staying here again. It was close to Bebo's, a dining facility near the hotel, and there is a 24 hour supermarket across the street. The only negative thing I can say is the room coffee brand is horrible. Ug! They should change that brand and use one of the many delicious local coffee brands produced on the island and are some of the best in the world! Nothing beats real Puerto Rican coffee with the Doubletree Signature Chocolate Chip Cookie!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Murray3553
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here and had a great time. It was the perfect location for day trip to Old San Juan and the beach. The room was very clean and modern. There is a supermarket across the street for drinks and snacks for your travels. The staff had good tips for things to do and places to go outside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, excellent hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: yieldmap
Reviews.Content: Omar was a huge help in guiding us around San Juan. Excellent experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Seminars”
Reviews.Author: Klldzr69
Reviews.Content: We held a 3 day seminar for our S. American dealers at the hotel. Meeting room, food & beverage, overall experience was one of our best so far. Most of all, the staff was not only efficient, but went out of their way to accommodate and let us know we were special to them. They treated 'everyone' of our attendee's like this. We've held 9 of these sessions globally in the past year, all at Hilton brand hotels. This by far was our best overall experience. Our sincerest thanks goes out to this hotel and its professional staff!

Reviews.Title: “Double the Comfort at Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: lilcruz77
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the gorgeous lobby of the Doubletree San Juan around 4pm, after self-parking our rental in the adjacent garage for $15 a day. The friendly receptionist checked us in very quickly and handed us our room keys with 2 of the most delicious chocolate chip cookies I've ever tasted! More cookies are available for purchase in the lobby. The knowledgable bellman escorted us to a spacious corner room awaiting us on the 4th floor, overlooking the swimming pool. He told us everything in the room was Free! That included internet access, 2 water bottles per day, Wolfgang Puck coffee, travel magazines and bathroom toiletries. Our room was accommodated with: a cozy queen sized bed, flat screen TV mounted on the wall, mini-fridge, coffee maker, hair drier, safe, iron and full sized ironing board. My favorite feature about the room was all the open counter space. I definitely recommend staying at the Doubletree on your next visit to San Juan, PR. P.S. For the best local food in all PR, take a 2-minute walk to Bebo's Cafe. I ordered the Mofongo de Yuca con Hueyes. Â¡Buen provecho!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: grand dutchess
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Doubletree the day before our cruise was to set sail. I had read the reviews on Tripadvisor and was happy to see that everyone was on target. This is a great hotel with even greater staff. A "shout out" to Genesis, Antonio, and Samuel to name a few. Nothing was too much trouble. The staff take great pride in their hotel and are very service oriented. The hotel itself is outside of Old San Juan but a quick cab ride away. The room was very "Ikea" like to me but I like that look. The bed was extremely comfortable and the black out shades were great. We did not have any meals or drinks at the hotel rather opting for local cuisine. We ate at Bebo's for dinner and had breakfast the next morning at a local bakery. It was all good. They let us have late check-out the day we were to leave on the cruise which was very nice. There is also a grocery store right across the street if you want to stock up on things you may need. We bought a case of bottle water for $4.89 which we took on the cruise with us. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again and I got a great AAA rate.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay at DoubleTree Again!"”
Reviews.Author: Michelle028
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the DoubleTree hotel on July 2nd. We stayed on the 4th floor facing the pool. It was a smaller room than North America standards. But it was clean and comfortable. The staff was superfriendly - especially Diana at the front desk who checked me in and gave me directions to a local restaurant around the corner from the hotel- Bebo's cafe, She also helped answer my questions about the surrounding area. the hotel has a very small pool. But the area is clean. We stayed for a 1 night pre-cruise. We paid about $20 to the PAN AM (for Royal caribbean) cruise pier. I would definitely stay again next time I am in San Juan! tips: There is free wifi at the hotel and 2 computers you can use in the front lobby. There is also a great 24 supermarket across the street with a payphone. It was 50 cents for 10 min to call Canada (cheaper than using my cellphone!)

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: mgraced
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Doubletree San Juan twice now. This is a great hotel with excellent service for the business traveler. Not quite a resort which is perfect for business. Rooms are nicely decorated, comfortable and very functional with plenty of electrical outlets. Staff is very helpful and very friendly. Has a great gym. Never used the pool although it looks small. I love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Doubletree in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Lorien77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after coming back from a cruise and it was a really nice hotel. The facilities are modern and clean and our room was very chic. We didn't explore the neighborhood, and it didn't seem very nice, but we did walk across the street to the little grocery store to pick up a few things (stuff is cheaper there than in the lobby store) We enjoyed the hot tub and the pool as well as hearing the frogs at night. It's not in the nice, old part of San Juan, but you can take a cab there.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice set-up”
Reviews.Author: Shawn90
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in June for 4 nights. The room was great. The staff was very helpful, courteous, and professional. I got my daily cookie and had a wonderful breakfast each day at the hotel. Nothing but rave reviews for this place. It is located along a bus line that takes you into Old San Juan in about 20 minutes for $.75 one way and has a grocery store located right across the street. Our group also walked down a block to Bebo's Cafe and had a great meal. High recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good but service not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: lewisam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a pre cruise night in April and booked it based on the reviews. The location was fine but on arrival at 2.30 we were told our room wasn't ready but were given the famous warm Hilton cookies which I must admit were good ! We sat in the foyer and having gone back to reception on a number of occassions eventually got into our room at 4.30 - the sun had then gone off the pool area. They had taken our cases and said they would get them up to us immediately and we then waited nearly an hour for the cases to come. The room was nice and had a murphy bed but was on the small side. We had an evening meal at under the trees which was lovely and resonably priced. When we got back to the hotel and pulled the murphy bed down it didn't have any bedding. We again rang down to reception who said they would bring bedding to us and eventually turned up an hour later with sheets !!! We were all tired by this point and as it was warm my sons just slept with sheets. Overall OK but the small hold ups on the room, luggage and then bedding spoilt it a bit for me and I would probably not return.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating staff, fine accommodations”
Reviews.Author: nedhop
Reviews.Content: We were among the first half-dozen passengers to debark our cruise ship after a seven-night, six-day Caribbean cruise. That put us at this hotel a little after 6:30am. We had reservations for that night. Despite the hotel's posted check-in time of 3:00pm, almost the first words out of the desk clerk's mouth were "Your room is ready." We were in the room by 7:15am. That room was spacious and well appointed: large safe, Wolfgang Puck coffee and coffeemaker, good-sized bathroom (shower only), quiet and well-functioning a/c, and comfortable king-sized bed.with eight(/1) pillows. The location is not the hotel's best selling point: it's about six blocks from the beach and a US$15 (pre-tip) cab ride to the Old City. It is, however, in an upscale residential neighborhood with several good restaurants nearby and a Suiper Max (supermarket) across the street. We were in the small main or original building in what is a large complex (about 160 rooms in addition to the 24 in our building). Also in the complex is an office building and at least four restaurants at which meals may be changed to one's room. One, Silk, is "Asian fusion" and serves near-gourmet cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: dwelling
Reviews.Content: As others have said,,,,,,, Lovely property, very nice staff, great location. Was very relaxing atmosphere & quite accesible to what ever your plans required.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed........”
Reviews.Author: kasualtravler
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Doubletree base upon the reviews and location. I have to say we were pleased with the room but extremly disappointed with the staff. Upon arrival, the front desk staff was not welcoming. They were talking in a group and did not pay any attention to us until we asked to be checked in. We already planned several excursions but wanted additional information regarding the city and restaurant options. The guy checking us in said that someone will give us a packet....not sure who that someone was because we never received one. In addition, he gave us our key and told us our room was past the elevator. The problem is, by design, the elevator is out of sight. So we had to ask where and he just pointed his finger in a direction. The room overall was clean. The house keeping staff does a sub-par job cleaning the room. Throughout our stay, they did not replace the face, hand towels, and did not restock the soap. We called the front desk to request additional housekeeping items and did not receive them (we were told they would bring them to our room on both occasions). As stated, the room was clean but the staff is not friendly or helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Superb choice in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: gsa_and_av
Reviews.Content: We couldn't agree more with what other reviewers have said about the Doubletree San Juan. Here are some additional thoughts/comments: 1. The photographs posted on their website accurately represent the actual accomodations--no surprises after check-in. 2. There is a great supermarket right across the street for quick snacks or picnic lunches. 3. The hotel staff are helpful and friendly. 4. On-site restaurants/bars are a great bonus. 5. Self-parking, despite being $15 per day, is pretty hassle-free (watch out for roaches in the underground parking!!). 6. Hotel is pretty easy to locate after you become familiar with the San Juan highways. We would definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “In typical fashion a good Doubletree experience”
Reviews.Author: fmkyfc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our trip to Puerto Rico as we wanted a place that is not too far and not too near the airport. We just finished a stay at St Regis Bahia beach and will be going to Viequez for a week so wanted a non beach location that is convenient to the airport. Overall happy with the stay. Plus for us is that they allowed us to store our baggage while we hop to Viequez for a week and retrieve it on our returning stay. I have been trying to find a place to do this since planes to Viequez are typicaly light and small you are limited in what you can bring on. In the case of Cape Air we were allowed a max of 20Kg. So it was a kind of a blessing that we could do this. Secondly the coin operated laundromat was also great as we could wash our clothes for our onward journey. Third there is a 24 hour large super market just across the street. For this three thing it is alone worth the stay. If you are looking for a place to stay with facilities then this is not for you as there are no beaches , pool is somewhat small and really nothing much to do. But for short stay and in transit this is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for cruise option night”
Reviews.Author: TravelNut70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree after going on a cruise. Hotel is very clean and in a good location to walk to restaurants and even has a nice grocery store across the street to buy items to eat/drink in the rooms. Rooms come with refrig so it does help with costs. Check in was very good. Room was nice and clean. Bathrooms are a bit small but still nice for the one night we stayed. They have a small bar and restaurant. We had a couple drinks but did not eat there. Pool is clean but pretty small if the hotel has alot of people using it. A few rooms that open out to the pool with balconies but otherwise there are no other balconies at the hotel. I had booked a balcony but the room was not ready so I took another. I am glad I did as there is no privacy for the balcony sitting right next to the pool. Overall a nice place to stay a night or two pre or post cruise as the hotel offers a good value and is easy to come and go from.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise hotel, will be back in 2012”
Reviews.Author: CTRebel13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here between April 30 and May 1. The front desk staff was professional, courteous, and helpful when it came to answering questions about the area, sightseeing, restaurants, market, etc. We loved the warm cookies we received at check-in. They were delicious. It was nice that there was a grocery store across the street. Nice and convenient for a few things we forgot to pack. While our room was small, it was set up perfectly. Loved the shower, the beds were very comfortable. Plenty of storage space. There was no noise in the evening or overnight and the hotel was rather busy. Breakfast was delicious and we felt satisfied with plenty of choices to chose from. We were only staying for a pre-cruise nights stay. We did not get to use the pool as we were too tired. Same with the fitness center. We were more than satisfied with this hotel. There were plenty of hotel choices that were more expensive and we are glad we picked this one due to the great reviews here on TripAdvisor. We will be booking this hotel for next April as well and may just book for 2 nights just because we enjoyed the hotel so much.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacations!!!”
Reviews.Author: Niev
Reviews.Content: Great service!!! Super clean hotel! Comfortable bathrooms! Cute and modern rooms! Nice restaurants! They give u personalized service! And delicious cookies!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: travel770
Reviews.Content: We went to San Juan during the christmas vacation in 2010. We chose this hotel because the price was fair and due to the great reviews. All the other "good" hotels that are located on the beach were charging at least twice the price. (As we went for 9 days, it made a big difference). So first the negative, the room was a bit small, there is no balcony and the windows won't open. The no balcony part bothered me more than I thought it would. (they have only a few rooms with a patio, try to get those ones) Apart from that, this hotel is great. The people at the front desk were all super nice, Peter, Raphael... The cleaning lady Karine was great. The serviceman Gerald, was amazing. Really this hotel takes customer service seriously. The location is right across the street from a supermarket open 24 hours, very convenient. There is a bus that takes you directly to old San Juan. The beach is not far. The hotel is affiliated with 2 other hotels were you can spend the day. First the courtyard by Marriott, which after spending the day there, we were really happy that we did not book there. The hotel looks old and the noise from the planes did bother me. The beach there was ok. As for the 2nd hotel, I forgot the name, that was a nice hotel worth going to spend the day there. Again doubletree hilton is a great hotel if you'd rather spend your money on outings. One more thing, we drove to ponce one day and arrived at the hilton hotel over there, told them we were staying at the doubletree in San Juan and they let us use their pool for the day.

Reviews.Title: “dreaming of still being there!”
Reviews.Author: Ruby_travels_888
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel - the staff couldn't do enough to help out: lending us umbrellas when it was raining, giving us a couple of extra cookies on the second night ''because they are also wet weather cookies''! The rooms are beautifully furnished, the beds are heavenly comfortable and the shower is amazing! One thing I would say is that a queen room has a standard double bed in - not the usual gigantic beds you find in mainland US hotels. And the bathroom door is frosted glass and directly next to the bed, so there is a lack of privacy there from your partner! I didn't see the larger rooms, perhaps these have a different design. A taxi to old San juan is $15 from the hotel or you can get the bus from outside for 75c!

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected!!”
Reviews.Author: lulufl
Reviews.Content: We were there for a full week. The whole staff was amazing. They genuinely care about their guests. Robert and Margarita especially. But each and every staff member was professional and helpful!! The price was better through Expedia.com. We were blown away by the value of our room and the hotel. We loved the hot tub and the pool. It was not crowded and they provided us with pool towels and showers. We LOVED our stay there. Location was not bad either!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great room”
Reviews.Author: techdeviant
Reviews.Content: I totally loved having the 24 hour grocery store across the street. We were also close enough to walk to the beach and restaurants in Condado. The Rain sushi restaurant next door was excellent. The rooms also have microwaves, coffee makers, and a refrigerator which is great too. We opted for the poolside room with a balcony. Unfortunately it rained the whole time we were there and didn't get an opportunity to use the pool; the hot tub was excellent though. The room was clean and comfortable and spacious enough for just the two of us. The only thing I didn't like was that our room was not ready at noon, but official check in time is not until 4pm so its not like I didn't expect it. I also didn't like that self-parking is not immediately obvious. We just parked in the valet parking but were told on check in that self parking is around the corner and is a little bit cheaper. Pros: great comfortable room for a better price than many of the fancier hotels nearby Cons: wish we could have checked in earlier than 4pm.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: iamjonk
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was close to work and I was really happy with it. It was new, clean and best of all the service was incredible. Every employee that I came in contact with was very gracious and approachable. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “I love love love this hotel and staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wit1972
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of DoubleTree San Juan for a variety of reasons; near the beach, great view, great food in and near hotel! I'm most impressed with the excellent level of individualized customer service, friendly staff and the smiles! During some trips, I had noticed an allergy to the detergent being used on the sheets and towels. During a chat with the Hotel Manager, I inquired on if they could use a different detergent. He apologized and shared that the vendor probably wouldn't fulfill that request, however, he made a commitment to me on the spot. Let them know in advance of my arrival and they would personally wash some sheets and towels in allergen free detergent and my room would be ready for my arrival! It's been the best experience I've had with a hotel EVER! I will return to this hotel every chance I get when I visit San Juan. They're absolutely the BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: geme406
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and the friendliest hotel staff I have ever met. My wife is in the travel industry and we have stayed at many hotels, the staff at Doubletree San Juan rates as the best. Good location, the 24 hour market across the street is a bonus along with use of all facilities at the La Concha Resort, a short 10 minute walk, just ask for the letter of introduction at front desk in Doubletree. Anytime we visit San Juan it's the Doubletree for us

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: jodibiggar
Reviews.Content: We ended our trip in Puerto Rico in this beautiful hotel because we wanted to be pampered a little after staying in various B&Bs. We were not disappointed. The staff was excellent, the beds were comfortable, and I very much recommend the local restuarant around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel but a bit far out”
Reviews.Author: magsw
Reviews.Content: we were welcomed by Bo the hotel manager who upgraded us to a garden/pool view room for our pre cruise stay it was very comfortable but the coffee maker didnt appear to work after several attempts we found it was the electricity supply ......it wasnt fixed whilst we were in room 203 all in all the hotel is great and the staff also but i think it was a bit far away from condado/the old town or the port

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Service great. Location could be better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Service great. Food good. Location could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing All Around”
Reviews.Author: Justineey2008
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in San Juan and I stayed five days with my family. This hotel and hotel staff was amazing. The best experience I have had at any hotel. Everyone is super friendly, always with a smile on their faces and kindly greeting you. The location is perfect. A great price. The cookies are awesome! Thank you to Jerry and Tyler and everyone eles who gave me great advice on where to go and how to get there!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Customer Service - Long Review Needed :)”
Reviews.Author: as_i_c_it_2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome, it has to be the best doubletree hotel you will ever visit. and one of the best hotels in its star rating worldwide. This was my first trip to San Juan and i stayed for a week and had the pleasure to meet most of the hotels workers. I Must say everyone was extremly nice; and it wasnt a fake forcefull nice because there were working (like many hotels). You can easily tell the management of this hotel has done a great job in creating an enjoyable atmosphere for thier employees, in turn the hotel guests get treated extremly good. Just a few reasons why I enjoyed my stay. 1) Me and my girlfirend really didnt plan much before going, but we knew what we wanted to do and it was alot. I called downstairs to inquire about tours and places I Can drive to etc.. Genesis @ front desk asked me a few questions and said to give her a few min. and shell get back to me. After about 15-20 min she called us to come to the front desk she had called different places to check location, prices and availibility on short notice. she spent a good amount of time with us literally making a pen and paper timeline scedule for us for the next four days. We did alot of activites. Thank You Genesis. 2) Driving in PR is a hassle unless you know where you are going. You cant rely on your gps, especially using addresses. etc.. mine worked somewhat better with gps coordinates. But at this hotel they knew I wanted to drive everywhere after assiting like 5 times a day with directions(over the phone aswell|) so one of the managers gave me his card and wrote his personal number on there aswell in case I really get crazy lost. 3) I was partying in the evening and doing all activities during the day so beileve me I really left the room in a mess everyday. And housekeeping really did do a through job everyday cleaning up. 4)Across a 24 hr supermarket u can get everything you need from. 5) Rooms were smaller but really clean and clam and cozy feel. The Only thing was the location: It is not in Old San Juan. it is not in Candado and it is not on a beach. but it is fairly close. so we didnt mind at all. but it was conviently close to the highway which pretty make taes youallover PR. so thats good. BTW if you going PR make sure you go take the farry to go to femenco beach http://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g580453-d147939-Reviews-Flamenco_Beach_Playa_Flamenco-Culebra_Puerto_Rico.html

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: mpep86
Reviews.Content: Just stayed on my honeymoon this may. Service is very friendly and accommodating. Clean. Decent neighborhood. Close to beach. Didn't know it when I booked but the hotel gives you access to la conche. Only 20 min walk away. Nice private beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Home Base, But Bring Your Walking Shoes”
Reviews.Author: platinumblonde
Reviews.Content: Don't fret about the view from the hotel, the Doubletree is a nice hotel that serves as a great home base for all that Condado and San Juan have to offer. Every thing in the Condado beach is a short walk away. Take advantage of the Doubletree not being on the beach by walking around the corner and dining at Bebos Cafe for excellent & affordable Puerto Rican food. The super market across the street does come in handy for sunscreen, water, snacks, and alcohol. If you choose to stay in at the hotel one night, the hotel bar serves up a mean mojito. The hotel staff was very nice, but we did have a problem with our keys being deactivated every time the staff cleaned our room, but that was only a minor annoyance that was always addressed quickly.

Reviews.Title: “We love the front desk staff!”
Reviews.Author: beautifulblee_11
Reviews.Content: The room was modern but small. It only accommodates about 2.5 people. Move up to 3 and it's a no-go. In addition, walking to the center of Condado took about 20 minutes while Old San Juan was accessible only by car, bus or taxi. The pool was refreshing but the hot tub was a little cold. The restaurants in the hotel have delicious food (not too pricey) and the coffee was great. The front desk staff was terrific and PETER was the host with the most! He made miracles happen with last minute reservations for excursions and suggestions on where to go out. If you don't mind being "off the beaten path" this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone associated with the Double Tree became my family (familia)”
Reviews.Author: mariacrivera
Reviews.Content: My purpose for the trip was to bring my aging father, 90, home to the states with me and so my bear of a son met me. I stayed for 19 days and instead of bringing my dad home, we buried him at the Veterans Cemetery. Daddy goes to the hospital and the Doubletree staff becomes aware of it and soon they were praying for us. I came to love each and every one of the staff members. Peter, Juan, Courtney, Elias, Sadie and the gals that made my room perfect. Bo. You know when you start doing this, your bound to forget names. The girl at Godiva. Antonio, Damaris at the bar. The head guy in charge. The guys who call the cabs, everyone. I will never forget what Elias did for me. A very tired dejected me crying silently, walks in with my dad's flag in my arms. Elias salutes the flag and mouths, "I'm so sorry, senora." I love them all. Damaris, the bartender. I stopped in there first for the best beer in PR. Medalla Light. I said, put in on my room tab. She said, this one is on me and if you need more, amor (love), you know where I am. But for me and for anyone who will listen to me...it's the Double Tree. Last note, for dad's funeral we wanted to play "En Mi Viejo San Juan," our anthem. It's midnight and Juan is working the desk. "I don't know the words," I say. "Don't worry, I will find them out for you." Courtney helped too. Woke up next morning, the copy of the anthem was under the door. To the staff at the Double Tree in English: I love you. You are incredible. Amazing! I will never forget your acts of kindness, I will be your forever guest. In Spanish, "Los amo, mil gracias por todo lo que hicieron por mi." This is my best description of all of you, from the boy that sweeps the floor to the man who puts out the coffee. I think you are angels disguised as human beings. I love you all. Maria

Reviews.Title: “Can it be that good? Yes!”
Reviews.Author: rogerroy1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree prior to our cruise. A couple of things to note upfront. The hotel is not near Old San Juan, so if your expectation is to walk there or the like it is not realistic staying here. Also, it is NEAR Condado, but be prepared for a 10-15 minute walk depending on where you are going. The walk is VERY doable, and you can use the facilities at the hotel's sister properties. The hotel itself is super modern, great bathroom's, stylish interiors, and very clean. There is a business center with FREE internet access and printing (super handy). The gym has Precor equipment and some limited free weights. Pool is a little on the small side, but serviceable. The staff is GREAT, a nice cookie when you arrive always makes things better. We ate at the Under The Tree restaurant a couple of times and it was GREAT. Another nice item, laundry facilities on-site and a 24 hr supermarket across the street. You can't beat this hotel, as long as you are prepared for where it is and where you want to be.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Relaxation Point before Cruise”
Reviews.Author: N0tTheM0nkey
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree is a good hotel choice for pre-cruise to just relax in until time to set sail. It is a $15 taxi plus $1 per bag from the airport. The pool itself is a little small and can get crowded but there were plenty of sunning chairs â€“ you need to get towels from the front desk. The rooms were clean. They utilized a shower only concept and the only real negative is the shower curtain didn't really keep the water in the shower - puddled in the bathroom. Beds were extremely comfortable and offered a good nights sleep. We did not notice any noise from the other rooms. The food options were plentiful. We highly recommend eating at the hotel restaurant â€˜Under the Treesâ€™. It has a full range of food from seafood and pasta to sandwiches and burgers. The Jibarita burger was one of the most amazing burgers I have had â€“ it had sweet plantains, bacon, queso del pais, and recao garlic mayo. Whoever thought plantains and burgers go together? One of the â€˜lighterâ€™ fares were large avocado halves stuffed with various things. The wife had hers with chicken salad but options included shrimp and other seafood. All the food was fresh and tasted great â€“ including the drinks (i.e. mojitos). A special call out to our incredible server, Jesus. For dinner, we ate at â€˜Silkâ€™ which included sushi and Chinese/Japanese fare. The sushi was fresh and the various rolls were well prepared. With wine, it did run a little one the pricey side for even good sushi. The breakfast buffet was okay â€“ standard fare and nothing special except for some very fresh salsa with the eggs, but it was free with my room as a diamond member so we utilized it. You could also walk about six blocks to get to a strip of chain restaraunts/coffee including Fuddruckers, Pizzeria Uno, and Starbucks. Near that was some other more authentic food places. For convienience, there was a 24 hour grocer across the street from the hotel to pick up any last minute travel items. For those interested in sightseeing, it is about another $15 taxi fare to Old Town and there are some other closer places.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth7
Reviews.Content: I can see why this hotel has so many great reviews in terms of the facilities, rooms and attention to detail. The hotel was spotless and modern in design. We stayed here for one night pre-cruise. For me the thing that sets in firmly in the very good category rather than excellent, is the service and arrangment at breakfast. Breakfast selection is limited and the way the food is set out makes it difficult to reach as the area is so small. That said, I would definitely stay at this friendly and welcoming hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Awesome Value”
Reviews.Author: datadinkusmc001
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful, they let us check in at 4am no extra charge, and the building feels very well kept. The rooms were outstanding. I had a small room but I felt like I was living large. It seem like they just renovated them. The breakfast is expencive but thats expected. They are right across the street from a super market. Bebo's Cafe is right down the street. A livelyier side if town is a few blocks down. This hotel was wonderful, they let us check in at 4am no extra charge, and the building feels very well kept. The rooms were outstanding. I had a small room but I felt like I was living large. It seem like they just renovated them. The breakfast is expensive but that's expected. They are right across the street from a super market. Bebo's Cafe is right down the street. A livelier side if town is a few blocks down. The shampoo and soap they provided were awesome, And the towel service was great to. Soo much more I could say...

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: MaryK_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree for 2 nights prior to our cruise. I did my research and was very happy we picked this hotel. All the staff members were kind and helpful, from when we arrived to our departure. We loved the warm chocolate chip cookies when we checked in...our room was ready and the bellman took our luggage up with us to our room, and on our way gave us a run down of the hotel and surrounding area. After we checked in we walked over to the 24hr. supermarket across the street and picked up some snacks and just relaxed by the pool. That evening we walked to Bebo's for dinner....we really enjoyed our dinner and went the following night again as well! Our room was very nice - the beds were very comfortable, and the room was clean and nicely kept. They did have little complimentary toiletrees in the bathroom, but when the strap on my dress snapped, the front desk gave us a sewing kit so I could sew it up. Overall everyone was very friendly, the hotel common areas were nice and modern, the coffee was delicious, the gym was well equipped, they had free wifi throughout the property, the hottub was relaxing and overall we were very pleased with our stay. We did take a taxi to old San Juan, which we really enjoyed. We were sad to leave but excited to get our cruise....I can clearly understand why this hotel was rated #1. I recommend this hotel if your visitng San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: senseiluisruiz
Reviews.Content: We Had to stay here because the original reservation at the Hotel Iberia was NASTY thank god they were close this is what a vacation hotel should be like.Thanks to the staff and managment for your help. We loved it.....Goshin Ryu Karate School... if you need to contct me here is the info. THANK YOU www.goshin-ryu.com

Reviews.Title: “Love Those Chocolate Chip Cookies”
Reviews.Author: jdeuser
Reviews.Content: Twenty five of us stayed at the Doubletree in San Juan prior to going on a cruise. I had booked with them several months prior to our stay and had great communications with them throughout. They recommended and very good place to eat that was within walking distance. In addition, they recommended 3 different transportation companies for us to use. All three were contacted and and we told them what we were looking for regarding transportation from and to the air port plus a tour of San Juan prior to our cruise. The staff at the Doubletree were very helpful throughout the entire time working with them. The rooms appeared to have been remodeled recently and were very nice. It was a great value for the money and as always their chocolate chip cookies were great and plentiful. Thanks for a fun and smooth experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: jeeves06
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Juan. From the room, to the welcome warm chocolate chip cookie, the fitness center and pool, everything was fabulous. I felt like I was in a fancy upscale hotel. Great bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Upscale Amenities”
Reviews.Author: rodney_pryor
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the grounds it is obvious that the Doubletree by Hilton San Juan stresses hospitality and quality. The Bell-man was extremely helpful. The hotel lobby is beautiful. The rooms have the most modern amenities. And the restuarants served great food - especially Silk. Only 3 blocks (or so) from the beach. I will definitely reccommend this hotel to travelers looking for a little something extra during their next business or personal travel to San Juan, Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Great and reasonably priced place to stay”
Reviews.Author: seeingtheworld_10
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying here and we liked it just as much as the first. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean, modern, and well-appointed, and the location is convenient. There is a 24 hour grocery store right across the street, which is very convenient, especially when traveling with family. Just a couple of blocks down from the Condado area. Gym is newly rennovated and well equpped, and the kids loved the pool (and the small kiddie pool). This is a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: ANNIVERSARYTRAVELER2
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here the night before our cruise. We picked this hotel based off of the reviews from this site an they were right on target. We arrived early evening and check in was a breeze. Our room had a queen bed and a great view. The staff was extremely friendly and made some restaurant and site seeing suggestions. The first evening we took a cab to Old San Juan which was around $15US each way. The next day we took the bus .75US and it was easy and we got to see parts of the city. We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant and it was very good, The grocery store across the street is a real convenience for snack and last minute items. We didn't use the pool, but it was beautifyully lit in the evening and well maintained. I definately reecommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful! Very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: happycatapillar
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree was a great find in San Juan, where you pay a ton for beach access. As a business traveler, it was much more important to me to have a convenient location and comfortable room than be on the beach. I traveled with colleagues and a companion. While I was out working in town, my companion enjoyed the pool and exercise rooms. Business center was sufficient for basic web and bw print needs. Staff was friendly, dining options were pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - good price”
Reviews.Author: ssfg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our cruise and it was the perfect spot! Our kids were in heaven with the pool. We stayed in one of the rooms right off of the patio and it allowed the children to have quick access to the pool as well as the hot tub. There were great games for the kids to play as well. Breakfast included was amazing. The staff of the hotel could not help us out more to accommodate our late check out. They took care of our bags while we lounged around the pool for the afternoon. Well worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, wonderful hotel and ,yes, a great bathroom”
Reviews.Author: jimbo65
Reviews.Content: We arrived a day early for our cruise. After reading all the comments about this hotel it was a no brainer not to stay here. Every positive comment we had heard was correct. It was not as close to the beach as I had thought. When I asked for directions to the beach, I was given a letter so that we could spend the day at their sister hotel, La Chonch. After a 10 minute walk we had the beach we wanted, with lounge chairs, cabanas, towel service etc. The Under the Trees restaurant was excellent and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: Surfercisco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree a day before our cruise based on the reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. The room itself was pretty tight for three people and all of our cruise luggage when the murphy bed was pulled down. The design and furnishings of the room were very sleek and modern. The beds were comfortable and we slept well. The staff was friendly, happy and helpful. We liked the hotel so much that we have reservations for next year. We plan to stay longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: roomtogo
Reviews.Content: This was a 3-day stay prior to a cruise and we were glad we were in such good hands. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and comfortable, with adequate light and temperature controls. Internet access was available for free. Breakfasts included juice, coffee, eggs, sausage, bacon, and either french toast or pancakes. Some days, there was a fruit and yogurt station. The pool was comfortable and relaxing. However, the best part was having a reciprocal agreement with the Concha Resort (a 20 minute walk) . This hotel is right on the beach, with pools, pool service and a bar and restaurant, all really nice options. We would stay tat the Doubletree again!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel Feeling...Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: LadyTraveler444
Reviews.Content: From the moment I entered the hotel, after a 7 day cruise, I felt at home. Miguel, at the front desk, welcomed me and had a room made up for me so that I could relax...hours before check-in time. Antonio and Yamira graciously arranged the tours I wanted to go on, and Bo, the operations manager stopped to chat when I told him that one of the reasons I had chosen the Doubletree.was that he seemed to care enough about his hotel to read and respond to the comments left by visitors on Trip Advisor. Before I knew it, a beautiful platter of fresh fruit was delivered to my room, compliments of Bo. I was also pleased to find that there was a refrigerator, microwave and pod coffee maker in the room. Throughout my four day stay, all of the staff members were helpful. On the day I left, Omar allowed me to check out late, even though the hotel had full occupancy...and gave me two of those fabulous warm chocolate chip cookies upon my departure. The only shortcoming I found was that, although the room was extremely clean, staff was a bit careless in neatness. Nothing that would stop me from returning and highly recommending this wonderful hotel. (And knowing Bo, when he reads this, the matter will be addressed and will not happen again.) If I've left anyone out, I apologize because everyone I dealt with went out of his/her way to be of service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: VacaGirlLexington_KY
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. They service was impecable. We had forgotten a few bathroom items and room service provided them for us. We were on our way for a cruise but had a few hours to spare so we wanted to go into Old San Juan. They offered to hold our luggage at no charge, or made the recommendation we take our luggage to the ship first then to Old San Juan -that would save us about $40 in cab fare. They also made great recommendations for local authentic restaurants for great food. Wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a sensible location”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Mgmt_Advisor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not exactly right next to anything, which is why it worked out well for us. It's convenient to the airport, but not right next to it. It's not right on the beach, but is a short walk away. It's not right next to Old San Juan, but was reasonably accessible with our rental car. Basically, it was centrally located to a number of places that we needed to be - and reasonably priced. The service was excellent; Peter is probably the most helpful receptionist I have ever encountered. I'm a light sleeper, and he really went out of his way to find my wife and I a quiet room. Overall, we ended up being very pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: sabastian67
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here in February after returning from a seven day cruise. We had a couple of days in San Juan until our return flight back to NYC. When my girlfriend asked why we did not have bathrobes in our room I went to the front desk and requested two for our room. I assumed they forgot to put them in our room because they were in a rush to clean our room because we were asking to have it ready prior to the 3pm check-in time. The first person I spoke to at the front desk attempted to give a reasonable answer for this and told me that they only give them when requested. This seemed strange because the average person would not know bathrobes are provided unless they read the place card in the bathroom. Fortunately, another staff person stepped in and simply had someone provide us with the robes. They were delivered quickly. Other than the incident I just mentioned, overall the staff was excellent. We asked the front desk about finding a vegetarian friendly restaurant in the area and they gave us a variety of restaurants to choose from in the area. We also asked about seafood restaurants in the area. Even though we eat vegetarian we also allow fish in our diet. They again provided a large selection of restaurants, we settled on Marisqueria Atlantica, which was only a few minutes by car from the hotel. It cost about $12 by cab each way. The food there was very good and we were happy with our choice. On another night we did not feel like travelling too far for dinner and went to, Under the Trees, which is located next door to the hotel. The dinner was excellent (pan seared Cajun Red Snapper) which made up for the service, which was very slow. The waitress apologized and said they were hosting a private party in the restaurant and had a new chef, which was fine but that did not explain why it took over 10 mins for a glass of (fresh squeezed) orange juice and sangria (which we were offered complimentary for our extended wait). They also offered us a complimentary dessert, which was a generous gesture. Rafael was especially helpful with the restaurant selection and choosing a tour to take. We wanted to take the cave tour but it was not open on Monday, so we decided to go to the rain forest tour. If you like to hike and donâ€™t mind getting wet, after all it is a rain forest, you will enjoy it. The amenities at the hotel itself were very good. I enjoyed the gym they have. It is small but the equipment and free weights seemed new or very close to it. I did not have a chance to experience the pool or hot tub, but they definitely were well maintained. We had a poolside room which came with a ground level balcony that led directly to the pool and hot tub, very nice. I would recommend this room to anyone who stays here. They have free Wi-Fi throughout the building, which I can appreciate. They also have free parking. The rooms come with a mini fridge and microwave, which comes in handy with a supermarket across the street. Overall we enjoyed our three day stay at the hotel and would definitely recommend it to anyone staying in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but quite far from all attractions”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter13131
Reviews.Content: Hi. My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one week in February 2011. It has been renovated quite nicely and the room and bathroom was quite modern. One thing that I think really detracts from this hotel is that they don't have a concierge to give you tips on where to go, eat, how to get to places. We actually relied mostly on the young men who were handling the valet service. They were excellent with their recommendations (but this is not necessarily within the realm of their job description). The front desk staff were pleasant. I have to admit that some were better than others. The one young gentleman that checked us in was not very helpful. When we asked him how long it would take to get to San Juan by taxi vs bus, he said it all depended on traffic, could take anywhere from 30 min to 2 hours depending on traffic. He seemed really uninterested in his job. The others that we spoke to later in the week were quite good. In hindsight, I think that this hotel is more than adequate if you're staying for one or two nights pre- or post-cruise, however, I wouldn't recommend staying any longer than that. There are some beautiful hotels in Old San Juan that are very quaint and unique, but if you want your standard Westernized hotel, then the Doubletree San Juan is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a happy stay”
Reviews.Author: gastineauman
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were amazingly nice, and extremely helpfull. They greeted us with a smile and a hello (or ola) everytime we came off the elevator, or came in the front door. The housekeeping was great, the room was always clean, however, a little small. Pretty good location. The beach was only a ten minute walk, a 24 hour grocery store directly across the street with everything from liquor, to laundry soap, and a killer little dive about a 30 second walk away called Diana's. The food is AMAZING! They don't speak a lick of English but luckily there always seemed to be a customer there who would translate for you. The valets were even helpful. All in all, this hotel gets two thumbs up from my Wife and I. Also, there is a "Market Place" about ten minutes worth of walking away. On Thursday and Friday nights, there is no better place to be. It is called Plaza Del Marcado (spelling?). The staff will tell you all about it. The in house drinks and food are waaaaaaaay to expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: pearson30
Reviews.Content: We selected the Doubletree based on the very positive reviews we read on TripAdvisor and agreed with all the great reviews. We were even more pleased with the hotel when we arrived. We stayed in a room looking out on the garden/pool area and it was very beautiful. The staff were wonderful and we will stay here again. Thank you for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Get double of what you paid for at the Doubletree.”
Reviews.Author: The_Boulevardier
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a real value in San Juan, stay at the Doubletree. The hotel is clean, the front service is exceptionally friendly and accommodating, and the rooms were nice and airy. The swimming pool is also a nice amenity, especially since the beaches nearby are not necessarily exceptional. Even the fitness room is well-equipped with new machines and workout necessities (for those that need to get their fitness on after a few nights of decadent dining). I was able to walk to the Condado area which has many great restaurants and shops (it has a nice South Beach/San Juan flavor to it). Old San Juan is only a short cab ride away ($17 or so). I was really surprised at the high quality and great value of this hotel. I would recommend this hotel to a friend that is looking to stay at a reasonably-priced, high-amenity hotel near the best things that San Juan has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to end our trip”
Reviews.Author: DCMrsg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after returning from a 12 night cruise and overall we really enjoyed our stay. We arrived prior to the stated check-time but they were able to accommodate us with no hesitation. The check in clerk was very helpful in recommendations for places to eat and see which were within walking distance. We were on the first floor and really enjoyed sitting on the patio and eating dinner. The room was very comfortable and spacious and the free breakfast the next morning was plentiful. The hotel is right across the street from a grocery store so it made picking up snacks for the flight home easy. They were having some problems with the internet when we first arrived but that was quickly fixed. I wouldn't say this location was glamorous but it was certainly comfortable with a great staff and I look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value but cramped room”
Reviews.Author: vacation_junkie03
Reviews.Content: We travelled with 2 little kids. The room had a murphy bed and it was cramped for 4 people. The bathroom was small and tight. No real sink counter other than a 4" metal strip across the length of the mirror. There's only a shower stall which was all glass and we were careful to open/close the door when our little daughter was in the bathroom. Smokers hang out in front of the lobby and so we had to run or walk quickly to pass them so we don't get "smoked out". They know how to ruin a good, breezy beautiful day. There's a toddler pool which was a nice surprise. The front desk was generous with the chocolate chips cookies which were available daily if you ask. As usual, the service and cleanliness is excellent and consistent with other Doubletree hotels we've stayed at. There's a local Puerto Rican restaurant called Bebos around the corner and has very good local food for reasonable price. We purchased the meal plan and went across to the Under the Tree restaurant for ala cart breakfast which was a good option to breakfast buffet at the inside restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay Before Cruising!”
Reviews.Author: cls09
Reviews.Content: Check in was very fast and the staff were very friendly. We stayed here from January 13-15, 2011 just before our cruise. The warm chocolate chip cookies sure hit the spot. The room was very nice however the rugs could use a cleaning and the shower flooded every time we used it. These two issues were very insignificant. The best part about staying here is the grocery store right across the street. We bought some coconut rum and pineapple juice and had our own little party by the pool. The bus stop is just down the street to go to Old San Juan which was very handy. Bebo's Restaurant around the corner was very good and so was the restaurant in the hotel. Ask what the price of the brunch is before you have it. The first day it was $9.95 and the next day it was $19.95 (for the same very small brunch), however we were refunded after complaining. The beach is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel also has free internet service which was great so we could e-mail the kids. You just can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: shannonculver
Reviews.Content: We flew in the day before our cruise and stayed here. We were close to the airport and was only 3 short blocks from the beach. The 24 hour huge store across the street was nice to have for those last min. stuff we need for the cruise. We left at 11am on Sunday and it was just a short cab drive to the boat. We were able to get on the ship (Carnival) at 1:30, even thou the ship did not leave till 10pm. The hotel was clean and we did not have problems with the shower!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel and the staff were awesome!”
Reviews.Author: stefshur
Reviews.Content: Just loved the staff and the way they made us feel. Thank you Doubletree. Work-out room was great and pool area was very nice. Rosa Desarden, Yodil M.Caban, Antonio Cruz, Rafael, Jerry, Victor, Isamel (maintance guy) and the morning breakfast crew (were great). Thank you all for making my stay great while my husband was there on business!! I could not have asked for a better hotel and such a wonderful time being in there for 3 full weeks. My husband and I thank each and everyone of you for making our stay well worth a trip back one day. Best of luck, Stephanie & Tony Ramirez

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable housekeeping, beautiful decor and the BEST, friendliest service people”
Reviews.Author: barbpract
Reviews.Content: Would like to commend Rafael Romain, Genesis and Omar, among others at the hotel, for wonderful service and attention to our special needs. The hotel is very, very clean, decor is smart and well appointed. Food is way above average. The pool is lovely and clean, open 24hr. The service is outstanding and full of good will. Only complaint was the allowance of smoking for guests on the outdoor patio at the entrance to the hotel. PR is a place where being outside is optimal. Maybe a special patio for smokers well away from social interaction. The hotel is located in a good area about walking distance of 2 blocks from the beach. There is a swank sister hotel right on the beach where you can spend time at the pool or the beach with a special pass given by DoubleTree. There is a well stocked grocery store right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “best of the best”
Reviews.Author: mbjfm77
Reviews.Content: love the place it is nice and clean but parking a little to high in front of the hotel there a grocery store that the food is exelent they sale breakfast and lunch it was great

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug41563
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here three days prior to our cruise. We had additional guests arrive on different days, in total there were nine of us. We were greeted by Raphael. He is an great at his job and I do believe he loves his job. Anything you want to know or need he can assist you with. Our room was reaaly nice, clean and comfprtable we were on the 5th floor. The room is modern in decor and a decent size. The hotel resturant was good. A bit expensive but that is to be expected for a hotel dinning experience. Food was great especially the cheeseburger! Drinks were expensive as well. The grounds were nicely taken care. The pool area was nice to socialize in, open 24 hours. The 24 hour supermarket across the street was very nice. We were able to buy beer and wine and have it in the pool area and socialize with others. The hotel management did not mind us doing this, as a matter of fact we had sandwiches there, from the supermarket. The bus service was excellent. We utilized the service to go into Old San Juan and the drivers and people on the bus were very friendly, those that didn't speak english asked others to interpert for us. We were excited as to how nice and friendly everyone was. My husband & I walked up the street for a few blocks(4-5), went into the art museum. We were looking for some coffee and were referred to the "Cafe Hacienda San Pedro" for the best coffee around and it was the best. Small place, locally owned. They serve coffee of all kinds, sandwiches and pastry. Do go! The beach was a few blocks away, nice a bit rough. We also ate at "Dianes'" pizza, kind of a "dive" but pizza was very good. Waitress did not speak english so the customers helped us out. We had fun there and even met the cook from "Bibos" resturant (around corner from hotel). All in all we have no regrets staying here and would not hesitate to stay again. Raphael was the best!!!! Other staff was great too but he had a beaming personality and gave us so much information.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly acceptable hotel”
Reviews.Author: gsbdiver
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a night here after American Airlines messed up one of our flights. Doubletree was the subject of one of the funniest powerpoints that made its way around the Internet a few years ago (you can see it here: [--]). Given that beating, I was depressed, but not surprised, when American Airlines put us up there after messing up one of our flights. What surprised me was that the hotel was not a as bad as I expected. It was perfectly fine for a low-end chain place. The staff was helpful and the restaurant was OK, too, but not great. The location seemed a little away from anything of interest, but the facilities were also OK.
