Nothing to rave about and I'd probably opt for something more fancy, if I were coming to Puerto Rico as a destination, but if you are in town for a layover night, you'll be OK here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: SFB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is spotless. The staff warm, friendly, and very helpful. The restaurants are excellent but there are also many reasonably priced and interesting restaurants within a few minutes walk. The gym is well equipped and the outdoor pool area is attractive. There is a supermarket across the street so you can stock up the in-room refrigerator. The free wifi connection was excellent. There is a public beach 2 blocks away, but you can also get a day pass to use the beach and facilities at the ocean front La Concha Hotel which is a 15-20 minute walk. The hotel will provide beach chairs and a cooler for the public beach, but if you go to La Concha you can use their chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious and Capable Staff and Nice Rooms Make This a Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: chucktraveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived early afternoon on Friday,Jan 28 and were greeted by Genesis, one of the outstanding front desk staff personnel. For our two day stay, we enjoyed our visit as much as we did the cruise which followed. Relaxing poolside area, good quality restaurants, clean, updated rooms, and the friendliest staff people in all positions, from bellmen to restaurant wait staff to pool attendants, to the cleaning staff and maintenance, we encountered genuimne hospitality from everyone. This hotel is well managed, with well-trained staff who really enjoy working with people. We hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “we were very pleased with the Double Tree San Juan”
Reviews.Author: bluewaterhomes
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice and the service was great. You won't be disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, So glad we choose the San Juan Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: suebee7
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Everyone friendly, no problems. Would love to stay again. Will highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: delawareseven
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed post cruise for one night. It was a wonderful cruise, but there was a charge for everything on the ship. We read on Trip Advisor that this was a great place to stay post-cruise. We arrived at the hotel at 10:00 am hoping to drop off our bags. They immediately gave us our room, Antonio was our bellman and he could not have been nicer. We settled in and decided to walk about 10 minutes to the beach. Free beach towels, free beach chairs......I couldn;t believe it. The beach near the hotel is not the greatest, small beach and the Atlantic was rough. The beach chairs they give you and really not chairs so to speak, kind of like a mat with a back, but it was nice to have them. Back from the beach and into the pool, it was heaven. The pool is really not as small as noted in earlier reviews, and it has two waterfalls and there are nice lounge chairs. It was a cloudy day with some misty rain, so of course, there were no crowds by the pool. The room is comfortable, modern, with a really nice bathroom. There is free internet with a printer in the computer room, so you can easily check in for your flight. The staff could not have been more welcoming and hospitable, especially Margarita at the front desk and Antonio the bellman. It is a good idea to stay here post cruise for one night, because three cruise ships arrived in San Juan that day, and my friends said that the airport was wild. We went to the airport the next morning, and ours was the only flight there. Had the whole place to ourselves. DO not miss the restaurant on site "Under The Trees". The atmosphere may turn you off at first, it is kind of like a cafeteria, but the food and service were excellent. I would go back there in a heartbeat, as I would the Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “Great mid-winter get-a-way!”
Reviews.Author: BransonBob
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this hotel and had a great time. Although not right on the beach like some hotels, this was still in a convenient location in San Juan (Condado) with easy access to the major highways plus only minutes from "Old San Juan". Navigating the highways can be tricky but Antonio, Rafael and the other Bellman / Valet staff were very helpful all week with their directions. As far as hotel staff in general, everyone that we met was friendly, courteous and helpful. I would not hesitate to stay here again on our next P.R. vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, easy walk for food and 10 minutes from Cruise ships”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel6768
Reviews.Content: A very modern hotel, with very nice rooms. Free internet, clean rooms and nice outdoor pool area. Staff very friendly. Stayed the night before cruising on Sat. 10 Minute taxi to cruise ship. All in all, best stay hotel we have stayed at in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price for what they offer and location!”
Reviews.Author: ShahramMi
Reviews.Content: We have been in San Juan for the past 3 years and stayed at Raddison, Marriott, and now Doubletree. We liked the fact s that it was conveniently located close (but not to close for noise) to HWY for easy access to airport, couple of minutes walk from Ashford Ave., amminities (such as great service, room, hotel layout, business center), and definitely the price. We will definitely stay the next time we are in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Biz Hotel. Also, very Botiquee..:-)”
Reviews.Author: Willie-Hop
Reviews.Content: I was there on biz for several days and found it to be an excellent hotel. I hoefully will be going back for more biz, and would go back w/ my wife for pleasure as well

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: hope89
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beutiful and clean staff extra helpfull with me oh boy i wanna go back soon this place is really relaxing and homie love the pool fell in love with the bathrooms i give this hotel 100 points.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Bebel
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree is very well located. There are bus stops right in front of the hotel, so we could go to Isla Verde and Old San Juan paying just 75 cents. The market across the street is really handy. The hotel itself is very clean and the bed very comfortable. The staff very nice. We would stay there again for sure. The hotel offers partnership with other two hotels, one in Condado and one in Isla Verde and we were able to use their beach and pool facilities. We stayed there before and after our Cruise and we were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Looking Forward to Returning”
Reviews.Author: Traveller12345678
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at this hotel prior to Caribbean cruise. Staff were very helpful/accommodating, rooms clean and comfortable. Two blocks walk to beach, large modern food store nearby for snacks, beer, etc. Lovely pool, spa, exercise room. Best rooms are those at the ground level, garden and poolside. These rooms offer sliding door access to individual patios and steps to the pool. They are also very quiet given the downtown location. Check to see if you can use pool and facilities on cruise return if you've got a long wait til your outbound flight. Good experience, we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Super San Juan Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: cbg326
Reviews.Content: make this your overnight or after cruise hotel. Staff is super courteous, rooms are spacious and well appointed, and the pool area is a lovely retreat from the busle of San Juan. A supermarket is conviently located right across the street for last minute needs. A direct bus line to Old San Juan is just across the street. Well Located between airport and the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: vancity9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not bad if you are staying for a short while. The rooms themselves are quite nice, as are the washrooms. The elevators are a bit scary/slow. Nice lobby and decor but next time I'm in PR I think I'll stay somewhere in Old San Juan because that's where all the action is. The best part of the hotel had to be the free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel, but overpriced and overrated”
Reviews.Author: desertprince
Reviews.Content: Highlights: clean (except for filthy carpeting) modern, upscale contemporary furnishings. Great beds. Helpful staff. Low-lights: expensive, minuscule rooms. European modern ambiance but completely lacking in charm. Tiny pool for such a large hotel. Poor dining options. Inconvenient location. Expensive parking.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ColdeComfort
Reviews.Content: Located a few blocks from the main Condado hotel district, this quiet, upscale hotel is close to the beach, restaurants and the action. Wonderful, courteous staff, nicely appointed rooms, lovely pool area and the best chocolate chip cookies in the world. Directly across the street is a large 24 hr. super market with a fabulous selection of wine and beer and prepared foods. The hotel's continental breakfast is more like a breakfast buffet and dinner at Michael's was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing post-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: TropiCAL2003
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the Doubletree and had a wonderful room with sliding doors to walk out to the pool area and patio tables. My husband loved the big shower in our room. Our taxi driver mentioned the 24-hour market across the street also had a cafeteria - we had fun just seeing all the different things like root vegetables and fresh fruit in the huge market. We bought some things (sparkling cider, shrimp cocktail, cheese) to have a nice lunch buffet in our room. A pleasant walk several blocks to sit and see the ocean, and then back through residential area was nice. The waterfalls around the pool were relaxing to hear while reading a book and sunning. I was very happy that the front desk was able to accommodate our early arrival (had arrived back from cruise). All staff were excellent from the bellman to engineer to repair AC who put batteries in door monitor. We were able to hear the unique Coqui frogs in the evening when we were outside. Internet was fast for last-minute work. A wonderful day and evening in San Juan before flying back to the USA the next day - totally enjoyed the stay at the Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: BBtrip21
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at the Doubletree. We were looking for a place to stay in San Juan the night before our early flight. The hotel was clean, modern, and very upscale looking for the price. We got a taxi into Old San Juan to sightsee before returning to use the pool/hot tub area. All I can say is I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there anytime I am back in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: wowfort
Reviews.Content: when we arrived on Jan 1st we were greeted at the front desk with no surprises and warm cookies. The business center and pool area were great and we used the fitness room and had no problems except it was hot in there and the treadmills had no fans on them. Not a big deal. the rooms were clean and well maintained and as for the glass bathrooms we didn't have any issues with them as some reviews commented on. We stayed one night before and one night after a cruise that ended up being 2 nights cause our flight got cancelled. Being the great facility they are they gave us the same room for the second night for the same price even though we had gotten a great rate by pre-paying. In the end we loved this hotel and would definitely stay again the next time we go to San Juan. Also the store across the street is great for snacks and such also a fridge and microwave are nice in the room. On our last day there we got to watch the rehearsal for some kind of pageant thet was going on by the pool...interesting!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Melissae5784
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin. My boyfriend and I were extremely disappointed in the location of the hotel. The hotel is surrounded by buildings. The ONLY good thing is the hotel is located near a supermarket (you can walk there from the hotel). We arrived to the hotel early - 10:30am (after leaving the port, Royal Caribbean, in San Juan). The drive is about 15-20 minutes. The taxi from the port to the hotel was $15 (the most the taxi will charge) plus an additional $1 for each piece of luggage. Our room was ready when we arrived. We absolutely loved the room. Very modern and newly re -renovated. The only negative thing I have to say about the room is there was a strong smell of paint. The pool is very small. There is a pool for adults and a pool for children. For the size of the hotel there were only 15 - 20 lounge chairs. So my boyfriend and I had the choice to either lay on a towel on the floor or to put two chairs together. The hotel did give us the option to use the pool at another hotel, which the only way you could get there was to take a taxi (which cost money). You could walk there, but it would take about 20 to 30 minutes to get there. To me this is not how you spend a vacation. Unfortunately around 2 pm I received a phone call that my grandfather passed away. My boyfriend and I immediately packed out bags and left the hotel to make our flight for 5 (the drive to the airport was about 10-15 minutes). About 10 days later I had called the hotel because 1) MY CREDIT CARD WAS CHARGED TWICE 2) I felt that the hotel should reimburse me back partial of my money since I only stayed 4 hours. I spoke to someone from the front desk and he told me there was nothing they could do for me. Then I had asked to speak to a manager. At first he told me there was nothing he could do for me. After insisting, he eventually told me the only thing he could do was to charge me for using there facilities which is $75 plus taxes which ended up costing me $94, which I think is absolutely ridiculous. I WILL NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL AGAIN. Also, the hotel (which they don't tell you until you get there) will charge you credit card an additional $50 for room service or restaurant, but if you don't use either one they will put the $50 back on your credit card (so look for that). I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, courteous service, fine stay.”
Reviews.Author: KdoughboyMc
Reviews.Content: Howdy. Stayed here from 12/31/10 till 01/02/11; a pre-cruise stay. From initial booking of cruise in Jan. of 2010, i had been looking at places to stay near the cruise port for a couple days prior to embarking. Upon coming across the listing for this hotel and thru the course of the year i was impressed by the positive reviews listed by TripAdvisor members. Also impressed by management response to any queries/comments brought up by reviewers; this to me was showing 'care' for the needs of the traveler. I met the gentleman, Bo Bramsen, behind the responses during my short stay at the hotel. Pleasant guy, answered any queries i had and wanted to ensure that my stay there was a good one. It was. Upon arrival at hotel, was met by Antonio whom took our bags and provided my party of 8 with a warm chocolate chip cookie for each, very nice. Likable chap, he provided answers to any questions about local area for eating, sightseeing, other interests. A 24 hour grocery store across the street from hotel came in handy too. Hotel accommodations for myself were very fine, i was 1 in a room. The other 2 rooms in our reservation held 3 and 4 people respectively. Seemed a little cramped in their rooms but the lodging served its purpose for our brief stay. Was an outdoor pool area that was adequate for sunbathing and general lounging around. The upstairs deck could have used a few more chaise loungers at times. Overall i was very pleased with our stay there. I usually stay in places alot cheaper but the others didnt want a HoJos or Motel 6; the value for price paid was worth the extra dollars it cost me. Should San Juan ever be in future travel plans, i would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravelALot
Reviews.Content: Myself, my husband, and 14 year old daughter disembarked off cruise - many of the passengers attempting to check in early here. Staff kept their cool, stored everyone's luggage, gave a precise time to come back, let people hang out if they wanted. Loved the warm cookies at check in. The pool area, the pool itself, the whirlpool were fun and clean. It's a bit more than I'm used to spending, but I can see why. A lot of nice touches at this hotel, the murphy (wall) bed was very comfy and convenient to have folded away until required. Modern decor. Micheals Bistro had a great menu, very nice place to dine that evening (small, so make reservation). The breakfast was pretty good too in the morning. Convenient having a cab stand right at hand. Close to the airport ($17 US).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience - Incredible Staff”
Reviews.Author: nytraveler718
Reviews.Content: I knew that the Doubletree was going to be a great time when Peter, at the front desk, offered us a chocolate chip walnut cookie upon arrival. I would have to say that the Doubletree has some of the best hospitality that I have ever received at a hotel. From Margarita, who was very helpful when we thought we would be stranded in NY and not make it to PR because of the weather to the valets Robert and Freddy who knew where all the hot spots were, everyone was a delight. Make sure you check out the Tropical Splash drink at the bar downstairs. Ask for George. As you can tell, we really got to know the people that worked there. Everyone was really friendly. We stayed 6 nights and I would definitely stay here again. The rooms were clean and well-apportioned. The location was perfect for catching the bus around San Juan and within walking distance of the bustling Ashford Avenue. Be sure to check out the Supermax supermarket across the street. It offers a good value lunch menu.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a quick stay”
Reviews.Author: Lilliput441
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night upon returning from a Caribbean cruise. The Trip Advisor reviews made it sound wonderful. Actually, I would only recommend it for the convenience. It is not a place to stay for an extended vacation. While modern and well decorated, the public areas and pool area are not spacious. We arrived well before check-in time and the lobby was mobbed with guests trying to check out for cruise departures and guests checking in after cruise arrivals. Registration did its best to get us into our room as early as possible, but under the circumstances, there was a 2-hour wait. We had a double with one queen-size bed and a double murphy bed for 2 adults and 2 children. With the murphy bed down and 5 pieces of luggage in the room, there was little maneuvering room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Refuge After a Long Day at Work!”
Reviews.Author: logisys
Reviews.Content: Every person working at the San Juan Doubletree had a smile on their face and asked if there was anything I needed to make my stay more comfortable. As always, the warm chocolate chip cookies in the evening were great. A collegue and I arrived late but the person in the restaurant/lounge stayed a bit longer to make sure we could see the end of a game. The location was very convenient, the service was great. I would definately recommend the San Juan Doubletree to other road warriors.

Reviews.Title: “The Doubletree is a great deal & a great place to stay in San Juan, PR.”
Reviews.Author: wiggytili
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at The Doubletree last month and would certainly stay there again during our next trip to Puerto Rico. The rooms are clean and spacious, ours overlooked the pool. The pool & outdoor hot tub are clean & relaxing - the area around the hotel is "true" Puerto Rico. All of the staff are knowledgeable and friendly & will accomodate any realistic needs that you might have.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariekey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Doubletree hotel twice--once before going on a cruise and again when we returned. Our balcony opened up onto the pool area. It was absolutely beautiful. The service was excellent. The hotel is only a short taxi drive to all of the major attractions. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great- from a frequent traveler”
Reviews.Author: Danielle_from_FL
Reviews.Content: Modern decor. Flatscreen and cable. Nice fitness room (smelled a little rubbery new). Lived the balconies in the second floor that open to the pool area. Groceries across the street. Great front desk staff. Romantic. Near old San Juan (but no place to park in old San Juan so get a cab). Neutrogena products. Paid $179 a night total. Parking is $15 self and $20 valet. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “can they get this right?”
Reviews.Author: sidecut
Reviews.Content: The facilities were wonderful and the people were wonderful, however, the charges for eight nights have changed many times during our stay and they continue to change a full week after check out. Our stay was divided between two credit cards and the charges have bounced back and forth between our two accounts (sometimes all on one and sometimes split not at all the way it should have been). This has caused money to be transferred numerous times between our two accounts and the bank has levied nsf charges to my fiance's account. If you choose to stay at this hotel, it would advised to book on the internet through a third party and settle all payments prior to your stay with that third party.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, nice location, clean, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: gblai
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the doubletree over the summer with my husband and we enjoyed our stay. The staff at the front desk were very helpful. The hotel is located within a short walk of the beach, grocery and restaurants. The room itself was also very nice. Overall, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel but ...”
Reviews.Author: cr0n
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night. The hotel was very nice and the service was great. We had only one complaint. Both of us were covered by mosquito bites the next day morning (our room was on a high floor). Not sure if this is an issue with the weather in San Juan during Dec or the hotel but both of us had a bad time sleeping. Having said that, and assuming that this was just a freakish one-off bad experience, the rooms were very nice and the hotel overall was great. They also helped us book a table at a nice restaurant in San Juan as well.

Reviews.Title: “DoubleTree Is the Place to stay in San Juan.”
Reviews.Author: sloal
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the San Juan, PR DoubleTree in December preceding a cruise. I've stayed at DoubleTree locations around the US and have always been satisfied with everything. This location was no different. (love those warm cookies on arrival) There is a supermarket directly across the street which was very convenient for picking up wine & snacks for the cruise. The staff was friendly and helpful and upon our asking recommended a GREAT restaurant for paella. It was superb! The only downside (which DID NOT bother us) is that it is a $15 cab ride to Old San Juan. We would stay there again & recommend that others do as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to our expectations”
Reviews.Author: GreggMS
Reviews.Content: After reading the Trip Advisor reviews earlier in the year, I booked a 2 night stay. I would highly recommend this and plan on staying here when I visit San Juan again. The service was outstanding. Antonio went out of his way to accomodate us. When two of my excursions were in jeopardy of being canceled, he told me that he could book similar tours. He even gave me his business card with cell phone. This was a very thoughtful gesture. The rooms were comfortable, quiet and clean. The only drawback was that the shower doors leaked out water. Faulty design that should be addressed. Business center had high speed internet that worked well and I never had to wait. Workout room was excellent with treadmills, elliptical trainers and weights. TV's were on each machine. Pool was spacious but a little chilly (low 70's). I also enjoyed using their Jacuzzi. There is a 24 hours Grocery Store across the street which came in handy. Overall a great stay and I am looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Clean & Comfortable Room, Excelent Location.”
Reviews.Author: Silvertraveller08
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the DoubleTree prior to joining a cruise. We could not have made a better choice. With large clean and comfortable rooms, the hotel has all the facilities a traveler needs.. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the beach and local restraints. Local buses will take you to Old San Juan and other locations. The staff were very helpful, particularly Antonio the Bell Captain, who arranged for us to store our luggage on our return, as we had a late flight out of San Juan. It is easy to see why this hotel gets its No1 rating

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree is an "outstanding" hotel at a fair price.”
Reviews.Author: traveltomuch24
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit for work. I work in operations not sales as so many frequent travelers do. I don't need the meeting rooms, the large hotel room for a meeting. This hotel has perfect access to the freeways in San Juan, close to old Town and still allows easy access to cabs/tour buses etc. Safe area with good nightlife options if that's your thing. The rooms are not large, however, they are VERY nicely done, comfortable bed, nice bathroom tastefully decorated though small. The staff is helpful as the airline lost my bag and they got me where I needed to go for clothing. The A/C in the room is THE nicest I've ever experienced. It is quiet, and works to the temp you set, where most hotels the racket could keep one up. The propoerty is in great shape and a better value for the money than many other hotels in San Juan. Good for business and access to the airport and old Town. For perspective I make Hilton Diamond by June every year and then start on Best Western Disamond which I make. This is a good option for business.

Reviews.Title: “comfy!”
Reviews.Author: camobio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree for 6 nights. The room was really clean and had ample space for two people and all of our belongings for the week. We were impressed with the efficient use of space in the room and the hotel in general. The hotel staff were super friendly and helpful with suggestions of activities, directions, and just generally chatting about PR. The hotel was clean and quiet, definitely had a professional/business atmosphere. The pool are was generally not busy, but the water was pretty chilly. There was a 24 hour grocery store across the street, which was extra nice because there was a microwave and fridge in the room. Although the beach closer to the hotel is Ocean Park Beach (about a 5-10 minute walk), we preferred going to Condado Beach (about a 15 minute walk) because it was cleaner, had chairs for rent, and had more lunch options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel for not much money.”
Reviews.Author: NickandSue114247
Reviews.Content: While taking a cruise from Fort Lauderdale to the Caribbean, my wife dislocated her artificial hip. We were landing in San Juan the next morning so the ship arranged an ambulance to take her to Presby Hospital in San Juan. Even though the hospital was a little primitive by USA mainland standards, the staff and doctors were wonderful. The doctor put my wife's hip back in place but not in time to make it back to the ship before it left for St. Kitts. The hospital recommended the Doubletree as an inexpensive but nice hotel for the evening. It was not only inexpensive but one the most beautiful and comfortable hotels we have stayed in. The clerks were very concerned about my wife's newly repaired hip and gave us a room near the elevator. They also offered us chocolate chip cookies that are to die for! The only "complaint" I have is that the breakfast buffet is fairly expensive for a budget hotel ($29.00) but after the service and the comfort of the rest of the hotel I was not unhappy. All in all a wonderful experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very calm and restful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ljoanne76
Reviews.Content: If you want to rest or just spend the night, this a perfect getaway. The pool is small but very clean. The rooms are very updated and smells great!!! Overall a very enjoyable visit! And the courtesy cookie was great!!

Reviews.Title: “People make the Place”
Reviews.Author: Seeqer
Reviews.Content: The people at the hotel were great! Omar at the Front Desk and Rafael out front, can set you up with any adventure or destination and everyone is warm and friendly. The rooms are as stylish and comfortable as any Ritz or Four Seasons I've been to. Across the street is a supermarket and the rooms have refrigerators, microwaves and coffee set ups, so you can stock up with snacks for coming back to your room late. The hotel is centrally located but cabs are costly. At least the staff and amenities makes it a pleasure to be in the hotel versus those places that you just use as a sleep and shower headquarters.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Comfortable, & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: PalmettoGuesthouse
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this property years ago prior to the new management & remodel & it is a completely different property now-in a great way! The hotel is very clean, close to groceries, restaurants, shops, has a super fitness center & rooms are all you could need. The wifi worked well, there is a mini-fridge & even micro in the room. Rooms are modern with clean lines & are nicely appointed. It was a great value for the money in a central San Juan location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with Amazing people.”
Reviews.Author: albert407
Reviews.Content: The staff is Amazing, great attitude all the time from managers, front desk, the valet parking service, their people behind Michael's bistro and their sales staff. Iâ€™ll be back in January and Iâ€™m looking forward to stay at the Doubletree. Hey be careful with the cookies :)

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SirSimon
Reviews.Content: Located in the business section of the Condado area, this property is small, yet efficient. It is quiet and perfect for business travelers as there are no noisy and drunk vacationers roaming in the corridor at night. It has four very distinctively different restaurants. Under the Tree serves an array of fresh and innovative light fares along with the more traditional salad and sandwiches. The Ceviche sampler and the pulled pork appetizers at the Alquimea are simple yet delicious. The gym is small. But the machines look new and they work well. The staff at the hotel are amazingly friendly. Peter, John, Paul, and Margarite at the front desk are eager to help whenever I had questions for local eateries, beaches, sights, or culture. I am bringing a team of colleagues to stay there for a five day meeting in the coming month. While we will be working non-stop and having many late nights, the helpfulness of the staff will make our work a whole lot easier.

Reviews.Title: “This Is The Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Agreatguy4
Reviews.Content: What can I say, WOW!! On the day after my third stay at this property this year, I reflect to each and every time I visit, it gets better and better. From Check In to Check Out. Raphael, you are the best man! Your champagne treat was much appreciated! The Complimentary Upgrade. Loving that Room 310 and last to mention the Tkanksgiving Day Brunch/Buffet. Amazing! Everything. Much fun. Jorge, you just keep doing what you do with those Mojitos. Tastes the best. In all, Thanks again Doubletree staff for all of your kindness. Looking so forward to my next visit!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Presently surprised with service, decor and location.”
Reviews.Author: uscga2000
Reviews.Content: Though not on the Ashford Strip of Condado the Doubletree surprised me with its staff and ammenities. Staff was bi-lingual and extremely professional...even the graveyard shift staff. Fitiness center was one of the best hotel gyms I've seen in recent memory. Room was trendy and electonics were modern. Definitely staying here again if my travels bring me back to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: EricL97332
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week. Hotel was in a great location. The staff, especially Peter and Miguel, were excellent. They provided detailed directions to my meetings. Room was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Ponce56
Reviews.Content: This place is the best in the area. Near Airport, Museums, Restaurants and Shopping for everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel -- the staff are extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: FearlessK
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great; a very Crate-and-Barrel vibe, clean and modern, but warm in attitude. We loved the free wi-fi, Wolfgang Puck in-room coffee and tea, warm cookies on arrival, the SuperMax supermarket conveniently located right across the street (great for the forgetful and/or budget traveler!) But all this pales next to the uniform excellence of the staff. We were greeted like family when we arrived, and made to feel warmly welcome by literally every member of the staff during our stay. We started to write down the names of the people who raised the bar on an already high level of guest pampering: Peter, Omar, and Yamira (thanks for the great restaurant recommendation!) at the front desk, and bellman Rafael Roman. They all seemed glad to be there, and delighted to see us. We would unhesitatingly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Condado section of San Juan, and will certainly stay there when our travels bring us back to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: Perkinpeak10
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night post cruise. We were able to check in early which was great but it turned out our assigned room was occupied (not good). Luckily the maid caught it before we accessed room and found us another room. The room was very clean. Had shower only. I was hoping to take bath after having shower only all week on cruise. The desk chair had 2 broken casters that kept falling off. The staff was very friendly and helpful - lent us cooler (leaked), cork screw, bottle opener. It was nice having a supermarket across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for the value”
Reviews.Author: Aventurera1_10
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent choice to stay if you are looking for location, quality and value. This hotel has been renewed by the Hilton's. It is located in the heart of the San Juan area, close to the Airport (about 10 minutes far), main Highways, Old San Juan, El Condado and Isla Verde. So you can go everywhere in minutes. Plus you have the quality and service of the Hilton's signature. You have the choice of eating in the hotel's restaurant or if you prefer, you can walk around to find other options to eat. Next time we go to Puerto Rico, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business AND pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Bigbluedk
Reviews.Content: I was in San Juan for business and found the location ideal, since I did not have to worry about the dreaded traffic jams going to my appointments or when returning to the hotel. Having a 24 hour supermarket across the street is also very convenient as you can store your snacks in the fridge in the room or prepare your microwave meals in the room. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from the beach. However, I took advantage of the Beach Club, which gave me access to the hotel's two sister hotels free of charge. One is located in Condado while the other is in Isla Verde. I tried both of them and they were both very nice. I will definitely stay at the Doubletree again when I return next month, and use the beach and pool at these hotels. And I will definitely return. The service is impeccable and the staff extremely friendly, always with a smile and time for a chat.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Condado, Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: GabrielRFritz
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very good, with LCD screen and a good design. Also the hotel staff are very friendly. It was a good pleasure to stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: behanjjp
Reviews.Content: A nice clean hotel, the rooms are small but they have great showers. perfect for the leisure stay that we had planned. The check-in was quick and efficent with very welcoming and polite staff. The only downside to this hotel is you can hear people in the halls talking if they speak loudly. The bar staff are excellent service was quick and they were full of information about places to visit and what is happening in town. The resturant was very nice good food. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best and Friendliest Hotel I've stayed in in years”
Reviews.Author: thandoc
Reviews.Content: This was a treasure. Staff was wonderful. Room clean and spacious. Great pool. Kept our luggage after check-out while we toured Old San Juan. We we returned, they took us to a spa where we could shower and change into our travel clothes. Could'nt ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for Pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: imamood
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Doubletree San Juan prior to leaving on our cruise. We arrived fairly late in the day. The room was very modern and had a view looking over the city. We walked to the ocean the next morning which was a good walk, maybe about 10 blocks. A grocery store across the street provided last minute purchases for our cruise. The hotel lobby was impessive and the pool area was clean. We were disappointed in the friendliness of the staff. At checkin, the clerk was strictly business with no smile or friendly greeting. He offered no information other than handing us our keys. The next day, the young man at the gift shop where we ordered lattes also was unfriendly. No worries though, we were on vacation and all was good! Just assumed it was the Puerto Rican way. Despite the unfriendliness, we loved the hotel and would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: StangGT909
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our honeymoon (7 day cruise Caribbean cruise, staying over 1 night in San Juan at the Doubletree). I spent many many days researching reviews on Trip Adviser. We were looking for a hotel in San Juan (preferably Hilton chain) but saw many negative reviews about the Caribe, Conrad, and Waldorf. After going with the Doubletree we could not be more pleased. We got off the Royal Caribbean boat and were lucky to find another couple going to the Doubletree. It was a $22 ride but we split it so it only cost us $11. When we arrived the staff was amazing. We were really exhausted from the cruise and the heat and it was really nice to have them bring our suitcases to the desk and then to our room. The warm cookies were also a nice touch. The lobby and room have a really modern and trendy feel. They had a lounge with a huge flat screen TV, restaurant, and bar. The room itself was shockingly clean and also modern. The high speed internet was free and extremely fast. The bathroom had nice glass tile on the shower wall and a trendy vessel sink. Overall we were shocked at how nice it was and the minute we got the room we felt we made a great decision. The location isn't amazing, but it was about a 5 minute walk to a Starbucks, fudruckers, and pizzeria uno. It is moderately close to the airport compared to some of the other hotels. We took a taxi to Old San Juan and I think it ran us $15 each way. I think the taxi to the airport the next day was also about $15. It's probably one of my favorite hotels I've stayed at and that says a lot after struggling to decide on what one to book in San Juan. I hope this review helps!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: SunnyBoy50
Reviews.Content: I live in Mayaguez and once in a while stay in the local hotels in San Juan. I recently stayed at the Doubletree for the first time since it was recommended by a friend. Nice hotel, clean rooms, friendly staff, free wifi, four very nice restaurants. Special thanks to the maid on the 8th floor "can't remember her name but I stayed in room 806". Thanks also to everyone at the front desk especially Peter, Yamira and Diane for their courtesy and professionalism. Definitely, a pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Our memorable 5th anniv. trip at Doubletree by Hilton San Juan”
Reviews.Author: DSKARIAH
Reviews.Content: First of all, I need to clarify that this trip occurred back in July 2009. Sadly, I kept putting off the review. However, I am writing the review over one year after the fact since it was such an enjoyable experience. I loved that we were able to travel out of the country, and visit Puerto Rico and not deal with the headaches of international travel; we had less than five days for the trip. We did not have to worry about a passport or currency issues. Booked our stay in San Juan through an on-line vendor, and convinced to check out this place after reviewing all sorts of websites (including Trip Advisor). The folks there made the trip extra special. The GM (J.C.) put us into one of a handful suites on the first level (pool level). I ran into an issue with the on-line promotion that I got for breakfast. Surprisingly, J.C. provided us breakfast for free at their hotel bistro "Under the Trees" Amazing breakfast! I thought how well can a hotel make breakfast. Ordered the waffles twice - that good. Overall, the hotel was super clean, and the employees were quite gracious. It was hot and humid outside (expected in July), but cool and comfortable inside our room. We were not exactly a hop away (rather, a long hop and a few steps away) from the beach. Rough waters, but soft sand. Plenty of sun. Hopped into the pool area once - literally a few steps away from patio. It was nice having a cup of coffee in our private poolside patio. This hotel provided us a nice jumping off point. We could walk across the street to buy groceries. It was kinda of neat to see the local produce. Walgreens was not too far either. Other local dining options in the area to visit by taxi or even walking. Our last night - wanted a nice, relaxing place to go - Alquimia (Double Tree). Island Shrimp was delicious. Okay, enough on the food. We walked for souvenirs (obvious tourists) and dropped by the El Museo de Arte de Puerto Rico (MAPR) - check out the outdoor garden! El Morro and San CristÃ³bal are only a bus drive away. We made a day of it in downtown San Juan. Lastly, we had our comfy beds and well decorated room to spend our evenings. I just wish we could have taken some of those warm Double Tree cookies home! Of course, no two people have the same experience. Nevertheless, I would strongly recommend this hotel. We've experienced the resort gig (in Costa Rica), which is very nice, but the Double Tree in San Juan offered us a wonderful home base for our 4 day stay. If we had more time, we would have loved to make some longer trips. Sorry for the late review, but I guess better late than never.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was very nice but the maid service was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: PRHoliday
Reviews.Content: First Impressions The Staff (Excellent) My lady and I stayed at the San Juan Double-Tree Hotel from Sep 28th thru Oct 1st 2010. Our initial impression of the grounds was a favorable one. Upon checking in at the counter we were warmly greeted by Courtney and Margarita. We received the traditional and delicious choclate-chip cookies at the conclusion of our registration.The interior lobby was nicely decorated, cheery and polished. Room Accommodations (Appears nice and inviting but....) We resided in Room 602 that had a perfect view of the Super-Max mini grocery store just across the street. Our room was tastefully decorated but unfortunately did not meet our standards of hotel cleanliness. The Safe (Very nice feature) A very nice digital safe was found closed and locked upon entering the room thus requiring a call to the front desk. Mr Ismel came up and corrected the problem within minutes. A special thanks to Courtney for her quick attention to our needs. The Mini-Refrigerator (Quite convenient and adequate) Was a nice amentity and cooled our purchased bottled water and other beverages quite nicely. Maid Service (A lot to be desired) We never did receive the daily two bottles of complimentary water as advertised at any time during our stay. -The view through the main windows that we could see the mini-grocery store included a few disappointing nose smudges. -The mirrored table by the sitting chair was full of fingerprints smudges as well. It appeared that the maid had her fingers on the mirrored table while she was cleaning and never checked to see that the mirror table was really clean after she was done. -The bed sheets although appearing to be fresh did manage to have a fresh stain on the mattress side and on top of the inside sheet as well. This was a total turn-off for the both of us! :-( The furniture needed polishing as well as the glass sliding door to the bathroom was smudgy and required a thorough cleaning also. The floors were inadequately vacummed every day. We even moved the trash can from under the desk- closer to the door to make it easier for the maid however, upon returning back to the room we found the trash can in the exact same location where we had left it?? The Temperature Controls (Worked very well) Worked quite well and 73 degrees appeared to be the ideal setting for us during our stay The Bathroom (Almost great) Included a nice design that was adequately clean and initialy fully stocked with towels and the normal grooming accessories. On our 2nd night we found no bath towels at all and after calling and waiting a couple of hours we were finally properly accommodated. The wash basin was always left wet and not wiped out daily which rendered a tacky appearance. The Shower (Functional obsolesence) Has a nice hand-held shower head-The shower floor was poorly designed because it is not raised up so the water cannot be contained and subsequently runs onto the floor thus causing a potential safety hazard! It's a shame because the bathroom otherwise is well appointed and nice. The Bistro (Excellent but slow service) We ate downstairs a couple of times and found the food to be ok and the portions small. My lady really enjoyed her salads and the coffee was delicious however, on one occasion a big fly managed to find its way into my cup and the waiter humbly apologized and contacted the manager. The manager cordially apologized and did not charge us for both meals. That attention to detail and excellent customer service was most appreciated! We did notice that there was never any salt and pepper on the table for dinner which we found odd. In conclusion, we both agreed that the hotel management needs to have more quality assurance with their maid service. The maid that we had appeared to just go through the motions thus giving you the illusion that the room was in order. This is a big deal and really needs to be addressed immediately!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: barthoic
Reviews.Content: Several weeks ago, my wife and I traveled to San Juan for our honeymoon. We booked our stay well in advance and were able to get a much reduced price of about $100 per night for the basic queen bed room. Along our trip, we stayed at two other places, all for about the same amount, and simply none could compare with the Doubletree. Also, if you are afraid of traveling during the â€œhurricane season,â€� donâ€™t be too concerned. We went during the peak of it and had about 10 minutes of rain each day. When it rains, it rains hard, but wait 10 minutes and the sun will be back out. When we arrived, we were immediately greeted with a warm welcome by the staff and the hotel looked amazing. Everything was extremely clean and simply unbeatable for the price. Since we were there on our honeymoon, manager Yodil Caban assured me that they would do everything possible to make it outstanding. Although I had booked the most basic room, we were given one on the first level, with a patio that led out to the pool. As you can see from the pictures, everything was in immaculate condition and a tremendous room. The location of the Doubletree is not ideal, but it is still very convenient to get wherever you need to go. It is located right beside two major bus routes that will take you to the main strip in Condado, as well as right to Old San Juan. Additionally, it is an easy walk down to the strip where there are countless restaurants, as well as beautiful beaches. Right across the street is a Supermax grocery store to pick up snacks, meals, or whatever you would like. Although driving in San Juan can be a challenge, the hotel is also just an hour drive from El Yunque, the rainforest, and an easy day trip. There are numerous places to rent cars; we went to the Enterprise on Ave Ashford, either a quick bus ride down the street or about a half hour walk do the strip. There are closer places if you'd prefer. The one downside to the Doubletree is that the self parking is $15 and valet parking is $20 per night. We spent one week in Puerto Rico, four nights at the Doubletree, another two on the small island of Vieques, and one more at the Doubletree . (I would highly recommend a trip to see the Bioluminescent Bay on the island, it is phenomenal. Also, the beaches of Vieques are incomparable to any I had ever seen before.) So that my wife and I didn't have so much luggage to take on the Vieques Air Link flight over, we left two of our bags at the Doubletree. As soon as we got back to the hotel after our two day trip, I immediately heard my name called out by the bellhop, Antonio. Without waiting for the concierge to say what room he needed to take the bags to, Antonio said he already knew the room and went off to get our luggage. Within minutes, he was at our door with all of our things in perfect condition. All in all, we had an outstanding trip and a tremendous stay at the Doubletree. An added bonus was the delicious warm chocolate chip cookie upon check-in. My only regret is that we only had a week in Puerto Rico. Thank you to all who made our honeymoon a trip to remember!

Reviews.Title: “Even better than the first time!”
Reviews.Author: Californian12
Reviews.Content: One more time I decided to trust the Double Tree in San Juan and I was very pleased. The service still great and the people are extremely friendly. They go out of their way to make sure you feel like at home. Cleanliness is spotless and beds are supper comfortable. One of my favorite things about this hotel are the showers. I feel like I am staying in a super expensive new york city modern hotel. The area offers lots of amenities and is extremely close to the beach (Walking Distance). The hotel will give you towels and even a cool chair to relax at the beach. If you are craving good sushi try Silk at the hotel. Will definitely stay there every time I go to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every way”
Reviews.Author: Spankems
Reviews.Content: Where to start. We were allowed to check in early. Staff was top notch, room was very comfortable with a nice view. Lobby was appealing. Restaurant very good. Pool area was great. This is an awesome hotel with the best staff I have ever experienced. We will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in puerto rico”
Reviews.Author: lynpena
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. We travel all year long and stay in many hotels but this by far has been the best stay. I think managment should now Peter in the lobby was exeptional. He was very helpful since this was our first time to Puerto Rico.He made it a very pleasant experience and that can not be said of all the lobby staff. We stayed in Puerto Rico for two weeks touring the whole island and unfortunalty needed to stay in other hotels as well. They were no where near as good as the Double tree in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton Service With Reasonble Rates”
Reviews.Author: missdior21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed to stay one night prior to boarding our cruise ship. After reading many great reviews we decided to stay at the DoubleTree. They greet you with a warm chocolate chip cookie (that was very delicious!) We couldn't be happier with our decision! The staff is extremely friendly and approachable, the rooms are modern and super clean and the location was great! We had no trouble getting taxi's from the hotel to do sightseeing and it's location was only 15 mins from Old San Juan. There is a super market across the street which made is very convenient to pick up some last minute snacks. Overall, We highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Puerto Rico our stay here kicked off a great vacation. Thank you DoubleTree!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One less thing in my life to ever be concerned over !”
Reviews.Author: Jumper33
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive about the condition of my room, but that was before I saw it. Clean, modern, comfortable, and cool. I really hated to leave it. I took measurements and photos of bath and shower so when I remodel mine, I'll reproduce it. The staff was polite, friendly, knowledgeable, and eager to help. It would really be difficult for me to expect any review that was less than excellent .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel;conveniently located, great staff, modern facilities”
Reviews.Author: Cmoral
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel and its facilities. The chocolate chip cookie was a nice touch. Hotel looks great and inviting. Food and beverage product is very good and all the staff was very accommodating and nice.

Reviews.Title: “CAN'T WAIT TO RETURN...”
Reviews.Author: KayBelle830
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to San Juan last week for my birthday and a friend suggested that we stay at the Doubletree, I have to admit that at first I was a little reluctant to stay there but after reading the reviews and talking to some of the previous guests I figured "why not". There was a 24 HR supermarket across the street from the hotel where we shopped for snacks to cut down on the cost of eating at the hotel. CHECK IN: We arrived at the hotel and was greet by Yamira (I believe that is her name). She was pleasant and made the check in process quick and easy. To our surprise even though we arrived early our room was available. Of course before we left the desk we were given some warm cookies...great way to start a vacation. ROOM: The room was very cozy, clean and had a trendy look. Flat screen TV, dual in room phones, wifi connection and even a clock radio that you could play your ipod/mp3 player to. *** The only complaint that I had with the room is that when you took a shower the water leaked from the door, no biggie...just had to ask for extra towels HOTEL STAFF: During our stay I felt very comfortable and at home at the Doubletree. Being new to the island Yamira at the front desk was very helpful with telling us places of interest to visit and some local spots to eat. She was very helpful and instrumental during our stay at the Doubletree. Our last night stay was the day before my birthday and my husband set up with the Manager Miguel, the Valet Jerry, and the BellHop Rafeal to surprise me with wine, balloons and cheesecake in the garden area of the hotel. The guys even put out some xmas lights to make the setting a bit more romantic....to me that was the icing on the cake. The hotel staff are busy attending to their daliy duties and they went out of the way to make sure that I had a great birthday. My husband and I are planning a trip back to San Juan next year with some other couples and we plan on staying at the Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “Labor Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: RichRR
Reviews.Content: I was in San Juan on business and extended my stay through the Labor Day weekend. I chose the Doubletree based on the reviews. While very nice, it does not warrant the #2 spot it currently holds. The lobby is nice and trendy, especially at night with live music; the business and fitness centers, and the pool area are fine, but the guestrooms are small. The rooms have a microwave oven, coffee maker, a fridge and a safe, and the wireless internet signal in the room is strong and free. But they charge a 14% hotel resort fee as if they were a resort on the beach and that is just not so. The beach is three blocks north and one block west. There is a supermarket across the street to stock up and the A-5 bus stops right outside, if you are patient. Otherwise, taxis are $15 flat rate plus $1 per suitcase.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Best Service!”
Reviews.Author: bellaitalia58
Reviews.Content: We were on our honeymoon and were upgraded to a poolside room when we checked in. The room was beautifully furnished and very clean. There is one restaurant in the lobby area and three others right outside. Old San Juan Is beautiful and the waterfalls in El Yunque rainfoest are great! If you have any questions ask Peter at the front desk, he knows everthing and always had a warm welcoming smile. Juan, Diana and Margie were very helpful too as well as the rest of the staff. Keep it up guys, great service!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: hwcii
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. Exceptionally quiet and comfortable room. Special kudos to the staff (Eddie, Sonia, Robert, Pedro, Rafael & more). The staff was fantastic. Delicious asopao (Puerto Rican stew) at dinner. I've stayed in other San Juan hotels and this one gets an A.

Reviews.Title: “Good bussiness hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Enriquegb
Reviews.Content: Close to the airport and to the main highways. Close enough to old San Juan and the casinos for the time off. Good gym. Parking is $15.- extra. Staff is helpfull. Rooms are small but very nice. Cafeteria is acceptable. Right next to a supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY PERFECT!!!”
Reviews.Author: LOVELV
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are staying in Puerto Rico for two nights prior to a cruise. In fact, I am writing this review from the hotel, as our cruise departs tomorrow. We couldn't decide which hotel to choose, but we're so happy we chose the Doubletree by Hilton San Juan! I was impressed when I first sent an e-mail inquiry. I received an e-mail response really fast and then I called and spoke with Daniella. She was incredibly helpful! The warm chocolate chip cookie that everyone mentions was amazing! When we arrived in our room, I immediately noticed a beautiful platter of cheeses and toast. There was a note from Rafael, the Bellman. He then knocked on our door and introduced himself and gave us coupons for breakfast. When we asked him for suggestions for dinner on our first night, he walked us outside and showed us where the restaurants were located. What service!! We ate dinner at Under the Trees, and it was great. Karina was so friendly and answered all of my many questions. We had breakfast the first morning at Michael's. My husband had the "Puerto Rico" sandwich, and I got the French toast. Both were delicious! I cannot say enough about the staff. Diana and Juan at the Front Desk were also fantastic. Everyone went above and beyond to help us with anything and everything. We enjoyed every minute of our stay and would choose this hotel again in a heartbeat! I highly recommend staying at this wonderful property. The staff is second to none!! Thanks to all of you for such a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Everything but the clerk at the front desk”
Reviews.Author: stew629
Reviews.Content: posting this review from my room on my blackberry on my last night. The free cookies were delicioso, the room was immaculate, the only problem was the Peter at the front desk, you'd think someone would be happy to have such a nice job but everyone else was 100 percent great

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ybeltran
Reviews.Content: I'm a travel agent so when I do my personal travel I look for things that others tend to miss and of course I use it as my personal reference when booking my clients. This was a quick trip to celebrate my daugther's b-day and from the moment we check in till the moment we check out our time was just wonderful. The staff was just amazing and rooms were clean and roomy. Just amazing - although, not by the beach it is within a 5minute walk to the beach, the other condado area hotels are within a 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Business Hotel, but Iffy for Leisure”
Reviews.Author: rmaggid
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving in Puerto Rico, my girlfriend and I spent our first night on the island at the Doubletree. After receiving a fantastic rate on Expedia and reading the reviews and viewing photos we had very high expectations. Needless to say we were not let down by the hotel itself. It looked like a model of what a business hotel should be out of a designers portfolio. We were promptly greeted and welcomed by the valet in front who helped us unload our bags and asked if we would like to self-park or have him take care of it, we chose to self-park after we checked in. He offered to move the car off to the side of the entrance, so we would not have to rush back. The hotel lobby was beautiful, sleek, and modern. Upon reaching the check-in desk, we were promptly greeted by all smiles and some 'just-out-of-the-oven' cookies! Like everything else, the hallway and room was catalog worthy - extremely well designed. The bathroom in the room was sexy and sleek, while the rest of the room was immaculate and modern. We eventually ventured outside to the pool area which was very nice, although not up to the same design standard as the rest of the hotel. The pool itself was smallish and the water was very cold, especially for Puerto Rico. The business center and fitness center appeared very nice. The hotel also offers free internet. Now for you detailed readers, I mentioned earlier that the Doubletree "is what a business hotel should be." We were in PR for purely leisure, staying at the Doubletree our first night after arriving, then leaving the next morning to explore the whole island. The hotel had a very distinctive business oriented feel to it. As a non-business traveler there really wasn't much of anything to do at the hotel or in the area. The hotel tries to be a mini-resort, but just doesn't offer enough to come through on that end. Its location is terrible for a tourist, you definitely need a car (which is a confusing pain) or to catch a cab to go anywhere. Would I stay here again, probably not. For a comparable price I'd pick the Sheraton in Old San Juan. If you need to be in the Condado area of San Juan on business this is definitely a great pick.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: PRTravelerUSA
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel. Great staff, very clean, across the street from a 24 hour grocery. I would stay there anytime.

Reviews.Title: “chic”
Reviews.Author: sbthomas00
Reviews.Content: This embodied the essence of the Puerto Rican culture: lively, hip, avant garde, metropolitan. The people were very friendly and staff very helpful. I thoroughly enjoyed the facilities and our stay in PR.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: liltraveller88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May and I was blown away with the room. Very clean and loads of room. Service was great, very friendly staff. Location isnt the best, but that depends what you are after. We wanted to be near old san juan - just did not research properly. But id give this 5 * Nice quiet clean pool and hot tub. Washing machines, gym, free internet.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE LOVE LOVE”
Reviews.Author: Jessykah
Reviews.Content: I spent approximately 6-weeks living in this hotel while on business travel. The hotel is clean, the staff is helpful and friendly and the location is great. More importatny I had the great pleasure of watching the Doubletree "team" work over an extended period of time and can tell you they bcame a second family to me. The staff at the bar and restaurant work harder than most people you will meet and always make you feel welcome. I don't think you could replace any of them but a pecial shout-out to Victor and Jorge who are AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: j_vargas1007
Reviews.Content: We recently took a trip to Puerto Rico and stayed at the Doubletree in San Juan. It is a beautiful hotel. The rooms are exquisite and comfortable. Not to mention that the staff caters to you. They are, also, very helpful. They let us know what attractions and hotspots to go to during our stay. There is a market directly across the street which definitely comes in handy considering they also carry liquor. It is a 3 short blocks away from the beach which is amazing. One of the bellhops was tons of fun. His name is Rafael so if you plan on staying there be sure to speak with him. All in all it was a great trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel should be #1”
Reviews.Author: SaraHernandez
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel several weeks and I highly recommended it. The rooms are cozy, clean, well lit, with a comfortable desk. We had a microwave, coffee maker and a fridge. The hotel is at a walking distance of a 24 hr supermarket, the beach, and easy access to the main highways. Exercise room, Pool and Jacuzzi available. Office center has a laser printer available, and a beautiful lounge with tables is you need to meet up with your coworkers. The hotel has a small restaurant and bar (great Mojitos!!!). I felt safe walking around the area. Hotel has valet parking or self parking and there is a fee for it (other hotels around the area have higher fees). The Art Museum is maybe 10 minutes away by foot. Cab from the airport is not more than ~$20 - $30 one way. What impressed me the most is the consistency in service throughout all my stays. The staff was extremely professional, eager to help, and worked well together. The staff sets the tone for the hotel. I look forward to my stays.

Reviews.Title: “It was a peaceful and a beautiful weekend,”
Reviews.Author: Pablunski
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the weekend with my fiancee and she loved it, it was a surprise i had for her. All she said was "Thank you, it was all a dream". The room was so nicely decor for us, it was like they were waiting for us. The room, the bathroom, pool, jacuzzi and the amenities, it was all an excellent taste. The personel were so polite and treat us like we were the only ones int the hotel. It is a paradise in the caribbean. The bad thing is that i did not know how to do the check out because i wanted to stay forever. My fiancee said to me that she wanted to do it again in a near future so, im already planning for the next vacation at the hotel. Here are just two pictures of hundreds.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Vacation in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: WeLovePR
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that my wife and I visited Puerto Rico this year. In March we stayed in Rincon at a B&B called Tres Sirenas so see our review about that once in lifetime place. This time we stayed at the Doubletree by Hilton in San Juan for 6 days and 5 nights. My wife and I were very pleasantly surprised and extremely happy about the Doubletree in San Juan. Great location, Great Staff, very, very, very clean hotel. We will definitely stay at the Doubletree again in the future. We were very fortunately to have booked this trip which included breakfast for 2 for the entire stayed. The breakfast choices for those with this offer are limited but you do get the choice of two slices of big size French Toast, Pancakes with fresh berries, made to order two eggs with potatoes, toast and your choice of Canadian bacon, sausage or American style bacon. They also have a Puerto Rican style breakfast sandwich called Puertorriqueno and this is not your typical breakfast English muffin sandwich (this is a must if you stay here for breakfast). You also can choose the Fruit bowl and also the buffet if you like which is a full buffet breakfast and not a continental breakfast. Every breakfast comes with as many as you like freshly squeezed tall glasses of orange juice and piping hot coffee. Yes!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Smart40
Reviews.Content: I planned a trip to Puerto Rico for my boyfriend's birthday. I chose the Doubletree because of the reviews on tripadvisor. We arrived on a Monday afternoon. The Front Desk staff was very friendly, the girl that helped us had a thick accent and it was kind of hard to understand her but she was so friendly we grinned our way through it. (I'm sorry I'm bad with names) She gave us a lot of suggestions for restaurants. The room was very clean, the bathroom was spotless. The huge plus is the 24 hour supermarket across the street. The lobby was well kept. One night while we were there they had a mangers special where you could drink anything from the hotel bar for free for an hour. The Doubletree is not really close to a lot so the taxi fees became pretty expensive, but if you are going for pure relaxation or this is not your first time I would strongly advise anyone to stay here. The staff is very, very friendly and the hotel is very well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families or business”
Reviews.Author: Kellyexcursions
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of TA reviews and sometimes don't agree with them, but I have to say, this was one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. It's not that it's very luxurious it's not. Definitely a business class hotel. I stayed there 4 nights with my eight year old daughter purely for pleasure and it was wonderful. Believe the reviews about the staff and management. My daughter turned 8 our last day there and they surprised her with cookies and a stuffed animal. We ate breakfast every day at the hotel and I found the food each day to be reasonably priced, excellent service and very good food. A nice, but not large pool is on the premises. Directly across the street is a 24 hours supermarket. We ventured over there three times for drinks and snacks. This is a full sized supermarket not a convenience store. Having the taxi stand there was extremely convenient. We never waited for a cab. Always one available. A cab to the airport or Old San Juan was $15 plus tip. To Ashford avenue where the big hotels and Casinos are it's $10 plus tip. My daughter and I ate at Jam Jam Rum Bar taking a cab there and we walked back even with me in heals. The neighborhood is quite nice and felt safe. Bye the way, that restaurant is fantastic. The room was clean, comfortable and well appointed. I would definitely stay again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could give it a higher rating”
Reviews.Author: patsbosoxfan
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree is a beautiful, modern, very reasonably priced hotel located on the outskirts of the Condado area. The location was good (but not great) as beaches and most of the restaurants were a 10 to 15 minute walk. We appreciated having a 24 hour supermarket across the street. The lobby was beautiful and inviting. Rooms were modern and well-appointed. Each room has a small fridge and microwave which we gladly used. We tried two of the restaurants-Michael's and Under the Trees. Both served excellent food, but were a bit overpriced. The biggest asset this hotel has is its front desk and concierge staff. I have traveled extensively and have NEVER encountered a group of employees who were as courteous, helpful and knowledgable as this group. No matter what question or concern we had, they were there to help. What an amazing staff!!!!!! The reason I cannot give this hotel a higher rating concerns the cleaning staff. Our room was just not cleaned properly during our stay. Beds were never changed (as evidenced by a stain on a sheet that remained there). The bathrooms were barely cleaned during our week there. Water marks on the glass door remained. The shower had sand residue from a day at the beach that was never cleaned out. The counter was never wiped down. Soap, shampoo and toilet paper were not replaced as they were used. The hairdryer was never put back. We had 5 towels upon arrival. After the first day, they replaced them with 2 or 3 leaving the hairdryer on the shelf that originally held additional towels. A sheet was not replaced on an air mattress so there were no covers one night. Overall-the cleaning staff was poorer than the majority of hotels I have stayed in. I would love to see this hotel work to balance its employee care level. It is sad that the excellence of the front desk staff is ruined by the housekeeping staff.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Doubletree San Juan was OUTSTANDING!”
Reviews.Author: Deborah1234
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to celebrate our anniversary in San Juan. After searching websites and reading numerous reviews, we decided to book the Doubletree in San Juan. Upon our arrival, we were greeted with warm smiles and excellent assistance from the Doubletree staff including Margarita and Rafael. Our room was nice in size, very clean, decorated well (with mini-fridge and microwave), and the comfort of the bed was exceptional. The vacation package we purchased included vouchers to eat breakfast at either of the two restaurants in the hotel (Michael's and Under The Trees). We ate at both these wonderful bistros and thoroughly enjoyed beginning our days after such delicious meals. Making the meals even more pleasant was the attentive service provided by the wait staff including Onix and Barnabe. The Doubletree had wonderful amenities including a business center, a well-equipped fitness center, a pool with hot tube located in a beautifully maintained garden, and of course their signature cookies (which are reason enough to choose to stay at the Doubletree). The Doubletree San Juan was located about two blocks from a strip that had numerous restaurants and boutiques and about a 10-20 minute taxi ride from the airport, Old San Juan, and Plaza Las Americas (the largest mall in the Caribbean). Taxi cabs were readily available without having to call in advance, and the staff at the Doubletree was very helpful in directing us to our varied destinations. My husband and I travel often, but our vacation in San Juan was probably the most enjoyable ever thanks to the Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Beautiful Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: mnblc
Reviews.Content: We loved the Doubletree in San Juan! Our room was beautiful and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. They helped us find a local mall when our luggage did not arrive on time and provided us with a few necessities when informed of our situation. We also loved the cookie that was provided to us when we arrived...it sure helped perk us up after being poorly treated by the airline we used. The rooms were extremely well priced, clean, and even included a $10 breakfast voucher, which was quite delicious. Overall, a great experience, that I would recommend to anyone wishing to stay in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel, not on the beach”
Reviews.Author: outofcvg
Reviews.Content: A nice pleasant hotel with very friendly staff members. The cookies they hand out at registration are very good and they are always willing to hand some out to you. The rooms are small, but comfortable. Easy to get in an out of. It is not right on the water but i thought the price reflected that distance. The two restaurants are quite good. There are also plenty of great restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Staff, Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Margot323
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night prior to a cruise based solely on Trip Advisor reviews. I highly recommend this impressive, yet affordable hotel. We enjoyed the friendly & helpful staff, a tasty dinner in the bistro, the modern bathrooms, the in-room refrigerator, the well-decorated, airy lobby, the free Wi-fi access, the comfortable bed, and the yummy warm chocolate chips provided at check-in. The bistro serves awesome french fries that are crunchy and crispy. The supermarket across the street is very handy. While in San Juan, if possible, take a tour of the historical Old Town. Also, we were very impressed with the The Bacardi Rum factory tour.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC FAMILY FRIENDLY VACATION AT THE DOUBLETREE”
Reviews.Author: rep37nyc
Reviews.Content: I had no doubt that this hotel was going to live up to its expectations. The best way to know if the reviews on TripAdvisor are REAL is to look at how many contributions(reviews) each reviewer has made on TripAdvisor prior. Most of the reviews were from members who had already reviewed other hotels. We had a wonderful stay. We are a family on a budget and this is the perfect place to stay if you don't want to rent a car. There is a super market across the street so you can stock up on snacks, drinks, etc. (the rooms all have refrigerators and microwaves). The beach is about a 10-12 minute walk from the hotel. Other reviewers indicated it was only a couple of blocks, but you should know that they are long blocks. Still not a bad walk with our toddler. The bus that takes you to Old San Juan stops right in front of the hotel. It can be a long wait, however, and we were forewarned by the staff of the hotel, but we made the trip anyway and were glad we did. There are also several restaurants onsite at the hotel making it all the more convenient. Michael's Bistro in the lobby's of the hotel was the most kid friendly. They offered us a kid's menu and crayons. We were over billed more than once so make sure you take a good look at your check before paying. I do not think it was intentional. Very nice staff at the restaurant and food is good. Pros: Super friendly staff Awesome pool area with kiddie pool and waterfalls and jacuzzi open 24 hours! Nice fitness center Homemade cookies at check-in (very nice touch) Beach/Pool towels for your use Location Local beach super clean and has playground Modern rooms with super comfortable beds Computers with printers available for guests to use (I was able to print out my boarding pass) Cons: POOL AREA VERY SLIPPERY...while we were there I saw three children fall because the stone they used gets super slipper when wet. I really don't know what they were thinking. Showers in rooms leak onto the bathroom floor a lot. We were a family with a small child and would have preferred a full bath with tub, Walls in rooms are somewhat thin.

Reviews.Title: “great option in Condado”
Reviews.Author: jjjjohn777
Reviews.Content: Believe the hype , people, the Doubletree San Juan is the real deal. I almost dont want to write this because it feels like a hidden gem. The front desk staffers were very helpful, you could tell they took pride in their jobs. My first room was across the hall from some noisy toddlers (this could happen anywhere), but when I complained the front desk was very accomodating and switched me immediately to a quieter "smokers' wing" of the hotel (couldnt even smell a whiff of smoke btw). Valet guys were cool, good cookies, free printing @ the business center, decent gym, pool, hot tub, and an outdoor chess board. Rooms decked out nicely with flat screen tvs and carpet .
