The neighborhood is boring, but I thought san juan nightlife was lacking in general. On the bright side, there is a large 24 hour grocery store across the street and "Bebo's Cafe" nearby as well. Bus stop to old san juan just outside the hotel (confusing because depending on what side you are waiting on, you need to take a different bus!). overall good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place & service; would go back in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: SpartanGirl3
Reviews.Content: We were there for one night stay overs between flights twice in a trip and we would go back again. The staff was lovely and so helpful. The rooms were nice and clean, the coffee delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay before cruise departure!”
Reviews.Author: acepenny
Reviews.Content: We decided to give this property a chance because of the great reviews we saw and we were not disaapointed. We were checked in by Juan who offered area restaurant recommendations - he was extremely friendly and very informative. Stayed in a room with a balcony that opened to the 24 hour pool and jacuzzi. Room very clean and well appointed - fridge and microwave in room. The hotel was very quiet. Rafael assisted with our bags - he was also very friendly and helpful. We truly felt welcome there. There is a 24 hour Grocery store directly across the street with parking lot security which we found comforting when we made a late night trek there. We had brunch at Under the Trees before departing to the pier. Would definitely recommend this property and look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising”
Reviews.Author: RobertW68
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree by Hilton in San Juan was an unexpected delight. Stylishly apportioned, it exceeded any hotel I stayed at in the continental U.S. The only failing in the room I stayed in was the leaking shower, where water strayed onto the bathroom floor, necessitating a constant clean-up.

Reviews.Title: “I would be happy with this room anywere”
Reviews.Author: nukenriles
Reviews.Content: Very nice modern rooms,extremely comfortable and well appointed.Pool and spa area well kept. Short walk to the main drag and the beach. i have stayed in Old San Jaun and for price and convenience this is the spot. 24hr supermarket across the street,free laptops for use in the lobby.Staff were friendly and professional,called me when my room was ready for early check in.Thank You

Reviews.Title: “Tropical heaven in down town San Juan, PR”
Reviews.Author: nursevader
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I loved the stay at this hotel. We stayed there for two nights while we snorkeled in Fajardo and visited El Yunque. We stay in different hotels quite frequently since my boyfriend travels a lot for conferences. This one was definitely one of the best for the price. Pros: Ultra modern appearance with nice touch of tropical presentation (pleasing to the eyes). Very down to earth and relaxing atmosphere. Super friendly and professional staffs. Proficient (if not native) English speakers. Well thought-out room organization and convenience. i.e. microwave and fridge. Moderately quiet air conditioning system with digital thermostat (worked perfectly for us). Upscale bathroom with spacious shower compartment with glass door. Neutrogena sandries. Moderately firm matress, plush (nicely thick) comforter, and fluffy pillows. (We slept very well) Two layers of window coverings, one is thick (sort of black out like....) and the other is thin. Good WiFi in a room. Flat screen TV with English channels. Marvelous swimming pool with water falls, hot tub, and ample reclining chairs in a beautifully landscaped yard. Three PCs (free to guests) with a printer. Well equipped gym (We did not use it). Parking: two options. Valet or self. Self one is right around the corner. About $16 per day with a room number. (hourly charge without a room number). 24hr supermarket right across the street. Deli was ok. They have sandwiches, sushi, and everything else.... An Asian restaurant called "Silk" was so good. It's right around the corner from the entrance. Tuna tataki, summer rolls, and sushi were of excellent quality (I am from Japan, and I think I know good Asian food). Safe environment around the hotel. Just don't go too far on Loiza st. Cons: Water slowly runs beyond the shower door. It takes about 5 mins walk to get to the beach. Everything else was good....

Reviews.Title: “great hotel near airport, old San Juan, and Condado”
Reviews.Author: nofatties13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight to check out Old San Juan before heading to other spots on the island. This hotel was very clean and secure, great service from friendly staff. Nice pool area and fitness center, breakfast in the a.m. was very good. Lobby bar closed a little early, we went at 10:30pm and they already had last call. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable value; outstanding in every respect”
Reviews.Author: EasternShoreman
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I stayed here for four nights. We both are seasoned travelers, and we knew from TripAdvisor that we'd have a good experience, but the quality of the stay was off the charts. The friendliness and sophistication of the staff were top drawer. The breakfast/lunch restaurant was an ideal fit for the purpose. The rooms are done in a Mediterranean modern motif but not tacky. The designer was ingenious in his/her use of glass block light admission in the bathroom and the uniquely designed frameless shower. The size of the base room is quite adequate, and the deluxe room has loads of space and two closets. The rooms are exceptionally quiet, which is helped by being at the edge of an apartment neighborhood. The ample lobby has several bright, attractive sitting areas and a smart PC work area. All in all, this Doubletree deserves a lot more than 3 1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great hote overall - very comfortable rooms, wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel1027
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree San Juan soley based on the price.. it met our expectations and we are very picky! Couple of things: -We stayed in the garden view rooms - stay there! It has a nice view of the pool, trees, etc. - Try to stay on the 4th floor: We were on the 3rd and heard people on the 4th floor walking around at all hours of the day/night. - The walls are a bit thin..we could hear our neighbors through the connecting door and on the other side, our neighbor was banging things around all day. All the staff were very friendly and service was superb! Location was not the most convenient - but there was a 24 hour super market across the street and a few nice places to eat on Ashford Ave which is like a 15mn or so walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: diana2
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful. Our room was excellent. Wifi, cable, comfy bed, nice restaurant and a great location. This hotel has it all. I would definitely recommend this hotel without hesitation and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: mefferson
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time in PR. This hotel has everything you need and the rooms were beautiful. They have a nice pool with a little waterfall as well as a Jacuzzi that's open 24 hrs a day. As well as a gym equipped with dumbells and cardio machines. The hotel was kept fairly well and everything seemed so new. Check in and check out was fairly easy and the staff were just the best. They were very informative and willing to answer any questions you had especially Monica and Rafael from the front desk. They always had a smile on their face and could recommend places to eat or visit in Puerto Rico. Overall, this hotel was more than I expected. For the price, it beats any hotel along the beach. Make sure to stay here when visiting San Juan. Tip: The hotel charges $20 for valet parking or $15 for self parking a day. Find parking around the neighborhood instead. Plenty of parking if you look.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel! Would definitely come back here!”
Reviews.Author: kejannic0206
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from the Doubletree in San Juan. We stayed for two nights in San Juan after returning from a cruise. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. When we arrived they gave us warm cookies that were delicious! I spent some time by the pool which was very nice! We also walked to the beach which was about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The only down side to this hotel was the location from Old San Juan (where we did most of our touring.) It was a $15 cab ride to and from Old San Juan and this hotel. All in all, it was definitely worth it and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: JJsadventures
Reviews.Content: It is a little out of the way, but very accessible by bus to Old San Juan and a short walk from the beach. Beautiful, small pool and spa. Great workout facilities. Small business center. Free internet. Close to the airport. Trendy decor. The rooms are a bit small, but I think most the rooms in Puerto Rico are small. We had two different rooms (on two separate stays) and one was significantly larger than the other, so not all the rooms are tiny. They have very nice, modern decor with flat screens and very comfortable beds and pillows. The breakfast is great and the staff is very friendly and helpful. It is a fairly quiet neighborhood, but the blinds do let in a lot of light in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations and I will return.”
Reviews.Author: Willsot
Reviews.Content: I had a room on the top floor overlooking the pool area and I could see a bit of the ocean. Room was very modern and comfortable, exceeding my expectations. There is a nice full-service 24-hr. grocery store directly across the street with a deli and bakery. There is also a public bus stop right next to the hotel and I took the bus to and from old San Juan for just 75 cents per ride, a great deal if you have a little time and don't mind waiting at the stop. It is easy to walk to the Condado beach and many restaurants. I enjoyed my 2-night stay and will return as I am a big fan of San Juan and Puerto Rico in general.

Reviews.Title: “A well run hotel in a good position”
Reviews.Author: GethersUK
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our 2 nights in the Doubletree pre-cruise. The hotel is well run, very clean and within walking distance of the restaurants in Condado and a nice beach. Internet access, via a cable in the rooms, was fast and at no extra charge. It's a short taxi ride from the airport and from San Juan old town. It was nice and quiet, unlike many hotels in the old town itself. I would return to this hotel again, and it made a very good impression for Doubletree in general.

Reviews.Title: “THEY CAN'T DO ANYTHING ELSE TO MAKE IT BETTER!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerMayaguez
Reviews.Content: I used to stay with my wife in this hotel many years ago (Hotel Pierre) during weekends for pleasure. After several years, we returned but, to our surprise, the hotel had been restored to a Five Star Hotel. It is beautiful, comfortable and its personnel make the stay wonderful. Prices are moderate and affordable. My stays now are for business purposes and I cannot enjoy the facilities. Really, they can't do better!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, great hotel with just enough frills”
Reviews.Author: CalifornianInChina
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the doubletree san juan for four nights in april 2010. i chose the doubletree based on the strength of its reviews on tripadvisor and its relatively central location. it was a great choice! the hotel has wonderful amenities, but is basic enough to keep the price down. (i actually booked using my united mileage covering the majority of the cost.) our room was lovely, there was (good) coffee and tea for each morning before we set out (neither my boyfriend nor i can even think without a cup of coffee in the system), the staff was great but unobtrusive, bathroom amenities were thoughtful and replaced regularly. on days where we decided to stay by the pool (it was very windy while we were there, the beaches were less than enjoyable because of the wind whipping sand everywhere), you could enjoy the modest little pool and be left alone, which we really liked. you can also work out at the gym for free, which is rare. a lot of hotels force you to pay a gym fee at the spa. there were also two laptops in the atrium lobby where you could check email for free. while the outside of the hotel can be underwhelming, for us it didn't matter. we liked the location because we could walk to condado to eat, or ocean park for the beach. there's a supermarket across the street where we stocked up on beer and fruit to avoid the markups at restaurants during the day. our room faced the supermarket and ave de diego, but there were no noise issues. we'd definitely stay here again. if you're low-key like we are, you'll like this hotel. the drawbacks were few. housekeeping in the mornings could be heard through the thin doors (lots of doors slamming and banging), and the bathroom is encased in glass, meaning you can clearly hear and sort of see what's going on in there. and middle-of-the-night bathroom users will light up the whole room if they switch on the bathroom light, which is annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever.”
Reviews.Author: Alicia0911
Reviews.Content: Fell in love with Puerto Rico and a big part part of that was because of this hotel. We stayed here a few days after a Caribbean Cruise. The hotel decor was very modern and our room was spacious, comfortable and clean. We loved the large, stylish bathroom. The outdoor pool and hot tub were clean and landscaped well. There was a coin washer and dryer so we went home from our cruise with a suitcase full of clean cloths. The best thing about this hotel was the staff. They were ALL welcoming, upbeat, funny and treated us like guests in their home. We took their advise about local foods to try, restaurants, sites, beaches, public transportation (bus stop right outside the hotel) and shopping. With the fridge and microwave in our room we even took advantage of the grocery store across the street. It's in a nice area so we felt very safe walking at night. Everyone spoke English well and taxi's were available within a moments notice. The front desk had complimentary, fresh out of the oven, chocolate chip cookies to welcome us home from our days adventures. We didn't get to do this, but a dive/snorkel shop could pick you up from the hotel early in the morning for a day of diving/snorkeling off the east coast including all food and drinks. We were told by many locals that we would have loved it. Maybe we'll get to do it next time because we're definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Condado area of San Juan”
Reviews.Author: knotheadusc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a vacation in the Caribbean. The first four nights of our trip was in San Juan, Puerto Rico. As hotels in Puerto Rico are pretty expensive and heavily taxed, we decided to stay at the Doubletree San Juan, which had good rates for the days we were staying. The fact that Doubletree is a Hilton property and that particular Doubletree had gotten great reviews on Trip Advisor helped seal the deal. We collect Hilton Honors points and I've not yet been disappointed by Trip Advisor's advisories. Location The first thing to know about the Doubletree in San Juan is that it is not located in Old San Juan. It's in Condado, which is a newer part of town. Condado struck me as more of the business area in San Juan. It's also fairly close to the beach. To get to Old San Juan, you'll need to take the bus or a cab, unless you have a car at your disposal. If you plan to take the bus, be sure to have exact change (75 cents). The fact that Doubletree is in Condado is not a bad thing if you want to go to the beach. There's a super handy 24 hour supermarket across the street from the Doubletree. We also enjoyed the awesome art museum which is within walking distance of the hotel. Checking in We arrived at the Doubletree at about 10:00pm. We were warmly greeted by Rafael, the bellhop. If you stay at the Doubletree in San Juan, be sure to get to know Rafael. He's always smiling and tremendously helpful! Tip him generously, because he deserves it! Throughout our stay, Rafael did everything he could to see that we felt welcome. Our room Our standard room was pretty small by American standards. We had a queen sized bed, a desk with wireless Internet, a large flat screen TV with local cable, a microwave, and a fridge. Ice was available down the hall and we had a Wolfgang Puck coffee maker. There wasn't a very nice view from our window. Besides blackout shades, the windows were covered with a lighter shade that let in sunlight but kept out the depressing view. The bathroom The bathroom was very small, but stylishly appointed with a rainfall shower, a Villeroy and Boch toilet and sink, and Neutrogena toiletries. Other hotel amenities The San Juan Doubletree has a gift shop, complete with Godiva chocolates, a business center with free access to the Internet, a fitness center with Precor equipment, and a very nice pool area with manmade waterfalls, a hot tub, and lots of lounge chairs. Food Aside from the fantastic Doubletree cookies one gets upon checking in (and from Rafael if he catches you looking crestfallen), the San Juan Doubletree has several restaurants. We tried one of them, Michael's Bistro, for breakfast our first day. Breakfast was not included in our rate and, to be honest, I thought it was a bit overpriced. I think we paid about $12 each for lukewarm eggs and bacon. The coffee left much to be desired. I would recommend going elsewhere for breakfast unless it's included in your stay. There are plenty of options nearby, including the 24 hour supermarket across the street. Breakfast is served there. The Condado area also has some pretty good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. If you're keen to eat onsite, there's Silk, which specializes in Asian food, Under The Trees, a pasta and omelet themed restaurant, and Alquimia, a wine and tapas bar. We didn't try any of these restaurants, which I think were located in the business area directly adjacent to the Doubletree. I can also recommend Bebo's Cafe, a great no-frills restaurant just around the corner from the Doubletree. We ate lunch there and not only was the food good and plentiful, it was also cheap! The concierge We were very impressed by the concierge, who was helpful when we decided to take a day trip to El Yunque. She helped us rent a car and gave us directions to the rainforest. Our overall experience We liked the Doubletree, though the bed was a bit harder than I would have liked it. While not being in Old San Juan kind of kept us out of the tourist action, we liked the Condado area because it was close to the beach and wasn't overrun with tourists waiting for cruise ships. The fact that it was somewhat less expensive than the resorts in San Juan made it even more attractive to us. And that supermarket across the street was very convenient! I think we'd stay there again if we ever go back to Puerto Rico. It's clear that the San Juan Doubletree's manager is very concerned with customer service. He's got a great staff working for him.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travel but why no room service beyond breakfast???”
Reviews.Author: jmfangio
Reviews.Content: As others have already stated, this is a nice hotel and the service overall is quite good. I travel a lot for business and as such the needs you have for business are not the same for vacations. While I don't know that I would choose this hotel for a vacation, it met almost all of my needs as a business traveler. The wifi worked well everywhere in the hotel and was free, the rooms were nicely appointed and in good condition, there were decent public spaces to go work. Everyone I came into contact with was courteous and helpful. A glaring omission for business travelers is the lack of room service beyond breakfast. I find this baffling as when you travel for work, you rarely have time to go out and find restaurants and often eat in the room. When I called the room service number, I was told that I could go down to the restaurant order and pick it up, but there was no menu in room and no actual room service. I do not find this acceptable in any way. In addition, I found out that they don't actually serve lunch at all, only breakfast and dinner! This is another issue for business travelers. I would trade the Godiva chocolate store that's in the lobby for real room service and a restaurant that serves all 3 meals. In sum, this is a very good hotel that could be even better if they address the room service and overall restaurant offerings to what most business travelers would expect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelDTW
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and terrific neighborhood. The rooms are fantastic and might be the best appointed hotel I have stayed at in a long time. (The bathroom was really cool and the shampoos and soaps were neutrogena which I happen to love). The staff was friendly and efficient - rooms were kept very clean. The valet service folks were very friendly, always a big smile when we returned from one of day trips. The pool was lovely. We are not beach people so no big deal for us to not pay up to stay at a resort on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Average Location”
Reviews.Author: kjrailfan
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Doubletree prior to leaving San Juan on a cruise. The hotel was tucked into a neighborhood with a 24-hour supermarket across the street, office buildings, apartments, and some homes. It is a about a 10-15 walk to a beach, and a more "touristy" area that has a Fuddruckers and Starbucks. The lobby and rooms were very clean. The bathroom/shower looked brand new and very clean. The restaurant, though, is small. We tried to have breakfast on a Saturday morning, and it was a 20-30 minute wait. We opted instead to pick up some breakfast items at the Supermarket across the street since we needed some items for our cruise. The location is about 15 minutes from the airport and 15 minutes from the Pan American Pier, where our cruise left from, and 15 minutes from Old San Juan. If you have a car or just need a one night stay prior to a cruise, then I would recommend this hotel. Otherwise, you'll need a taxi to take you wherever you want to go. A bus line does run directly in front of the hotel; however, the front desk staff advised me it was slow on the weekends because the buses don't run that frequently. If you have time, the bus would take you to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed two nights after a cruise”
Reviews.Author: TDBBerlin
Reviews.Content: General: Stayed two nights before cruise in Old San Juan and two nights after cruise in Doubletree San Juan, which is in Condado area. Expected more of the area (Old S.J. is much better). Hotel is new, located about 10 minutes walking from the beach (forget it if you travelled in the carribean before). Opposite the hotel is a 24 hrs supermarket and a gas station (Shell). Easy walking distance to main road in Condado area. Parking: apart from hotel valet parking there is basically no parking in whole area. Hertz rent a car very close, easy driving distance to airport, Plaza Las Americas (huge shopping mall) and main highway of Puerto Rico (# 22). Not so good: Pool area was not really clean the day we stayed in hotel. However hotel very nice, rooms good, big enough and also very nice bathroom. Free business center. Hotel is good, area not.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem Within San Juan”
Reviews.Author: orr333
Reviews.Content: We were arriving late into San Juan and needed one night prior to heading to Fajardo to catch the ferry to Culebra. I booked the Doubletree because it was the cheapest Hilton property for the night we arrived. As a Hilton Diamond member, staying within the Hilton chain obviously has benefits for me. The location is not great if you plan on beach activities in San Juan. Aside from that, this place is a gem. It would be great for pre/post cruise nights. The staff was great from the valet to the front desk. They provided great insight to our drive time to the Fajardo ferry dock and what time we'd need to be there. The room is very stylish! We had a queen size bed along with a Murphy bed which the kids found very cool! For four people, it was pretty tight and an extended stay would not be comfortable. The bathroom was a little small but very unique and vogue. The bed did not dissapoint with the expected comfort of a Doubletree. The pool area, along with the whole property is very new and clean. The pool is somewhat small but the architects made great use of the space with a tiered structure for chairs. It is very nice out there! The fitness center is large and equipped with top of the line gear. Overall, despite our very short sleep, we found the Doubletree to be a fantastic value and would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our Stay”
Reviews.Author: strawbebi
Reviews.Content: We received a great price for booking online in advance. The quality of the hotel and the service really exceeded our expectations. The beds are so comfortable and the bathrooms are sparkling clean. There is a 24 hour grocery store across the street where we were able to stock up on drinks and food. From the hotel you can also walk to the beaches and some restaurants on the main street. A hertz is also located close by, it's about a 15minute walk. With the car rental we were able to drive Old San Juan, El Yunque and Fajardo. It's pretty easy to get around and the driving isn't as crazy as we were told. If you want a resort type vacation this probably isn't the hotel you are looking for. I would recommend La Concha or the Marriott Resort and Casino. This hotel offers beautiful rooms for a fraction of the price and a good location to explore San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dalesterSanDiego
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree is a very comfortable, modern hotel with all the amenities--good restaurant, gym, pool, helpful staff, free Internet, and, most important, quiet, clean, well-appointed rooms. After a week or more living on a small boat, staying here was heaven. It's about 10 minutes by cab from Old San Juan and perhaps 15 or 20 from the airport. We could not have been more pleased at the cleanliness, quiet, and comfort of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully renovated hotel with lots of amenities and friendly service!!!”
Reviews.Author: franciscojoel
Reviews.Content: We are locals who decided to "escape" the everyday hassles and relax in a nice hotel in San Juan... We booked this hotel because of the great reviews and we were very pleased with the experience. Everything was clean and tidy, the pool area was very nice and open 24 hours (big +++)!!! We had a minor situation with our reservation, but the Manager, Yodil CabÃ¡n, was gracious and attended the situation promptly... We are familiar with the San Juan area and found everything accessible. Even though is not located in the main street at El Condado, it's quite easy to enjoy the many sites by foot or by public transportation... We look forward to staying there again soon and would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel with Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: BC8-TC8
Reviews.Content: In late March, my wife and I spent two nights at the Doubletree San Juan. Upon arriving, we were personally greeted by the General Manager - Yodel Caban. His conscientiousness and obvious concern for customer service set the tone for the rest of our stay. Each hotel staff person we met demonstrated the same commitment to quality customer service. The hotel is modern and up-to-date with plenty of extra amenities that make staying here a pleasure. The fitness center is well-equipped and internet access is readily available. The courtyard surrounding the pool is also impressive and enjoyable to relax around. As other reviewers have stated, the hotel's location is also good with easy access to nearby restaurants, grocery shopping, and local buses that make it easy to visit Old San Juan. Access to the beach is also close (5-10 minute walk). While the physical characteristics of the hotel (e.g., appearance, location, amenities) deserve recognition, in the end, it is the hotel's commitment to customer service that deserves praise. My wife and I have stayed at numerous quality hotels in the past, but rarely have we come across the level of service and care demonstrated by the staff working at the Doubletree San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not #1 as rated.....”
Reviews.Author: ludiandrade
Reviews.Content: Doubletree Hotel San Juan - Booked this hotel thru an orbitz package staying Mar29-Apr 3, 2010 - Room 317. Before booking I researched TA reviews as usual. Although TA rated this hotel #1 in San Juan, PR, for the first time I must disagree. I do agree with previous reviews regarding its staff - The staff is extremely courteous and friendly - I say the most friendly in all our travels. They all go out of their way to satisfy your needs. The front desk serves as concierge helping you with booking excursions, transportation, advice on sightseeing, admissions, bus routes, restaurants, etc. They are all extremely knowledgeable - trust their advice! The bellhop, Rafael, is very friendly and carries a permanent smile on his face! Location & Transportation: Very safe. Tourist police are noticeable at all times. 20-30 minute bus ride to Old San Juan - depending on traffic. Bus fare is $0.75USD pp. Easily accessible. Take Bus B-21 - stop is located right across the street. Tell the bus driver your destination and they tend to remember and advise you when your stop is coming up! Great service! Taxi from SJU airport to hotel is $14USD + $1USD per bag + Tip. This is standard fee. From and to pier is @$15USD. Restaurants: Although the hotel has an independent restaurant on premises Michael's Bistro, we were very disappointed that the hotel offers no room service from this only eatery on the property. This is not usual Hilton standard. You can order and pick-up which is very inconvenient. The front desk advised us that they are working on that. The bistro, modernly decorated,has excellent service and food. We both tried the Cuban Sandwich served with fries or onion rings that although it was not exactly the "true" Cuban Sandwich (I am Cuban) - it was excellent! The server prepared a special complimentary drink he created called "Sangria" which I highly recommend. The restaurant is on the first floor by the entrance which unfortunately allows for an uncomfortable environment when the front hotel lobby doors open, high humidity retains in the enclosed area. Better off eating outside. In the building adjacent to the hotel you will find other fine restaruants such as Silk and Under the Trees. Both offer very good food in a very nice environment. Around the corner is a local restaurant Bebo's, also very good with its local traditions. Housekeeping: This is a problem that really upset us. When we first arrived, no towels were in the room. Unfortunately I noticed this upon coming out of the shower and had to use the hand towels to dry. We later called and towels were taken up quickly. There seems to be no area for bath towels in the bathroom so they were left on the counter by the room window daily afterwards. Pretty odd. Room was never cleaned properly. Upon our initial arrival we found food items purchased by the previous guests in the small fridge and nonperishable items in the small pantry furniture. Upon arriving we also found a dead roach in back of the decor chair and it was never vacuumed-up during our 5 day stay although I kept moving that chair so housekeeping would notice. The sink bowl contained the same toothpaste residue on the outside for our entire stay. I wiped it up the last morning myself. Mirrors were never wiped up. I usually travel with a Clorox-CleanUp pack for these reasons. Lately, even Hilton properties are slacking in housekeeping. The "Sweet Dreams" white decor pillow had a red stain on the front. This was never repalaced nor cleaned. Amenities such as shampoos, face cleanser, etc, were never replaced once used. We did not report these issues as they were embarrased enough with the towel and other incident with the shower later described. Room: The room is modern decored with a European style bath. Shower is large and spacious with a safety bar but no handheld showerhead. Coffee, tea, fridge, microwave, iron & ironing board, in-room safe, free wi-fi throughtout entire hotel and free wired connection in room. Two phones, alarm/radio clock, 32" LCD TV, comfortable desk and lots of lighting. Make-up mirror in bathroom and hair dryer. Not too much area for personal items in the bathroom. Shower leaked profusely. Reported that and maintenance came immediatly to try and correct. It continued to leak so just used towels to hold it in. Dangerous situation as you can slip and fall after shower. Bed in this room is queen size and not comfortable . We found it to be on the "hard" side causing back pain. You could feel the springs. Bed also "creaked" constantly upon sitting on edge. One big problem we encountered was the window shades - no curtains in room. The shades are not "darkening shades" so light enters the room at 6am brightening the entire area. If you need to sleep in a dark room, this is not the hotel for you. Room size excellent for two people. Hotel Areas: Hotel is designed very european style. Beautiful lobby areas. Front desk is hidden in the rear by elevators. Dont understand that concept. Pool area needs updating and more inticing decor. Business area has three desktops for guest use- nice and clean area. There is also a counter in the lobby with 2 secured laptops that are for guest use. Beautiful floral arrangement greets you in the lobby. There is a small gift shop by the front desk that specializes in chocolates- Godiva chocolates, too. Visited the excersice area but did not use. Seemed clean. Taxis are available at all times. We didn't have car but valet parking is $20per day. Ouch! I have nothing but good compliments to the entire staff of this establishment but overall, this hotel is good for a first time non-beach stay in Puerto Rico however, we will probably stay elsewhere in the future. Hotel did not live up to our personal expectations. Hilton Honors Member.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kap22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Doubletree for two nights pre-cruise. Had never been to San Juan and picked this hotel because of the reasonable price and the good reviews on TripAdvisor. All of the positive comments are true. The facility is very nice and the staff is terrific. There is nothing negative to say about this hotel. I'm sure that there are are more luxurious hotels around but not for anything near the price. The stay was great and I will stay again if in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with extremely attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: soccerchic10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for the last two days of our honeymoon and were bummed we didn't stay longer! The staff was very helpful, the place was well decorated and clean and we received a complimentary upgrade because of our honeymoon. Overall, it was fabulous and an excellent deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, chic hotel with friendly service”
Reviews.Author: cowboys1fam
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Doubletree before heading over to Rio Grande, PR. It has a central location with easy access from the airport and to Old San Juan. It is also only a 3 block walk to Ocean Park Beach. Perfectly clean -- and I am a clean freak. One of the staff here said it was renovated 2 years ago when purchased by Hilton. All of the staff is super friendly. The pool area is nice with comfy towels and lounge chairs along with a jacuzzi. The hotel is in a heavily populated area so things are pretty compact and there is not much of a view due to the tall buildings all around. They have done a good job of putting palm trees, etc around to make it feel less "citi-fied." There are many restaurants within walking distance so no need to drive around. We enjoyed "Silk" --they serve sushi, and chinese cuisine. Parking is a bit much at $20/day valet or $15 self-park, but comes with the terrifory. Oh yeah, and the warm cookies are to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you're going to cruise”
Reviews.Author: Been250
Reviews.Content: Excellent HHonors value for staying a night before or after a cruise, which was why we were there. We had a large, pristine room with walk-out patio to the pool. It was quiet and staff was generally helpful. Check-in times were adhered to, rooms weren't ready early. Shout-out to Michael's Bistro, one of the on-site restaurants. We had an excellent meal (stuck to sandwiches, $10-13, rather than entree's at $20-25. ) Our waiter told us that everything down to the mayo is made there from scratch and I believe it. As another reviewer mentioned, there's a supermarket/pharmacy across the street. Cab service is $15 to the airport or cruise terminal, plus $1 per bag.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MarBaz
Reviews.Content: Although my boyfriend and I did not have the best weather during our Puerto Rico trip almost a year ago, this hotel more than made up for it. We were welcomed by a friendly staff member (a woman, but I don't remember her name) and some warm cookies. Our room was very nice: we had a nice, clean bathroom, flat screen tv, very comfortable bed, and a spacious room. A few pros of the hotel include: a beach within walking distance (about 5 minutes) from the hotel, a grocery store (that sells liquor) right across the street from the hotel, and restaurants inside, and within walking distance, of the hotel. The staff was very friendly and gave us good recommendations on restaurants, tour guides, and ideas for sightseeing. The nice woman who welcomed us (she was very nice during our entire stay) recommended Rafael as a tour guide (http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g147319-d1171873-r57935145-Pr4less_Tours_Adventure-Puerto_Rico.html), and he did an excellent job. The restaurant in the hotel was alright, and so was the breakfast. On our last day, we still wanted to do some exploring after we checked out, so the hotel (for free) stored our luggage for us until it was time for us to head to the airport. I didn't feel scared while I was walking around the hotel's neighborhood during the day, but I never did that at night- we either took a taxi or came home too late /too tired from an excursion to walk around. Assuming this hotel hasn't changed in the year since I have visited, I would recommend this place in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Just not that good”
Reviews.Author: DeportesGuy
Reviews.Content: I was just really surprised this was the same hotel that was reviewed so highly on TripAdvisor. My wife and I tried, but did not enjoy our stay at this hotel. 1. The rooms are TINY. Smallest rooms I have ever stayed in. The hotel told me it was a 50-year old building and they only had so much to work with. They moved us to a "bigger" room, which was nearly identical to the first one. 2. The service was really bad. The staff just seemed like they didn't care. It was honestly strange because it was almost like they weren't even listening to what you said. Whether it was the people behind the desk or in the hotel restaurant, it appeared as if they just didn't care. 3. They advertise Room Service everywhere but when we called to order...the hotel told us that they do not have Room Service. They also advertise massages, but during the entire trip, there was never anybody working in the Gym/Massage area. It was just an empty desk the whole time. After staying here a few nights, we switched to a more resort-type hotel on the beach in San Juan and the difference was night and day. It was then that we actually felt like we were on vacation. And the hotel we switched to was only $50 more than the Doubletree. My recommendation is, if you're going on a vacation to San Juan, don't skimp, spend the few extra bucks and go to a place with a nicer staff, nicer amenities and enjoy the resort experience. You won't regret it. I tried to save money and it came back to bite me in the end (you get what you pay for). The only way I could see anybody enjoying the Doubletree is if they are business travelers, and not in town on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for two people”
Reviews.Author: atlgardener
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the Doubletree. Husband and I were there for 4 nights. You can tell the hotel has been recently renovated, and it is very centrally located. We walked a lot in the area and felt perfectly safe. Loved having the market across the street. Three blocks to beach and Starbucks, cheap cab ride to Old Town (we also took a city bus to Old Town and it was fine). Also walking distance to a Hertz if you want to rent a car for a day to visit the rain forest. The rooms are small - fine for 2 people but I would not want to have my kids in with me. Pool area small but nicely laid out and fairly quiet. Housekeeping was good, but not perfect (bathroom spotless, dusty surfaces in room). Beds were great and our room was quiet. We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the lobby restaurant - very good food and we thought the service (at dinner) was friendly and professional. Skip Under the Trees next door - overpriced, average to bad food, surly service (on 2 occasions). Best meal we had (dinner) was at Jam Rum Bar & Bistro - excellent food and service, walking distance from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good room, between Old San Juan and Ocean beach--3.5”
Reviews.Author: Fr-and-Km
Reviews.Content: Wanted to rate it 3.5 stars. Rated 3.5 because of the area [unchangeable], bistro staff [easy fix], housekeeping hiccups [easy fix]. Then it would certainly be 4 stars. Pros: Lots of friendly & helpful staff [especially Peter, Antonio, Courtney, valet staff]; modern and updated decor & facilities; between Old San Juan [OSJ] and Isla Verde; easy taxi [flat rates $15] and bus $0.75 [coins only] access from de Diego Avenue to OSJ using the A5 south or the B21 north. Both go to the bus station in OSJ. A5 goes thru the entertainment and arts area on Ponce de Leon while the B21 goes thru the big hotel/beachy area on Ashford Avenue. Buses do not run in the late evenings. Warm cookies. Wolfgang Puck coffee* in rooms. Tile floors mopped daily. Fresh bathroom linens daily. In-room safe, frig., microwave. Cons: Housekeeping gave coffee supplies* just twice for a 5-nite stay, first and last nites. Room only vacuumed once. Michael's Bistro staff was the biggest smudge on this hotel. Less than warm staff. We had contact with 7 staffers and just 2 were friendly. Felt like these people didn't work for Doubletree. Had just one meal there. Ate at Green Tree, Molini's [walk west on Loiza in the daytime only], OSJ restaurants. Skip eating at Bebos--really. Convenient grocery across street for fresh fruit, beverages, snacks, etc. Hotel is in/close by/surrounded by a neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are true, this is an excelent 3 1/2 sar hotel.”
Reviews.Author: T J T 1
Reviews.Content: Flew in on Saturday for a Sunday cruise on the Victory. Cheched in at 4PM, no problems. Nice King room with patio, 80feet to pool and whirlpool from patio door. Restaurant in the lobby of the hotel is very good, it opens at 6pm. Steaks Sea Food and sandwiches.($10-30). Great nights sleep, left bags with front desk while we had breakfast at a restaurant, out the front door and to the right 100feet. very busy and slow but good food. ($14 each). Took a $20 taxi to the ship at 1:30pm. The Doubletree was a great start to a fine cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a not-so-nice area”
Reviews.Author: jcrusselljr
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - clean comfortable room, staff was friendly and accomodating. We stayed here based on (1) points to use for a free night stay @ Hilton and (2) Tripadvisor rating this the 2nd best place. I wouldn't stay here again, but only because it isn't really in an area that is good for walking around (especially at night) and it's kinda in the middle of...well....nothing. A great hotel in a "blah" area.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could really ask for....”
Reviews.Author: tedsredseat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights based on all of the good reviews and it was as advertised. We were thrown off by having the pool closed for the day for some updating and maintenance when we arrived, but it was a blessing in disguise. We were given a pass to La Concha which was right on the beach. I highly recommend if you want to go to the beach walk the extra 10 minutes down to the beach next to La Concha, you can use their facilities, swim at a great spot, and pass by multiple restaurants to have a choice from for lunch or dinner. If you dont mind a little walking or saving $100 a night against the beach front hotels then this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: ryanfamily3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel pre-cruise. Our criteria included price, proximity to the airport/cruiseport and two beds (with at least one of them a queen). We had rooms that had a queen and Murphy double. I traveled with my husband, 3 kids, in-laws and brother-in-law & his wife. This place was convenient to airport and cruiseport - about a $20 taxi ride each time. The rooms were TINY - but clean and adequate for our needs for the one night. My only complaint was that the shower had no lip on the floor - so if you opened the door to get in or out while the shower was on, the floor got flooded - this was a concern for my elderly in-laws. We ate supper and breakfast at Under the Trees - food was very good and not terribly expensive. The courtyard/pool area was very nice. There were two (free) laptops for use in the lobby. I wish we could have stayed here post cruise as well - but we got a rate of $130 pre-cruise and post-cruise it would have cost $349!! so we opted to stay elsewhere - which was not as pleasant. Also - as others mentioned, there was a supermarket across the street which was convenient for incidentals you might have forgotten - or for bottled water, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: bkehoe
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were welcomed by the very friendly valet parking and check-in staff. Although we arrived before check-in time, our room was ready within 10 mins and we were given some of the lovely cookies mentioned by others to enjoy while relaxing and waiting for our room. The room itself was a king size, with a balcony (with small table & chairs) and direct walk-out access to the pool area (beside which were some lovely loungers to relax on). Decor is very modern, the room and bathroom were spotless, aircon was quiet, lovely powerful shower, and in general it was a pleasure to stay there. The only problem I had was that I had booked a 'romance package' so was expecting a bottle of wine, however this hadn't arrived by the time we were leaving to dinner so I mentioned it to reception and told them that it wasn't worthwhile any more and that a fruit basket or something similar would be ok instead. However when we came back, they had supplied both the sparking wine & fruit, so this was fine for me. Our arrival before the checkin time was most likely why this problem occurred so I don't think it should reflect poorly on the hotel or team. The only other problem was an unrequested automated wakeup call at 6:30AM. Internet access was free and functional though was quite slow. Breakfast using the included vouchers from our package (different menu to normal) was very nice, service was good and the food was plentiful and well prepared. All in all, we were very impressed with this hotel. I choose it because of the reviews on Tripadvisor and was happy I did. In fact it was even better than I expected. We had stayed the previous 2 nights at a 4 star beach resort on the East coast and it was no comparison to the Doubletree. We wished we'd stayed all 3 nights here. The friendliness of the staff was exceptional, everyone seemed happy in their jobs and were happy to help with anything, the facilities are great, location is good (only $15 flat rate and less than a 10min taxi trip to Old San Juan), The only disadvantage being the lack of direct beach access, though it's not far to walk or you could drive to other beaches. If I ever go back to San Juan, this would be my only choice and only recommendation to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: PereLeBlanc
Reviews.Content: I agree with everything others have said who give this place a top rating. Here's an example of how a hotel can make a great impression on guests: On the 2nd day of our stay the drain in the air conditioning unit over the entry way to the room got plugged up and leaked water on to the floor. When we called the front desk we were immediately give a new room a few doors away. While we were moving a staff member named Courtney came up to apologize and to give us vouchers for a free breakfast for each of the remaining days of our stay. Earlier in the morning we had told courtney about a few things that needed to be fixed in the room and all of them were addressed within a couple of hours. We were very impressed with how Courtney and other staff were freindly and helpful and very responsive whenever there was a problem. Jose and Peter were great with help with restaurants and getting around San Juan. Very good place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: bozza
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night pre cruise and everything was what we hoped it would be. Never met a more friendly and helpful hotel staff. Although our upgraded rom wasn't quite ready when we arrived we were given some water and the famous warm cookies and we sat outside for a few minutes in the delightful surroundings of the pool. The room was great, everything you need and very modern. The supermarket across the road was a bonus for buying toiletries etc., to take on the cruise. We walked around the corner to Bebo's Cafe which was full of friendly locals(always a good sign) and we enjoyed an excellant, reasonable meal and a half pitcher of Sangria. We then headed back to the hotel and had a drink under the stars around the pool along with other people who were using the pool or just sitting around. Only thing that could be improved is that the service at breakfast was a bit slow, but we were on holiday so that didn't realy matter. And an added bonus was that we got to meet the charming and very handsome Jose (operations manager) who told us all about his island of Peurto Rico which he obviously loves. Thanks to everyone at the Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Doubletree!”
Reviews.Author: buttons78
Reviews.Content: What can I say bad about this hotel? NOTHING! I'm a Hilton Honors member and I've stayed at many Hiltons before. This one was by far the best! I was there for 7 nights and did not want to leave. Everyone at the front desk was polite and spoke English very well. I was told the hotel was recently remodeled and boy, did they do an awesome job! The lobby area is very open and inviting. I loved the outdoor lounge area. I spent many nights sitting outside listening to coquis while enjoying a glass of wine, people watching and socializing with other hotel guests. This hotel is ideally situated in the Condado area that is easily accessible to fine dining, shopping, nightlife, and the airport. There is a 24 hour grocery store and gas station across the street. The only annoyance was the city was tearing up the sidewalk and pavement in front of the store and heavy equipment was everywhere, but that was no fault of the Hilton. The hotel is within walking distance of some great eating places. Bebo's Cafe, Molinas, and Silk were my favorites. The hotel has a restaurant called Michael's Bistro. They serve breakfast and dinner but I didn't eat there... I only had drinks at the bar. The room was well-equipped with a mini fridge, microwave, flat screen tv, and work station. Internet access was free and the connection speed was great at all times. The bathroom had a shower only, no tub. One minor problem is that the shower didn't have a sliding glass door. There was only a curtain so the floor flooded everytime I showered. It was all good, just required housekeeping to leave some extra towels. The bed was incredbily soft and I slept like a baby. I used the pool only once during the week. The pool area is nice with lots of comfortable lounge furniture. The pool was rather small but it's not a resort so I wasn't expecting a big olympic size pool. I didn't use the fitness center but passing by I observed that it was nice and had state of the art equipment. I guess maybe the only thing that I would have liked better is if the guest laundry had been inside of the hotel. You had to go outside and walk through the pool area to get to it. But again, it was no biggie. I enjoyed my stay and I can't wait to return. The Hilton Doubletree in San Juan has a customer for life!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic service at a good price”
Reviews.Author: seeingtheworld_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days and used it as a base to explore San Juan. The staff were great. Every single hotel staff person we encountered was friendly and helpfu. The room was in very good condition, with all the amenities we'd need. It's a short walk down to the main hotel/beach strip, and just across from a 24 hour grocery store. Very convenient. The price was very reasonable for all of the amenities that were available.

Reviews.Title: “very walkable neighborhood, ocean park”
Reviews.Author: vista4u
Reviews.Content: get local flavor at the doubletree hilton....welcoming staff, helpful, pick up local street maps in lobby. a nice change of pace to the large resorts and just a short walk to restuarants on de diego or ashford ave, beautiful public beach 4 blocks bring your towel/beverage, local shopping nearby. fab massage on site by appt at fitness center, hot tub, small pool, plenty of towels and outdoor seating/tables, computer access in room or business center, small but comfy room with fridge(grocery across street sells everything), microwave, coffeemaker, hairdryer, safe, tv. just 75 cents exact change only to take A5 bus on de diego outside hotel to old san juan bus terminal 1 block from cruise piers and town....about 20-30 minutes. while ideally located for those who like to walk, rental cars and taxis will also get you to casino's, dinner, or the rainforest. i did take advantage of the hotel and adjacent restuarants and they were ok, my favorite "local cuisine restuarants" include "yerba buena" on ashford, and in viejo san juan: "el picoteo" in el convento hotel, or "raices" a short walk from the old san juan bus terminal (after 10pm i take a cab back).

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel with top notch and "green" amenities in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: rhroutjr
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and friendly staff, very comfortable and nicely decorated room with fridge and microwave, and very nice bathroom. Excellent bed and bedding. All was sparklingly clean as well. Good rate through priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: LRS0507
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree the night before our cruise in early January. Given that hotel prices are extremely high in San Juan, this is a great choice if you are just going to be there for one or two nights. The room was very clean and had nice decor. One bit of advice: do not put your make-up bag on the wooden shelves in the bathroom. When we left the room, the force of the door closing must have caused my bag to fall to the foor. Everything was cracked and all over the floor when we returned. Lesson learned! There was a highschool/college swim event in the area while we were there so the pool was constantly filled with loud teenagers. We were only there one night so it wasn't really a huge deal for us. The pool looked very nice. Our room was on the lower level and opened out to the pool area. We never noticed any noise during the night. We ate dinner outside of the hotel and stopped by the bar on the way back to our room. The bartender did a great job at showing us local rums and made us a really great mojito! The next morning we ate breakfast at the hotel. We had a discounted rate so it did not include breakfast. The food was good but the service was really slow. I had a vegetable omlet with stilton chesse and I believe it was about $15. It was Saturday and there appeared to be many locals eating there as well. There is a grocery store across the street which is very convenient. We bought soft drinks and water to use in the hotel room as well as to take on the ship the next day. If you were staying for an extended period, they have a large selection of liquor and beer as well. On our last trip to San Juan, we stayed at La Concha which is much more expensive since it is a resort property. While I loved the resort atmosphere of La Concha, for only a one night stay pre-cruise, I would save some money and stay at the Doubletree again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: Colleen55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived late in the evening to discover no food options at the hotel. We were referred to a local restaurant around the corner which turned out to be pretty good. We ended up there the next morning when we found out our "senior rate" did not include breakfast (in other words if you pick the senor rate you don't get breakfast so the price is basically the same as the regular rate with breakfast). For us the location made sightseeing awkward and used feet, taxi and bus to get around. We stayed for two days pre-cruise and for us would not stay again due to the location. in a nutshell good hotel but the location brings it down. We did not experience the good service others rave about however they did hold our luggage for us on the last day for three hours.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: ckm24
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I planned our honeymoon, we were a bit apprehensive about staying at the Doubletree because it looked a little bit farther from the beach than the other hotels in San Juan. Upon arriving, however, we could not have been more pleased with our decision to stay at the hotel. The entire staff was incredibly helpful, from holding our bags for a few extra hours while we went into Old San Juan on our last day, to arranging our trip to the rainforest; they were excellent. As far as the beach, it was only a couple of blocks away, and actually a very nice walk after dinner. Speaking of which, the two restaurants at the hotel were all great, offering a quiet sit-down place, as well as a casual place that offered delicious breakfast and lunch items. The area around the pool was excellent as well, providing a little oasis at night for grabbing drinks or going for a late night swim. The gym was also in great condition and it offered a good deal of equipment, which was an added bonus since I'm a personal trainer. When we go back to Puerto Rico we will most assuredly return to the San Juan Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Delightful”
Reviews.Author: SomaxOttawa
Reviews.Content: My husband traveled to San Juan for our Honeymoon prior to boarding our Cruise Ship. We had been once before on a stopover on a previous Cruise and were quite dissapointed with what we saw and therefore didn't expect much this time around, but let me tell you of our absolutely delightful experience this time around. We stayed at the Doubletree for 3 nights. Although dissapointed that the hotel has no room service and the restaurant is a little slow in service, our stay was great. The people at the front desk are always welcoming and the warm chocolate chip cookies are also a nice touch. roberto and Alberto were most helpful with our demands and always serving us with a smile. Roberto did enjoy our little red convertible Pontiac Solstice rental for the day. The room 2007 is large, beautiful and has a great view of the garden/pool area. Love the big comfortable chairs. There is a 24 hours grocerie store just across the street or head down to Silk next door for a very flavorful Asian cuisine. La patisserie franÃ§aise 2 blocks down offers the best breakfast at a very reasonable price. This hotel is very peaceful and just wonderful. They make you feel like you are part of the family. I would definitely stay again should we visit San Juan in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: DebbieO2
Reviews.Content: I used Hilton points to stay free, but would have paid. Staff was wonderful. Pool and rooms great. Get a room on the pool level

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel + great destination = my great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: GaTravelFam
Reviews.Content: After reading positive reviews of this hotel, my choice was made! I booked my vacation at the Doubletree San Juan. We stayed 6 nights and had such a great time. My husband and I took tours in the Rain Forest, the Camuy Caves, and the Bioluminescent Bay (this is a must). The service in this hotel was awesome. Each day we came back from these tours, we were greeted with a smile and everyone remembered our names as if we were among friends. It was so convenient to use the 24hr supermarket across the street because the rooms have a microwave and fridge. We also had the convenience (and leisure) of having the beach within walking distance (3 small blocks away!). We also had restaurants to choose from on Ashford Ave. (also within walking distance). I definitely recommend this hotel if you want a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff made my trip to San Juan a memorable one”
Reviews.Author: deeznutztyper
Reviews.Content: This my first review on Trip Advisor and its a positive one! I originally had planned on booking a two night stay at the Conrad San Juan Condado prior to a Southern Caribbean cruise on Carnival Victory back in December, but after reading the reviews on here about the Doubletree San Juan, I decided to stay there. I am also a Hilton Honors member and preferred to stay at Hilton hotels, so it fit perfectly. I corresponded with Yodil Caban, the hotel manager prior to my arrival and he made sure my stay was a nice one before I even arrived! Friday December 11th, I arrived to the hotel by taxi and was welcomed by bellhop Ezekiel (some name like that) who helped take my luggage to the front desk. At the front desk I was warmly welcomed by Juan who quickly pulled up my booking information and gave me my room key. To my surprise, he told me that Yodil was expecting my arrival and upgraded my room to the 6th floor with a view towards the ocean! The room was nicely furnished with nice decor, bed, and flat screen TV. I had originally booked a room with Murphy bed, but this room did not have one. I had a friend who arrived the next day and Juan made sure to get an air mattress put in the room upon his arrival. The Saturday evening I went to pick up my friend, utilizing the convenience of the bus stop outside to go to the airport (more about that in the another section). When we came back to the hotel and went to our room and the extra bed was ready along with two complimentary bottled water and cookies! Even though I did not get to meet Yodil, I did meet operations manager Jose Cepero who asked us how was our stay so far and if anything else he can make it better. I told him everything was perfect. He then advised us that people will be washing the windows in the early morning on Sunday and that it maybe noisy. However, we slept in and the window cleaning on the outside didn't bother us. Convenience wise this hotel is next to a 24hr Super Max supermarket, which came in handy as we bought stuff for our cruise. There is business center and two laptops in the lobby for guests to use. The beach is a 15 minute walk from the hotel. Also, along the street is a bus stop which I utilized a lot during my stay at the Doubletree hotel. I hate riding taxis and like riding mass transit in cities I visit because its a way for me to explore as well as interact with the locals. I took the B-21 bus to the Tren Urbano Sargrado Corazon station and then transferred to the B-22 bus to goto Plaza Las Americas (the largest mall in the Caribbean). I went to the airport to pick up my friend, rode the bus in front of the hotel to the Tren Urbano and rode that to the Pinero station and then took the bus to the airport. You can also take A-5 bus to old San Juan, which is what my friend and I did on Sunday prior to our cruise. Sunday we checked out and the hotel held our luggage while we when sightseeing at places like El Morro, Old San Juan, and the Bacardi tour. Also, the staff told us about Bebos Cafe which was just a short walk from the hotel, a nice local place to eat! Went there twice to eat during the stay! I just wished my stay at the Doubletree San Juan was longer. Nonetheless, when I visit San Juan again I'll be staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “You would be crazy to choose any place else.”
Reviews.Author: bryantl
Reviews.Content: This is by far the nicest and least expensive hotel in the Cantado area. It is two very short blocks to the beach and the neighborhood is very safe. Our room was spotless and modern, with a design that made great use of the space. You get a microwave, fridge and safe along with great Neutrogena bath products. The place is so modern and beautiful with a fabulous pool. Be sure and ask for Miguel Isaac, an assistant manager. He is so helpful and knows the area well. We left some items there and he helped get them back, a great person and a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Great Facilities; but Parking cost is too expensive.”
Reviews.Author: tripsc
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay -- they greet you with a yummy cookie, staff are professional and helpful, great facilities (gym, pool, internet, printers,... etc). But their charges for 'parking' for customers are excessively high (around $15-$20 per day). When I questioned them about their high parking rates, they indirectly encouraged me (with a wink-wink) to park in the neighborhood streets for free and that is what I did (I thank their staff for their wink-wink suggestion, it saved me a lot of $$ during my five day stay). I would give them a five star rating if they would lower their parking rates -- I would suggest that they lower their parking rates to a more reasonable amount -- say $3-5 per day -- for customers who have booked hotel rooms. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: zoe17
Reviews.Content: My mother and I spent a night at the Doubletree before a Caribbean cruise. Staff was very helpful, and it was convenient to get a taxi from the hotel to see sights in San Juan. Rooms were very clean, convenient and well-appointed, with decor that looked very new. The hotel's breakfast and dinner were convenient and not too pricey. It's about a 3 block walk to a pretty beach, but the beaches were not my priority on this trip. The hotel also provides free internet. Staff was very knowledgeable about getting around San Juan, and about the Caribbean cruises. We got better information from them about when to board our Celebrity cruise than we did from Celebrity! And I'm very thankful we took their advice! And the Doubletree folks at the 800 number were kind enough not to charge us for our intended first night of the stay when we were stranded in Atlanta due to weather issues instead of being in lovely San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “a modern gem where the value well exceeds the cost”
Reviews.Author: travelbugRaleigh
Reviews.Content: I was in San Juan for a conference and lucked upon this fabulous hotel when the conference sponsored hotels were full. As soon as I arrived at the hotel I was invited to the manager's cocktail hour(s) where I met many locals and fellow guests who had wonderful recommendations for restaurants, salsa dancing, secluded beaches, etc. The manager was incredibly informative and accommodating and practically planned out the rest of my trip for me. The rest of the staff followed the manager's lead by knowing both my name and my room number each time I passed by the desk (ok so I lost my key a few times.) Between the modern decor, the great location, the wonderful amenities, and the charming staff, I have no doubt that I will return to this hotel the next time I am in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was Excellent”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel1987
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend anyone traveling to San Juan to stay here. From the warm chocolate chip cookies, to the tropical pool and hot tub, and the modern rooms , everything about the establishment was excellent. The management, in particular, went out of their way to welcome us, accommodate all of our needs, and make sure we were having a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome from start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: Californian12
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived at the hotel the staff was extremely accommodating. Not only we had an extremely accommodating staff we had an extremely accommodating General Manager! We don't always have the opportunity to have a General Manager welcome us to the hotel but it was quite a pleasure. In fact from day one we felt that we had a VIP treatments. As soon as we got to our room we notice how clean and neat they are. The are very boutique looking and modern. Location is very convenient to shops and beach since the beach is walking distance. Overall our experience has been the best out of any hotels that we have stayed in Puerto Rico and we travel quite a lot to San Juan. Again thanks to the hotel staff for making our experience the best experience in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “FOUND CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: eastdallas
Reviews.Content: What a surprise! This hotel is located in the CENTER of convenience; the beach, shopping, nightlife (gay & straight), super market across the street, bus line, freeway, airport and city culture (old and new San Juan). Our room was a garden suite. Being able to open the door, sit, and enjoy the quite pool was a plus. The entire staff - valet/front desk/pool/guest services made this HOTEL a 5 STAR. The Business Manner's of the staff is a "10"- Jose, Roberto, Gilberto, Margarita, Peter, Esther and Onyx. I cannot remember visiting a RESORT and remembering any of the STAFF'S names? Doubletree Hotel - this is a DIAMOND hotel and you should be proud of the service - great job everyone. TOM DALLAS TEXAS

Reviews.Title: “This was perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: midatlantictraveler1
Reviews.Content: Wow. This worked out so well for our 5-night trip to P.R. It has clean modern rooms and nice newly-renovated bathrooms. I have never seen so many different types of lighting (all controlled by separate switches around the room that you have to find). The Murphy bed was much more comfortable than I thought it would be. My wife liked the bathroom so much she wanted to take it home with her. :) The location isn't bad at all! It's 3-4 blocks to the Ocean Park balneario (public beach) and I'd say 6-7 blocks to the strip of Condado hotels/restaurants. You can catch the A-5 bus for 75 cents, right next to the hotel, follow it to the last stop and you'll be right in Old San Juan. Don't waste your money on a taxi for that. The 24-hour supermarket across the street is a fully-fledged grocery store... they have just about everything. Recommended restaurants nearby: Bebo's Cafe, La Patisserie (for their weekday breakfast specials). As previous reviewers have stated, head to Luquillo for a nice beach that's not far out of San Juan. Beaches to the west of town (e.g. Dorado) were nice too, but a little too silty (muddy) for my liking. My only gripes: Expensive parking, expensive but so-so hotel breakfast... BE AWARE of all service charges/taxes that will be added to your bill. Hilton discloses these (~25%) when you book, but some of the other sites may not, and you should take this into consideration. If you book somewhere else, they might hit you up for more $$ when you check out.

Reviews.Title: “Made our 4 yr. wedding anniversary unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: KristineCG
Reviews.Content: Jose Cepero, the hotel's manager, is the best there is in the industry! He and the staff made sure we were always happy and had everything we needed. Here's some info you may find useful in planning your trip: The GOODS: - hotel service (as everyone raves about in most other reviews!) - very clean, modern yet comfortable bed and room - 24 hr. supermarket is right across the street (has everything you might need including an endless supply of the traditional and local hard liquors!) - swimming pool and hot tub areas were very clean - public bus access is right outside of the hotel. (Be prepared: EACH person MUST have HIS/HER OWN EXACT bus fare - we didn't know this and my husband and I added our fares together. We held the bus up and were thankful that a small child had some extra change for us!) Bus ride is approx. 20 mins. to Old San Juan. It's a great way to see the everyday streets and meet the locals! - variety of restaurants on-site. We found them very-reasonably priced and very good! - a short 5 min. walk to Bebo's Cafe - where the locals eat! Try some authentic Puerto Rican dishes for great prices! (approx. $5-8/dish). AWESOME food!!! Be ready to speak your best spanish as many of the waitresses/waiters don't speak english :) Totally worth it!!! - 10-15 min. walk to Ocean Park beach. Beautiful, wide open beach, light sands... it was just so relaxing wading and floating around to the rhythym of the ocean waves. Bring bottled water with us and if you forget, don't fret - local men wearing bags that keep drinks (local beer!!) icy cold sell their beer for $3 each. Nothing beat the sun sizzling our skin and the icy, cold beer running through our bodies! Also, other local people walk along the vast Ocean Park beach selling hot, fried local foods for cheap and also their yummy, refreshing ice cream!! - we were lucky enough to have a room on the bottom floor, with a sliding door that led out to our own patio which then led to the hot tub/ swimming pool area! It was an absolute treat!!! It was so clean, beautiful, relaxing and how can we complain about our access to the pool!!! Our last night there, while my husband and I enjoyed our wine, compliments of the hotel as our anniversary gift, we spent our time hot tubbing and meeting people from all over the world! It was our own little party just 30 steps away from our hotel room's patio! It was great! The NOT-SO-GOODS: - taxi ride was approx. $15-$18 to OSJ (Old San Juan) so my husband and I had to plan our trips to OSJ carefully. For example, we thought twice about having dinner in OSJ because going there and back in the evening would cost us $30 for a taxi ride. BUT if we spent our day in OSJ and took the bux there, then we'd only spend $15 for the night taxi ride back to the hotel as we preferred not to take the bus at night. - you may have to wait close to 30 min. for a bus ride from OSJ back to the hotel in the middle of the day (like we had to). We weren't in a rush but waiting that long was a little annoying. Maybe try to find a bus schedule?? I consider myself organized, but I wasn't THAT prepared... - no nightlife at the hotel - this could be a good thing or a bad thing, depending on what you're looking for. If you want to dance, gamble at a casino, etc, you'll have to taxi or bus to other nearby hotels. Overall, the staff and the service made up for the distance to other places around the city. Since the taxi rides weren't that expensive and public transportation was a stone's throw away, we couldn't complain. The hotel's manager, Jose C., helped made our wedding anniversary one to remember! He gave us everything we asked for and we're so glad we made the decision to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: NatashaMoh
Reviews.Content: I had to be in Puerto Rico for a wedding in October. After researching and reading reviews, decided to stay at this hotel. What a wise decision!!! The hotel is lovely! Clean, well situated, an extremely comfortable bed and service that I have not experienced anywhere else in the world. We started off as a party of 3 in 2 rooms, when the others in our party came to drop us off and saw our accommodations, they immediately cancelled theirs and booked 2 extra rooms. The Front Desk staff did this with efficiency and a smile. And a fantastically low rate, which made it even more appealing. I won't even talk about the delicious warm cookies and friendly smiles and hellos everyday from everyone. Or the two sets of bathroom amenities sent to my room when I called housekeeping for 1 item. I want to thank everyone but some names escape me. The ones I remember are Antonia, Grisel and Juan. Thank you everyone.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful experience due to the GreaT staff!”
Reviews.Author: LolaJenknz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree for two nights and had an absolutely wonderful experience. I stay in hotels multiple times a month and would easily say that the people who work at this hotel are the most friendly and helpful staff that I have ever met. Everyone (especially Peter, Juan, Diana, and Margie at the front desk) continually went out of their way to make us feel welcome! Our room was beautiful - very spacious and well decorated. The hotel is located in a nice location; walking distance from the ocean, art museum, and a variety of restaurants. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, accomodating, clean, great price and in Condado”
Reviews.Author: TXGirlinKY
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Doubletree by Hilton were great! We were here on a 9 day working trip and we could not have ask for better service , friendliness, or a cleaner, more comfortable hotel for the price. Great staff include: Peter, Wanda, Miguel, and Jdlanna

Reviews.Title: “Great choice, great price.”
Reviews.Author: DCPattersons
Reviews.Content: After scoring such a great deal on Travelocity, we couldn't have guessed that this hotel would have been as wonderful as it was. The newly renovated rooms are very clean and wonderfully appointed (w/ fridge and microwave), our breakfasts at Michaels and Under the Trees (both on the property) were on point and reasonably priced, and most importantly, the hospitality of the staff (especially Yodil, Peter, and Miguel) was comforting and delightful. It's approx a 3 block walk to the more quiet "locals" beach and 4-5 to the main strip of resorts and casinos. For us it was not worth the $300-450 more to stay on the typical resorty main strip (note that most "resorts" on the strip seemed older and much less contemporary than this hotel). Pool was small but clean and while families were there, it was certainly not overrun with kids like others. Ask for Yodil Caban, the General Manager, and he will make sure that your stay is outstanding. These folks don't just talk the customer service game, they live it.
