As they told us, the smaller size of the hotel allows them to be more personally attentive. It's a $0.75 bus ride to Old San Juan or a quick $12 cab ride at night (note that cabs are more expensive at night so it was probably cheaper during the day). If you're in Old San Juan and want a great dinner in a posh, elegant space, check out Marmalade. Expect at least $40-50 per person, but the chef clearly knows and loves great cuisine (note: this is not local Puerto Rican food, but delish nonetheless). Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Upped by the renovations, downed by the service”
Reviews.Author: prjoe05
Reviews.Content: The former "Hotel Pierre" has been beautifully renovated, with elegant colors and modern decorations. It is very clean and looks like new. It is part of the "Gallery Plaza" complex, which includes the hotel and a new residential and commercial building. The restaurant is very attractive to the eye. The staff, once you can talk to one, are courteous and friendly. The rooms are clean and comfortable (I liked the bathroom frosted-glass decoration), although on the small side, and they have their own microwave and mini-refrigerator. There is a supermarket across the street, where you can get anything that you may have left home. However, the much-advertised "CARELINE", Doubletree's trademarked name for their telephone concierge service, is never answered. I also called the front desk several times and I could not get an answer. At some point, I had the impression that all the employees had walked out and left us guests completely alone. In addition, Room Service was not available, even though it was advertised. For me, this was a big deal, so it was a hassle to walk to nearby restaurants to buy food. The wireless internet service is free, but we had a hard time keeping a good and steady connection. Finally, the self-parking facility ($16 per day) is the parking corresponding to the nearby Gallery Plaza tower, so you won't have easy access to your car. If this hotel can correct these flaws while keeping the prices, it will become extremely popular for cruise passengers and business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “best kept secret in san juan”
Reviews.Author: atlsunshine123
Reviews.Content: from the time i checked in, nothing but the best service. although the hotel doesn't have a casino or is not on the beach, the service, hotel staff, amenities, and the value more than makes up for it. the staff were extremely friendly, courteous, and attentive. the rooms are hip yet comfortable and well kept. if there was anything we needed, like a cab, directions to a attraction, a toothbrush, or even a sewing kit; they made sure to get it for us. Shouts out to the best staff, especially the Peter, Wanda, Carlos, Elezar, and Primo. (by the way ladies, the male staff here are sexy and muy caliente!) we had friends that stayed in a " top notch" hotel but when they visited us at the hotel they said they wished they booked here instead. The staff, free breakfast, and amenties won them over.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jujucivil
Reviews.Content: I knew from the other reviews that my stay here would be a good idea and I was right. We checked in around 2 PM and it was smoother than I expected since we arrived earlier than the 3 PM check in. Margarita greeted us with a smile and a warm cookie and she was awesome! We requested a larger room and she took care of our request immediately. Antonio was awesome in giving us the best spots to eat and visit. He was our "GPS on feet". Gilberto was another person that I cannot forget to mention. He's a breathe of fresh air....very polite. Overall this hotel is comfortable with great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Clean rooms and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: joshonki
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night before we went to Vieques, we chose the Doubletree because of the reviews on this site and the value. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was small, but very nicely appointed and clean; a most effective use of the space. The courtyard pool and whirlpool looked amazing, but it was raining, so we didn't go in. When we come back to San Juan, this is on the top of my list for places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: IslandHoping
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. Very contemporary. The staff is wonderful. They are helpful, knowledgable and pleasant. They gym was excellent. The pool and spa open 24 hours. Very clean hotel!!!! A 24 hr grocery store across the street. Art museum a 5 min walk. The bristro in the hotel was expensive for the quality. Under the Trees across the lot was a great atmosphere and a good value for the quality. Very close the airport and the cruise ports. Tours booked through the hotel were fantastic. We told them what we wanted they did everything, we just showed up in the lobby at the time they told us. I would stay here again as a family vacation or just as a get away for two. Oh and the warm chocolate chip cookies are great at check in.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of Follow Up”
Reviews.Author: CarlosMCardona
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel since year 2002; I stayed here for business purposes at least six to eight times per year (four days minimum, each stay) As a guest, I supported the entire remodeling of the hotel that took more than two years because the excellent location and great customer service at the front desk that made me feel like at home. When the hotel become Hilton (End of year 2008) I stayed until todayâ€™s date four times and I can confirm the reservations process doesn't work good or better said it is not the same as it was in the past. For my last stay I called five times the past week from the states to the Hotel in Puerto Rico to make the reservations and after greeting the person who answered the phone he transfer the call to reservations. Them put me on hold, and after long waiting (more than five minutes), I hung-up and called back again and again. I thought that they were very busy that day and called back the day after and the waiting was the same, so I called back and inform the person who answered the phone what was going on and she transferred my call to the Hilton reservations center in the US, where I finally booked my reservations. Because I felt loyal to the hotel I called back to Puerto Rico asking for the general Manager Mr. Yodil to inform him what was happening, and after confirming that he was at the office I requested one of his assistants to transfer my call to him. He didn't take the call, I called back him twice presuming to speak with him and left a voice message asking for a call back, and he never did. When I checked in on, September 14th, 2009 I asked for him to inform about this but again he IGNORED me. This is the reason why I am writing this review. In general I am satisfied with the hotel, specially I like the location and the front desk customer service is outstanding; but as a person, I donâ€™t feel good when the Manager ignores me not one but more than four times. I will do my research to find a hotel close to this area to switch for next stays and I really recommend the travelers to test the reservation process calling to [--]

Reviews.Title: “It was an excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: niom-k
Reviews.Content: Went with my husband for the first 2 nights of our honeymoon. It was an excellent choice. Our check-in was late after the wedding and we had no trouble with the process. Front desk clerk was actually waiting for us. Quick check-in, no hassle. The room was in excellent cleanliness state. Very comfortable. Only thing we thought was that refrigerator would be stocked and it was not. No biggie. Supermarket across the street very handy. Little misshap with the keycard and it was fixed very quickly. Staff very friendly. We didnâ€™t go to pool or restaurants but they looked in good condition. Check out was as quick and easy as check-in. Overall, we loved our stay and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Yonguk_traveller
Reviews.Content: Hard to fault the DoubleTree, plus we had a bonus of getting a good internet deal on the rates. Whilst it's not located right on the beach like some of the more resortier hotels, its only a few minutes walk away, there is easy access to the old town and there are some great restaurants within easy walking distance. Staff are friendly and helpful, the hotel is clean and the service is good. Only downside is the extra charge for parking on site. Overall, well worth your money for San Juan

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tropicsgirl101
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room at another hotel and were transferred here upon arrival due to the other hotel being overbooked. I was unhappy about this, but the staff here were very accomodating and friendly and the hotel was very clean. The rooms were typical hotel rooms, nothing fancy. They give you warm cookies at checkin which was nice. The pool is on the small side. There is a grocery store directly across the street which was convenient for buying supplies.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel! You should stay here!”
Reviews.Author: indyfan99
Reviews.Content: This was just an amazing hotel! Very clean not incredibly spacious but great for sleeping! We were a little but scared of staying in a room with a Murphy bed but the bed was very big and comfortable!! as was the other bed in the room.Staff was very friendly and said hi whenever you passed them in the hallways, the lobby, or down by the pool. Very nice workout facility and gorgeous pool and jacuzzi! I would recommend this hotel for anyone staying in puerto rico. Pretty close to the beach to! Only about 3 blocks. However I would probably not recommend this hotel for kids bc theres not a lot to keep them entertained in condado. Make sure to visit the market across the street and fill your in room fridge up to save yourself some money. This is more of a business traveler hotel but was great for our vacation stay. Internet is free and fast! Theres also a computer room with several computers. Overall a great experience!! whether for business or for pleasure. Would definitely stay here again but longer next time! :)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience!”
Reviews.Author: m_broussard
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very modern, clean & conveniently located but it is the staff that sets this place apart. Peter @ the front desk excelled in making you feel welcome & special & was a dream @ setting up just the right tours. I highly recommend the rainforest & beach tour. The views were breathtaking. We are already planning our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: lasfloresdrive
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable room, great bed and shower, friendly and responsive staff. There is a huge 24-hour supermarket across the street and the beach is a short 3 block walk.
